translations.hebrew: <big>מִ֭</big>שְׁלֵי שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בֶן־דָּוִ֑ד מֶ֝֗לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english: The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:

translations.hebrew: לָדַ֣עַת חׇכְמָ֣ה וּמוּסָ֑ר לְ֝הָבִ֗ין אִמְרֵ֥י בִינָֽה׃
translations.english:
For learning wisdom and discipline;
For understanding words of discernment;

translations.hebrew: לָ֭קַחַת מוּסַ֣ר הַשְׂכֵּ֑ל צֶ֥דֶק וּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט וּמֵשָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
For acquiring the discipline for success,
Righteousness, justice, and equity;

translations.hebrew: לָתֵ֣ת לִפְתָאיִ֣ם עׇרְמָ֑ה לְ֝נַ֗עַר דַּ֣עַת וּמְזִמָּֽה׃
translations.english:
For endowing the simple with shrewdness,
The young with knowledge and foresight.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁמַ֣ע חָ֭כָם וְי֣וֹסֶף לֶ֑קַח וְ֝נָב֗וֹן תַּחְבֻּל֥וֹת יִקְנֶֽה׃
translations.english:
—The wise man, hearing them, will gain more wisdom;
The discerning man will learn to be adroit;

translations.hebrew: לְהָבִ֣ין מָ֭שָׁל וּמְלִיצָ֑ה דִּבְרֵ֥י חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים וְחִידֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
For understanding proverb and epigram,
The words of the wise and their riddles.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה רֵאשִׁ֣ית דָּ֑עַת חׇכְמָ֥ה וּ֝מוּסָ֗ר אֱוִילִ֥ים בָּֽזוּ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
The fear of the LORD is the beginningaOr “best part.” of knowledge;
Fools despise wisdom and discipline.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע בְּ֭נִי מוּסַ֣ר אָבִ֑יךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝טֹּ֗שׁ תּוֹרַ֥ת אִמֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My son, heed the discipline of your father,
And do not forsake the instruction of your mother;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לִוְיַ֤ת חֵ֓ן הֵ֬ם לְרֹאשֶׁ֑ךָ וַ֝עֲנָקִ֗ים לְגַרְגְּרֹתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
For they are a graceful wreath upon your head,
A necklace about your throat.

translations.hebrew: בְּנִ֡י אִם־יְפַתּ֥וּךָ חַ֝טָּאִ֗ים אַל־תֹּבֵֽא׃
translations.english: My son, if sinners entice you, do not yield;

translations.hebrew: אִם־יֹאמְרוּ֮ לְכָ֢ה אִ֫תָּ֥נוּ נֶאֶרְבָ֥ה לְדָ֑ם נִצְפְּנָ֖ה לְנָקִ֣י חִנָּֽם׃
translations.english:
If they say, “Come with us,
Let us set an ambush to shed blood,
Let us lie in wait for the innocent
(Without cause!)

translations.hebrew: נִ֭בְלָעֵם כִּשְׁא֣וֹל חַיִּ֑ים וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים כְּי֣וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Like Sheol, let us swallow them alive;
Whole, like those who go down into the Pit.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־ה֣וֹן יָקָ֣ר נִמְצָ֑א נְמַלֵּ֖א בָתֵּ֣ינוּ שָׁלָֽל׃
translations.english:
We shall obtain every precious treasure;
We shall fill our homes with loot.

translations.hebrew: גּ֭וֹרָ֣לְךָ תַּפִּ֣יל בְּתוֹכֵ֑נוּ כִּ֥יס אֶ֝חָ֗ד יִהְיֶ֥ה לְכֻלָּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Throw in your lot with us;
We shall all have a common purse.”

translations.hebrew: בְּנִ֗י אַל־תֵּלֵ֣ךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אִתָּ֑ם מְנַ֥ע רַ֝גְלְךָ֗ מִנְּתִיבָתָֽם׃
translations.english:
My son, do not set out with them;
Keep your feet from their path.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י רַ֭גְלֵיהֶם לָרַ֣ע יָר֑וּצוּ וִ֝ימַהֲר֗וּ לִשְׁפׇּךְ־דָּֽם׃
translations.english:
For their feet run to evil;
They hurry to shed blood.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חִ֭נָּם מְזֹרָ֣ה הָרָ֑שֶׁת בְּ֝עֵינֵ֗י כׇּל־בַּ֥עַל כָּנָֽף׃
translations.english:
In the eyes of every winged creature
The outspread net means nothing.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭הֵם לְדָמָ֣ם יֶאֱרֹ֑בוּ יִ֝צְפְּנ֗וּ לְנַפְשֹׁתָֽם׃
translations.english:
But they lie in ambush for their own blood;
They lie in wait for their own lives.

translations.hebrew: כֵּ֗ן אׇ֭רְחוֹת כׇּל־בֹּ֣צֵֽעַ בָּ֑צַע אֶת־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בְּעָלָ֣יו יִקָּֽח׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Such is the fate of all who pursue unjust gain;
It takes the life of its possessor.

translations.hebrew: חׇ֭כְמוֹת בַּח֣וּץ תָּרֹ֑נָּה בָּ֝רְחֹב֗וֹת תִּתֵּ֥ן קוֹלָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
WisdombIn Proverbs, wisdom is personified as a woman. cries aloud in the streets,
Raises her voice in the squares.

translations.hebrew: בְּרֹ֥אשׁ הֹמִיּ֗וֹת תִּ֫קְרָ֥א בְּפִתְחֵ֖י שְׁעָרִ֥ים בָּעִ֗יר אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ תֹאמֵֽר׃
translations.english:
At the head of the busy streets she calls;
At the entrance of the gates, in the city, she speaks out:

translations.hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֣י ׀ פְּתָיִם֮ תְּֽאֵהֲב֫וּ־פֶ֥תִי וְלֵצִ֗ים לָ֭צוֹן חָמְד֣וּ לָהֶ֑ם וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים יִשְׂנְאוּ־דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
“How long will you simple ones love simplicity,
You scoffers be eager to scoff,
You dullards hate knowledge?

translations.hebrew: תָּשׁ֗וּבוּ לְֽת֫וֹכַחְתִּ֥י הִנֵּ֤ה אַבִּ֣יעָה לָכֶ֣ם רוּחִ֑י אוֹדִ֖יעָה דְבָרַ֣י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
You are indifferent to my rebuke;
I will now speak my mind to you,
And let you know my thoughts.

translations.hebrew: יַ֣עַן קָ֭רָאתִי וַתְּמָאֵ֑נוּ נָטִ֥יתִי יָ֝דִ֗י וְאֵ֣ין מַקְשִֽׁיב׃
translations.english:
Since you refused me when I called,
And paid no heed when I extended my hand,

translations.hebrew: וַתִּפְרְע֥וּ כׇל־עֲצָתִ֑י וְ֝תוֹכַחְתִּ֗י לֹ֣א אֲבִיתֶֽם׃
translations.english:
You spurned all my advice,
And would not hear my rebuke,

translations.hebrew: גַּם־אֲ֭נִי בְּאֵידְכֶ֣ם אֶשְׂחָ֑ק אֶ֝לְעַ֗ג בְּבֹ֣א פַחְדְּכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
I will laugh at your calamity,
And mock when terror comes upon you,

translations.hebrew: בְּבֹ֤א (כשאוה) [כְשׁוֹאָ֨ה ׀] פַּחְדְּכֶ֗ם וְֽ֭אֵידְכֶם כְּסוּפָ֣ה יֶאֱתֶ֑ה בְּבֹ֥א עֲ֝לֵיכֶ֗ם צָרָ֥ה וְצוּקָֽה׃
translations.english:
When terror comes like a disaster,
And calamity arrives like a whirlwind,
When trouble and distress come upon you.

translations.hebrew: אָ֣ז יִ֭קְרָאֻנְנִי וְלֹ֣א אֶעֱנֶ֑ה יְ֝שַׁחֲרֻ֗נְנִי וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָאֻֽנְנִי׃
translations.english:
Then they shall call me but I will not answer;
They shall seek me but not find me.

translations.hebrew: תַּ֭חַת כִּֽי־שָׂ֣נְאוּ דָ֑עַת וְיִרְאַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לֹ֣א בָחָֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
Because they hated knowledge,
And did not choose fear of the LORD;

translations.hebrew: לֹא־אָב֥וּ לַעֲצָתִ֑י נָ֝אֲצ֗וּ כׇּל־תּוֹכַחְתִּֽי׃
translations.english:
They refused my advice,
And disdained all my rebukes,

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭יֹאכְלוּ מִפְּרִ֣י דַרְכָּ֑ם וּֽמִמֹּעֲצֹ֖תֵיהֶ֣ם יִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
They shall eat the fruit of their ways,
And have their fill of their own counsels.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י מְשׁוּבַ֣ת פְּתָיִ֣ם תַּהַרְגֵ֑ם וְשַׁלְוַ֖ת כְּסִילִ֣ים תְּאַבְּדֵֽם׃
translations.english:
The tranquillity of the simple will kill them,
And the complacency of dullards will destroy them.

translations.hebrew: וְשֹׁמֵ֣עַֽ לִ֭י יִשְׁכׇּן־בֶּ֑טַח וְ֝שַׁאֲנַ֗ן מִפַּ֥חַד רָעָֽה׃ {פ}
translations.english:
But he who listens to me will dwell in safety,
Untroubled by the terror of misfortune.”

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אִם־תִּקַּ֣ח אֲמָרָ֑י וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י תִּצְפֹּ֥ן אִתָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
My son, if you accept my words
And treasure up my commandments;

translations.hebrew: לְהַקְשִׁ֣יב לַחׇכְמָ֣ה אׇזְנֶ֑ךָ תַּטֶּ֥ה לִ֝בְּךָ֗ לַתְּבוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
If you make your ear attentive to wisdom
And your mind open to discernment;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אִ֣ם לַבִּינָ֣ה תִקְרָ֑א לַ֝תְּבוּנָ֗ה תִּתֵּ֥ן קוֹלֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
If you call to understanding
And cry aloud to discernment,

translations.hebrew: אִם־תְּבַקְשֶׁ֥נָּה כַכָּ֑סֶף וְֽכַמַּטְמוֹנִ֥ים תַּחְפְּשֶֽׂנָּה׃
translations.english:
If you seek it as you do silver
And search for it as for treasures,

translations.hebrew: אָ֗ז תָּ֭בִין יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת אֱלֹהִ֣ים תִּמְצָֽא׃
translations.english:
Then you will understand the fear of the LORD
And attain knowledge of God.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יְ֭הֹוָה יִתֵּ֣ן חׇכְמָ֑ה מִ֝פִּ֗יו דַּ֣עַת וּתְבוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
For the LORD grants wisdom;
Knowledge and discernment are by His decree.

translations.hebrew: (וצפן) [יִצְפֹּ֣ן] לַ֭יְשָׁרִים תּוּשִׁיָּ֑ה מָ֝גֵ֗ן לְהֹ֣לְכֵי תֹֽם׃
translations.english:
He reserves ability for the upright
And is a shield for those who live blamelessly,

translations.hebrew: לִ֭נְצֹר אׇרְח֣וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וְדֶ֖רֶךְ חֲסִידָ֣ו יִשְׁמֹֽר׃
translations.english:
Guarding the paths of justice,
Protecting the way of those loyal to Him.

translations.hebrew: אָ֗ז תָּ֭בִין צֶ֣דֶק וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝מֵישָׁרִ֗ים כׇּל־מַעְגַּל־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
You will then understand what is right, just,
And equitable—every good course.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־תָב֣וֹא חׇכְמָ֣ה בְלִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝דַ֗עַת לְֽנַפְשְׁךָ֥ יִנְעָֽם׃
translations.english:
For wisdom will enter your mind
And knowledge will delight you.

translations.hebrew: מְ֭זִמָּה תִּשְׁמֹ֥ר עָלֶ֗יךָ תְּבוּנָ֥ה תִנְצְרֶֽכָּה׃
translations.english:
Foresight will protect you,
And discernment will guard you.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭הַצִּ֣ילְךָ מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ רָ֑ע מֵ֝אִ֗ישׁ מְדַבֵּ֥ר תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
It will save you from the way of evil men,
From men who speak duplicity,

translations.hebrew: הַ֭עֹ֣זְבִים אׇרְח֣וֹת יֹ֑שֶׁר לָ֝לֶ֗כֶת בְּדַרְכֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
translations.english:
Who leave the paths of rectitude
To follow the ways of darkness,

translations.hebrew: הַ֭שְּׂמֵחִים לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת רָ֑ע יָ֝גִ֗ילוּ בְּֽתַהְפֻּכ֥וֹת רָֽע׃
translations.english:
Who rejoice in doing evil
And exult in the duplicity of evil men,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר אׇרְחֹתֵיהֶ֣ם עִקְּשִׁ֑ים וּ֝נְלוֹזִ֗ים בְּמַעְגְּלוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
Men whose paths are crooked
And who are devious in their course.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭הַצִּ֣ילְךָ מֵאִשָּׁ֣ה זָרָ֑ה מִ֝נׇּכְרִיָּ֗ה אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ הֶחֱלִֽיקָה׃
translations.english:
It will save you from the forbiddenaLit. “strange.” woman,
From the alien woman whose talk is smooth,

translations.hebrew: הַ֭עֹזֶבֶת אַלּ֣וּף נְעוּרֶ֑יהָ וְאֶת־בְּרִ֖ית אֱלֹהֶ֣יהָ שָׁכֵֽחָה׃
translations.english:
Who forsakes the companion of her youth
And disregards the covenant of her God.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֣חָה אֶל־מָ֣וֶת בֵּיתָ֑הּ וְאֶל־רְ֝פָאִ֗ים מַעְגְּלֹתֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
Her house sinks down to Death,
And her course leads to the shades.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־בָּ֭אֶיהָ לֹ֣א יְשׁוּב֑וּן וְלֹֽא־יַ֝שִּׂ֗יגוּ אׇרְח֥וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
All who go to her cannot return
And find again the paths of life.

translations.hebrew: לְמַ֗עַן תֵּ֭לֵךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ טוֹבִ֑ים וְאׇרְח֖וֹת צַדִּיקִ֣ים תִּשְׁמֹֽר׃
translations.english:
So follow the way of the good
And keep to the paths of the just.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יְשָׁרִ֥ים יִשְׁכְּנוּ־אָ֑רֶץ וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים יִוָּ֥תְרוּ בָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
For the upright will inhabit the earth,
The blameless will remain in it.

translations.hebrew: וּ֭רְשָׁעִים מֵאֶ֣רֶץ יִכָּרֵ֑תוּ וּ֝בוֹגְדִ֗ים יִסְּח֥וּ מִמֶּֽנָּה׃ {פ}
translations.english:
While the wicked will vanish from the land
And the treacherous will be rooted out of it.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי תּוֹרָתִ֣י אַל־תִּשְׁכָּ֑ח וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י יִצֹּ֥ר לִבֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My son, do not forget my teaching,
But let your mind retain my commandments;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים וּשְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּ֑ים וְ֝שָׁל֗וֹם יוֹסִ֥יפוּ לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For they will bestow on you length of days,
Years of life and well-being.

translations.hebrew: חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֗ת אַֽל־יַ֫עַזְבֻ֥ךָ קׇשְׁרֵ֥ם עַל־גַּרְגְּרוֹתֶ֑יךָ כׇּ֝תְבֵ֗ם עַל־ל֥וּחַ לִבֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Let fidelity and steadfastness not leave you;
Bind them about your throat,
Write them on the tablet of your mind,

translations.hebrew: וּמְצָא־חֵ֥ן וְשֵֽׂכֶל־ט֑וֹב בְּעֵינֵ֖י אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
And you will find favor and approbation
In the eyes of God and man.

translations.hebrew: בְּטַ֣ח אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְאֶל־בִּ֥֝ינָתְךָ֗ אַל־תִּשָּׁעֵֽן׃
translations.english:
Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
And do not rely on your own understanding.

translations.hebrew: בְּכׇל־דְּרָכֶ֥יךָ דָעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝ה֗וּא יְיַשֵּׁ֥ר אֹֽרְחֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
In all your ways acknowledge Him,
And He will make your paths smooth.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֣י חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ יְרָ֥א אֶת־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃
translations.english:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
Fear the LORD and shun evil.

translations.hebrew: רִ֭פְאוּת תְּהִ֣י לְשׇׁרֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝שִׁקּ֗וּי לְעַצְמוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
It will be a cure for your body,aLit. “navel.”
A tonic for your bones.

translations.hebrew: כַּבֵּ֣ד אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה מֵהוֹנֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מֵרֵאשִׁ֗ית כׇּל־תְּבוּאָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Honor the LORD with your wealth,
With the best of all your income,

translations.hebrew: וְיִמָּלְא֣וּ אֲסָמֶ֣יךָ שָׂבָ֑ע וְ֝תִיר֗וֹשׁ יְקָבֶ֥יךָ יִפְרֹֽצוּ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
And your barns will be filled with grain,
Your vats will burst with new wine.

translations.hebrew: מוּסַ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה בְּנִ֣י אַל־תִּמְאָ֑ס וְאַל־תָּ֝קֹ֗ץ בְּתוֹכַחְתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Do not reject the discipline of the LORD, my son;
Do not abhor His rebuke.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶ֥ת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶאֱהַ֣ב יְהֹוָ֣ה יוֹכִ֑יחַ וּ֝כְאָ֗ב אֶת־בֵּ֥ן יִרְצֶֽה׃
translations.english:
For whom the LORD loves, He rebukes,
As a father the son whom he favors.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם מָצָ֣א חׇכְמָ֑ה וְ֝אָדָ֗ם יָפִ֥יק תְּבוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man who finds wisdom,
The man who attains understanding.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ט֣וֹב סַ֭חְרָהּ מִסְּחַר־כָּ֑סֶף וּ֝מֵחָר֗וּץ תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Her value in trade is better than silver,
Her yield, greater than gold.

translations.hebrew: יְקָ֣רָה הִ֭יא (מפניים) [מִפְּנִינִ֑ים] וְכׇל־חֲ֝פָצֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א יִֽשְׁווּ־בָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
She is more precious than rubies;
All of your goods cannot equal her.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים בִּֽימִינָ֑הּ בִּ֝שְׂמֹאולָ֗הּ עֹ֣שֶׁר וְכָבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
In her right hand is length of days,
In her left, riches and honor.

translations.hebrew: דְּרָכֶ֥יהָ דַרְכֵי־נֹ֑עַם וְֽכׇל־נְתִ֖יבוֹתֶ֣יהָ שָׁלֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Her ways are pleasant ways,
And all her paths, peaceful.

translations.hebrew: עֵץ־חַיִּ֣ים הִ֭יא לַמַּחֲזִיקִ֣ים בָּ֑הּ וְֽתֹמְכֶ֥יהָ מְאֻשָּֽׁר׃ {פ}
translations.english:
She is a tree of life to those who grasp her,
And whoever holds on to her is happy.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בְּחׇכְמָ֥ה יָסַד־אָ֑רֶץ כּוֹנֵ֥ן שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם בִּתְבוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
The LORD founded the earth by wisdom;
He established the heavens by understanding;

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭דַעְתּוֹ תְּהוֹמ֣וֹת נִבְקָ֑עוּ וּ֝שְׁחָקִ֗ים יִרְעֲפוּ־טָֽל׃
translations.english:
By His knowledge the depths burst apart,
And the skies distilled dew.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אַל־יָלֻ֣זוּ מֵעֵינֶ֑יךָ נְצֹ֥ר תֻּ֝שִׁיָּ֗ה וּמְזִמָּֽה׃
translations.english:
My son, do not lose sight of them;
Hold on to resourcefulness and foresight.

translations.hebrew: וְיִֽהְי֣וּ חַיִּ֣ים לְנַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְ֝חֵ֗ן לְגַרְגְּרֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
They will give life to your spirit
And grace to your throat.

translations.hebrew: אָ֤ז תֵּלֵ֣ךְ לָבֶ֣טַח דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝רַגְלְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִגּֽוֹף׃
translations.english:
Then you will go your way safely
And not injure your feet.

translations.hebrew: אִם־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ב לֹֽא־תִפְחָ֑ד וְ֝שָׁכַבְתָּ֗ וְֽעָרְבָ֥ה שְׁנָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
When you lie down you will be unafraid;
You will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭ירָא מִפַּ֣חַד פִּתְאֹ֑ם וּמִשֹּׁאַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים כִּ֣י תָבֹֽא׃
translations.english:
You will not fear sudden terror
Or the disaster that comes upon the wicked,

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יְ֭הֹוָה יִֽהְיֶ֣ה בְכִסְלֶ֑ךָ וְשָׁמַ֖ר רַגְלְךָ֣ מִלָּֽכֶד׃
translations.english:
For the LORD will be your trust;
He will keep your feet from being caught.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּמְנַע־ט֥וֹב מִבְּעָלָ֑יו בִּֽהְי֨וֹת לְאֵ֖ל (ידיך) [יָדְךָ֣] לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
translations.english:
Do not withhold good from one who
deserves it
When you have the power to do it [for him].

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֹּ֘אמַ֤ר (לרעיך) [לְרֵעֲךָ֨ ׀] לֵ֣ךְ וָ֭שׁוּב וּמָחָ֥ר אֶתֵּ֗ן וְיֵ֣שׁ אִתָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Do not say to your fellow, “Come back again;
I’ll give it to you tomorrow,” when you have it with you.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּחֲרֹ֣שׁ עַל־רֵעֲךָ֣ רָעָ֑ה וְהֽוּא־יוֹשֵׁ֖ב לָבֶ֣טַח אִתָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Do not devise harm against your fellow
Who lives trustfully with you.

translations.hebrew: אַל־[תָּרִ֣יב] (תרוב) עִם־אָדָ֣ם חִנָּ֑ם אִם־לֹ֖א גְמָלְךָ֣ רָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Do not quarrel with a man for no cause,
When he has done you no harm.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תְּ֭קַנֵּא בְּאִ֣ישׁ חָמָ֑ס וְאַל־תִּ֝בְחַ֗ר בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Do not envy a lawless man,
Or choose any of his ways;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י תוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה נָל֑וֹז וְֽאֶת־יְשָׁרִ֥ים סוֹדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For the devious man is an abomination to the LORD,
But He is intimate with the straightforward.

translations.hebrew: מְאֵרַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה בְּבֵ֣ית רָשָׁ֑ע וּנְוֵ֖ה צַדִּיקִ֣ים יְבָרֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked,
But He blesses the abode of the righteous.

translations.hebrew: אִם־לַלֵּצִ֥ים הֽוּא־יָלִ֑יץ (ולעניים) [וְ֝לַעֲנָוִ֗ים] יִתֶּן־חֵֽן׃
translations.english:
At scoffers He scoffs,
But to the lowly He shows grace.

translations.hebrew: כָּ֭בוֹד חֲכָמִ֣ים יִנְחָ֑לוּ וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים מֵרִ֥ים קָלֽוֹן׃ {פ}
translations.english:
The wise shall obtain honor,
But dullards get disgrace as their portion.

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ בָ֭נִים מ֣וּסַר אָ֑ב וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבוּ לָדַ֥עַת בִּינָֽה׃
translations.english:
Sons, heed the discipline of a father;
Listen and learn discernment,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֶ֣קַח ט֭וֹב נָתַ֣תִּי לָכֶ֑ם תּ֝וֹרָתִ֗י אַֽל־תַּעֲזֹֽבוּ׃
translations.english:
For I give you good instruction;
Do not forsake my teaching.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־בֵ֭ן הָיִ֣יתִי לְאָבִ֑י רַ֥ךְ וְ֝יָחִ֗יד לִפְנֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Once I was a son to my father,
The tender darling of my mother.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּרֵ֗נִי וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לִ֗י יִֽתְמׇךְ־דְּבָרַ֥י לִבֶּ֑ךָ שְׁמֹ֖ר מִצְוֺתַ֣י וֶחְיֵֽה׃
translations.english:
He instructed me and said to me,
“Let your mind hold on to my words;
Keep my commandments and you will live.

translations.hebrew: קְנֵ֣ה חׇ֭כְמָה קְנֵ֣ה בִינָ֑ה אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח וְאַל־תֵּ֝֗ט מֵאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
translations.english:
Acquire wisdom, acquire discernment;
Do not forget and do not swerve from my words.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּעַזְבֶ֥הָ וְתִשְׁמְרֶ֑ךָּ אֱהָבֶ֥הָ וְתִצְּרֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Do not forsake her and she will guard you;
Love her and she will protect you.

translations.hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֣ית חׇ֭כְמָה קְנֵ֣ה חׇכְמָ֑ה וּבְכׇל־קִ֝נְיָנְךָ֗ קְנֵ֣ה בִינָֽה׃
translations.english:
The beginningaOr “best part.” of wisdom is—acquire wisdom;
With all your acquisitions, acquire discernment.

translations.hebrew: סַלְסְלֶ֥הָ וּֽתְרוֹמְמֶ֑ךָּ תְּ֝כַבֵּ֗דְךָ כִּ֣י תְחַבְּקֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
Hug her to you and she will exalt you;
She will bring you honor if you embrace her.

translations.hebrew: תִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭רֹאשְׁךָ לִוְיַת־חֵ֑ן עֲטֶ֖רֶת תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת תְּמַגְּנֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
She will adorn your head with a graceful wreath;
Crown you with a glorious diadem.”

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע בְּ֭נִי וְקַ֣ח אֲמָרָ֑י וְיִרְבּ֥וּ לְ֝ךָ֗ שְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
My son, heed and take in my words,
And you will have many years of life.

translations.hebrew: בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ חׇ֭כְמָה הֹרֵיתִ֑יךָ הִ֝דְרַכְתִּ֗יךָ בְּמַעְגְּלֵי־יֹֽשֶׁר׃
translations.english:
I instruct you in the way of wisdom;
I guide you in straight courses.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽ֭לֶכְתְּךָ לֹא־יֵצַ֣ר צַעֲדֶ֑ךָ וְאִם־תָּ֝ר֗וּץ לֹ֣א תִכָּשֵֽׁל׃
translations.english:
You will walk without breaking stride;
When you run, you will not stumble.

translations.hebrew: הַחֲזֵ֣ק בַּמּוּסָ֣ר אַל־תֶּ֑רֶף נִ֝צְּרֶ֗הָ כִּי־הִ֥יא חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Hold fast to discipline; do not let go;
Keep it; it is your life.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֹ֣רַח רְ֭שָׁעִים אַל־תָּבֹ֑א וְאַל־תְּ֝אַשֵּׁ֗ר בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ רָעִֽים׃
translations.english:
Do not enter on the path of the wicked;
Do not walk on the way of evil men.

translations.hebrew: פְּרָעֵ֥הוּ אַל־תַּעֲבׇר־בּ֑וֹ שְׂטֵ֖ה מֵעָלָ֣יו וַעֲבֹֽר׃
translations.english:
Avoid it; do not pass through it;
Turn away from it; pass it by.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א יִֽ֭שְׁנוּ אִם־לֹ֣א יָרֵ֑עוּ וְֽנִגְזְלָ֥ה שְׁ֝נָתָ֗ם אִם־לֹ֥א (יכשולו) [יַכְשִֽׁילוּ]׃
translations.english:
For they cannot sleep unless they have done evil;
Unless they make someone fall they are robbed of sleep.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י לָ֭חֲמוּ לֶ֣חֶם רֶ֑שַׁע וְיֵ֖ין חֲמָסִ֣ים יִשְׁתּֽוּ׃
translations.english:
They eat the bread of wickedness
And drink the wine of lawlessness.

translations.hebrew: וְאֹ֣רַח צַ֭דִּיקִים כְּא֣וֹר נֹ֑גַהּ הוֹלֵ֥ךְ וָ֝א֗וֹר עַד־נְכ֥וֹן הַיּֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
The path of the righteous is like radiant sunlight,
Ever brightening until noon.

translations.hebrew: דֶּ֣רֶךְ רְ֭שָׁעִים כָּאֲפֵלָ֑ה לֹ֥א יָ֝דְע֗וּ בַּמֶּ֥ה יִכָּשֵֽׁלוּ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
The way of the wicked is all darkness;
They do not know what will make them stumble.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי לִדְבָרַ֣י הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה לַ֝אֲמָרַ֗י הַט־אׇזְנֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My son, listen to my speech;
Incline your ear to my words.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יַלִּ֥יזוּ מֵעֵינֶ֑יךָ שׇׁ֝מְרֵ֗ם בְּת֣וֹךְ לְבָבֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Do not lose sight of them;
Keep them in your mind.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חַיִּ֣ים הֵ֭ם לְמֹצְאֵיהֶ֑ם וּֽלְכׇל־בְּשָׂר֥וֹ מַרְפֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
They are life to him who finds them,
Healing for his whole body.

translations.hebrew: מִֽכׇּל־מִ֭שְׁמָר נְצֹ֣ר לִבֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ תּוֹצְא֥וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
More than all that you guard, guard your mind,
For it is the source of life.

translations.hebrew: הָסֵ֣ר מִ֭מְּךָ עִקְּשׁ֣וּת פֶּ֑ה וּלְז֥וּת שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם הַרְחֵ֥ק מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Put crooked speech away from you;
Keep devious talk far from you.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֭ינֶיךָ לְנֹ֣כַח יַבִּ֑יטוּ וְ֝עַפְעַפֶּ֗יךָ יַיְשִׁ֥רוּ נֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Let your eyes look forward,
Your gaze be straight ahead.

translations.hebrew: פַּ֭לֵּס מַעְגַּ֣ל רַגְלֶ֑ךָ וְֽכׇל־דְּרָכֶ֥יךָ יִכֹּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Survey the course you take,
And all your ways will prosper.

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־תֵּט־יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול הָסֵ֖ר רַגְלְךָ֣ מֵרָֽע׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Do not swerve to the right or the left;
Keep your feet from evil.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי לְחׇכְמָתִ֣י הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה לִ֝תְבוּנָתִ֗י הַט־אׇזְנֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My son, listen to my wisdom;
Incline your ear to my insight,

translations.hebrew: לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מְזִמּ֑וֹת וְ֝דַ֗עַת שְׂפָתֶ֥יךָ יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
That you may have foresight,
While your lips hold fast to knowledge.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י נֹ֣פֶת תִּ֭טֹּפְנָה שִׂפְתֵ֣י זָרָ֑ה וְחָלָ֖ק מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן חִכָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
For the lips of a forbiddenaLit. “strange.” woman drip honey;
Her mouth is smoother than oil;

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭אַחֲרִיתָהּ מָרָ֣ה כַֽלַּעֲנָ֑ה חַ֝דָּ֗ה כְּחֶ֣רֶב פִּיּֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood,
Sharp as a two-edged sword.

translations.hebrew: רַ֭גְלֶיהָ יֹרְד֣וֹת מָ֑וֶת שְׁ֝א֗וֹל צְעָדֶ֥יהָ יִתְמֹֽכוּ׃
translations.english:
Her feet go down to Death;
Her steps take hold of Sheol.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֣רַח חַ֭יִּים פֶּן־תְּפַלֵּ֑ס נָע֥וּ מַ֝עְגְּלֹתֶ֗יהָ לֹ֣א תֵדָֽע׃ {פ}
translations.english:
She does not chart a path of life;
Her course meanders for lack of knowledge.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְאַל־תָּ֝ס֗וּרוּ מֵאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
translations.english:
So now, sons, pay heed to me,
And do not swerve from the words of my mouth.

translations.hebrew: הַרְחֵ֣ק מֵעָלֶ֣יהָ דַרְכֶּ֑ךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝קְרַ֗ב אֶל־פֶּ֥תַח בֵּיתָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Keep yourself far away from her;
Do not come near the doorway of her house

translations.hebrew: פֶּן־תִּתֵּ֣ן לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים הוֹדֶ֑ךָ וּ֝שְׁנֹתֶ֗יךָ לְאַכְזָרִֽי׃
translations.english:
Lest you give up your vigor to others,
Your years to a ruthless one;

translations.hebrew: פֶּֽן־יִשְׂבְּע֣וּ זָרִ֣ים כֹּחֶ֑ךָ וַ֝עֲצָבֶ֗יךָ בְּבֵ֣ית נׇכְרִֽי׃
translations.english:
Lest strangers eat their fill of your strength,
And your toil be for the house of another;

translations.hebrew: וְנָהַמְתָּ֥ בְאַחֲרִיתֶ֑ךָ בִּכְל֥וֹת בְּ֝שָׂרְךָ֗ וּשְׁאֵרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
And in the end you roar,
When your flesh and body are consumed,

translations.hebrew: וְֽאָמַרְתָּ֗ אֵ֭יךְ שָׂנֵ֣אתִי מוּסָ֑ר וְ֝תוֹכַ֗חַת נָאַ֥ץ לִבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
And say,
“O how I hated discipline,
And heartily spurned rebuke.

translations.hebrew: וְֽלֹא־שָׁ֭מַעְתִּי בְּק֣וֹל מוֹרָ֑י וְ֝לִֽמְלַמְּדַ֗י לֹא־הִטִּ֥יתִי אׇזְנִֽי׃
translations.english:
I did not pay heed to my teachers,
Or incline my ear to my instructors.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭מְעַט הָיִ֣יתִי בְכׇל־רָ֑ע בְּת֖וֹךְ קָהָ֣ל וְעֵדָֽה׃
translations.english:
Soon I was in dire trouble
Amidst the assembled congregation.”

translations.hebrew: שְׁתֵה־מַ֥יִם מִבּוֹרֶ֑ךָ וְ֝נֹזְלִ֗ים מִתּ֥וֹךְ בְּאֵרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Drink water from your own cistern,
Running water from your own well.

translations.hebrew: יָפ֣וּצוּ מַעְיְנֹתֶ֣יךָ ח֑וּצָה בָּ֝רְחֹב֗וֹת פַּלְגֵי־מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
Your springs will gush forth
In streams in the public squares.

translations.hebrew: יִֽהְיוּ־לְךָ֥ לְבַדֶּ֑ךָ וְאֵ֖ין לְזָרִ֣ים אִתָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
They will be yours alone,
Others having no part with you.

translations.hebrew: יְהִֽי־מְקוֹרְךָ֥ בָר֑וּךְ וּ֝שְׂמַ֗ח מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת נְעוּרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Let your fountain be blessed;
Find joy in the wife of your youth—

translations.hebrew: אַיֶּ֥לֶת אֲהָבִ֗ים וְֽיַ֫עֲלַת־חֵ֥ן דַּ֭דֶּיהָ יְרַוֻּ֣ךָ בְכׇל־עֵ֑ת בְּ֝אַהֲבָתָ֗הּ תִּשְׁגֶּ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
A loving doe, a graceful mountain goat.
Let her breasts satisfy you at all times;
Be infatuated with love of her always.

translations.hebrew: וְלָ֤מָּה תִשְׁגֶּ֣ה בְנִ֣י בְזָרָ֑ה וּ֝תְחַבֵּ֗ק חֵ֣ק נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Why be infatuated, my son, with a forbiddenaLit. “strange.” woman?
Why clasp the bosom of an alien woman?

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י נֹ֨כַח ׀ עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְֽכׇל־מַעְגְּלֹתָ֥יו מְפַלֵּֽס׃
translations.english:
For a man’s ways are before the eyes of God;
He surveys his entire course.

translations.hebrew: עֲֽווֹנֹתָ֗יו יִלְכְּדֻנ֥וֹ אֶת־הָרָשָׁ֑ע וּבְחַבְלֵ֥י חַ֝טָּאת֗וֹ יִתָּמֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
The wicked man will be trapped in his iniquities;
He will be caught up in the ropes of his sin.

translations.hebrew: ה֗וּא יָ֭מוּת בְּאֵ֣ין מוּסָ֑ר וּבְרֹ֖ב אִוַּלְתּ֣וֹ יִשְׁגֶּֽה׃ {פ}
translations.english:
He will die for lack of discipline,
Infatuated by his great folly.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אִם־עָרַ֣בְתָּ לְרֵעֶ֑ךָ תָּקַ֖עְתָּ לַזָּ֣ר כַּפֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
My son, if you have stood surety for your fellow,
Given your hand for another,aOr “a stranger.”

translations.hebrew: נוֹקַ֥שְׁתָּ בְאִמְרֵי־פִ֑יךָ נִ֝לְכַּ֗דְתָּ בְּאִמְרֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You have been trapped by the words of your mouth,
Snared by the words of your mouth.

translations.hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֨ה זֹ֥את אֵפ֪וֹא ׀ בְּנִ֡י וְֽהִנָּצֵ֗ל כִּ֘י־בָ֤אתָ בְכַף־רֵעֶ֑ךָ לֵ֥ךְ הִ֝תְרַפֵּ֗ס וּרְהַ֥ב רֵעֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Do this, then, my son, to extricate yourself,
For you have come into the power of your fellow:
Go grovel—and badger your fellow;

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן שֵׁנָ֣ה לְעֵינֶ֑יךָ וּ֝תְנוּמָ֗ה לְעַפְעַפֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Give your eyes no sleep,
Your pupils no slumber.

translations.hebrew: הִ֭נָּצֵל כִּצְבִ֣י מִיָּ֑ד וּ֝כְצִפּ֗וֹר מִיַּ֥ד יָקֽוּשׁ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Save yourself like a deer out of the hand [of a hunter],
Like a bird out of the hand of a fowler.

translations.hebrew: לֵֽךְ־אֶל־נְמָלָ֥ה עָצֵ֑ל רְאֵ֖ה דְרָכֶ֣יהָ וַחֲכָֽם׃
translations.english:
Lazybones, go to the ant;
Study its ways and learn.

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֵֽין־לָ֥הּ קָצִ֗ין שֹׁטֵ֥ר וּמֹשֵֽׁל׃
translations.english: Without leaders, officers, or rulers,

translations.hebrew: תָּכִ֣ין בַּקַּ֣יִץ לַחְמָ֑הּ אָגְרָ֥ה בַ֝קָּצִ֗יר מַאֲכָלָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
It lays up its stores during the summer,
Gathers in its food at the harvest.

translations.hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֖י עָצֵ֥ל <small>׀</small> תִּשְׁכָּ֑ב מָ֝תַ֗י תָּק֥וּם מִשְּׁנָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
How long will you lie there, lazybones;
When will you wake from your sleep?

translations.hebrew: מְעַ֣ט שֵׁ֭נוֹת מְעַ֣ט תְּנוּמ֑וֹת מְעַ֓ט ׀ חִבֻּ֖ק יָדַ֣יִם לִשְׁכָּֽב׃
translations.english:
A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber,
A bit more hugging yourself in bed,

translations.hebrew: וּבָֽא־כִמְהַלֵּ֥ךְ רֵאשֶׁ֑ךָ וּ֝מַחְסֹרְךָ֗ כְּאִ֣ישׁ מָגֵֽן׃ {פ}
translations.english:
And poverty will come bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.calling upon you,-b
And want, like a man with a shield.

translations.hebrew: אָדָ֣ם בְּ֭לִיַּעַל אִ֣ישׁ אָ֑וֶן ה֝וֹלֵ֗ךְ עִקְּשׁ֥וּת פֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
A scoundrel, an evil man
Lives by crooked speech,

translations.hebrew: קֹרֵ֣ץ בְּ֭עֵינָו מֹלֵ֣ל בְּרַגְלָ֑ו מֹ֝רֶ֗ה בְּאֶצְבְּעֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Winking his eyes,
Shuffling his feet,
Pointing his finger.

translations.hebrew: תַּ֥הְפֻּכ֨וֹת ׀ בְּלִבּ֗וֹ חֹרֵ֣שׁ רָ֣ע בְּכׇל־עֵ֑ת (מדנים) [מִדְיָנִ֥ים] יְשַׁלֵּֽחַ׃
translations.english:
Duplicity is in his heart;
He plots evil all the time;
He incites quarrels.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן פִּ֭תְאֹם יָב֣וֹא אֵיד֑וֹ פֶּ֥תַע יִ֝שָּׁבֵ֗ר וְאֵ֣ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Therefore calamity will come upon him without warning;
Suddenly he will be broken beyond repair.

translations.hebrew: שֶׁשׁ־הֵ֭נָּה שָׂנֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝שֶׁ֗בַע (תועבות) [תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת] נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
Six things the LORD hates;
Seven are an abomination to Him:

translations.hebrew: עֵינַ֣יִם רָ֭מוֹת לְשׁ֣וֹן שָׁ֑קֶר וְ֝יָדַ֗יִם שֹׁפְכ֥וֹת דָּם־נָקִֽי׃
translations.english:
A haughty bearing,
A lying tongue,
Hands that shed innocent blood,

translations.hebrew: לֵ֗ב חֹ֭רֵשׁ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת אָ֑וֶן רַגְלַ֥יִם מְ֝מַהֲר֗וֹת לָר֥וּץ לָרָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
A mind that hatches evil plots,
Feet quick to run to evil,

translations.hebrew: יָפִ֣יחַ כְּ֭זָבִים עֵ֣ד שָׁ֑קֶר וּמְשַׁלֵּ֥חַ מְ֝דָנִ֗ים בֵּ֣ין אַחִֽים׃ {פ}
translations.english:
A false witness testifying lies,
And one who incites brothers to quarrel.

translations.hebrew: נְצֹ֣ר בְּ֭נִי מִצְוַ֣ת אָבִ֑יךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝טֹּ֗שׁ תּוֹרַ֥ת אִמֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My son, keep your father’s commandment;
Do not forsake your mother’s teaching.

translations.hebrew: קׇשְׁרֵ֣ם עַל־לִבְּךָ֣ תָמִ֑יד עׇ֝נְדֵ֗ם עַל־גַּרְגְּרֹתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Tie them over your heart always;
Bind them around your throat.

translations.hebrew: בְּהִתְהַלֶּכְךָ֨ ׀ תַּנְחֶ֬ה אֹתָ֗ךְ בְּֽ֭שׇׁכְבְּךָ תִּשְׁמֹ֣ר עָלֶ֑יךָ וַ֝הֲקִיצ֗וֹתָ הִ֣יא תְשִׂיחֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
When you walk it will lead you;
When you lie down it will watch over you;
And when you are awake it will talk with you.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י נֵ֣ר מִ֭צְוָה וְת֣וֹרָה א֑וֹר וְדֶ֥רֶךְ חַ֝יִּ֗ים תּוֹכְח֥וֹת מוּסָֽר׃
translations.english:
For the commandment is a lamp,
The teaching is a light,
And the way to life is the rebuke that disciplines.

translations.hebrew: לִ֭שְׁמׇרְךָ מֵאֵ֣שֶׁת רָ֑ע מֵ֝חֶלְקַ֗ת לָשׁ֥וֹן נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
It will keep you from an evil woman,
From the smooth tongue of a forbiddencLit. “alien.” woman.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּחְמֹ֣ד יׇ֭פְיָהּ בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝קָּחֲךָ֗ בְּעַפְעַפֶּֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
Do not lust for her beauty
Or let her captivate you with her eyes.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י בְעַד־אִשָּׁ֥ה זוֹנָ֗ה עַֽד־כִּכַּ֫ר־לָ֥חֶם וְאֵ֥שֶׁת אִ֑ישׁ נֶ֖פֶשׁ יְקָרָ֣ה תָצֽוּד׃ {פ}
translations.english:
The last loaf of bread will go for a harlot;
A married woman will snare a person of honor.

translations.hebrew: הֲיַחְתֶּ֤ה אִ֓ישׁ אֵ֬שׁ בְּחֵיק֑וֹ וּ֝בְגָדָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִשָּׂרַֽפְנָה׃
translations.english:
Can a man rake embers into his bosom
Without burning his clothes?

translations.hebrew: אִם־יְהַלֵּ֣ךְ אִ֭ישׁ עַל־הַגֶּחָלִ֑ים וְ֝רַגְלָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִכָּוֶֽינָה׃
translations.english:
Can a man walk on live coals
Without scorching his feet?

translations.hebrew: כֵּ֗ן הַ֭בָּא אֶל־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֑הוּ לֹ֥א יִ֝נָּקֶ֗ה כׇּֽל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
It is the same with one who sleeps with his fellow’s wife;
None who touches her will go unpunished.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יָב֣וּזוּ לַ֭גַּנָּב כִּ֣י יִגְנ֑וֹב לְמַלֵּ֥א נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ כִּ֣י יִרְעָֽב׃
translations.english:
A thief is not held in contempt
For stealing to appease his hunger;

translations.hebrew: וְ֭נִמְצָא יְשַׁלֵּ֣ם שִׁבְעָתָ֑יִם אֶת־כׇּל־ה֖וֹן בֵּית֣וֹ יִתֵּֽן׃
translations.english:
Yet if caught he must pay sevenfold;
He must give up all he owns.

translations.hebrew: נֹאֵ֣ף אִשָּׁ֣ה חֲסַר־לֵ֑ב מַֽשְׁחִ֥ית נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ ה֣וּא יַעֲשֶֽׂנָּה׃
translations.english:
He who commits adultery is devoid of sense;
Only one who would destroy himself does such a thing.

translations.hebrew: נֶגַע־וְקָל֥וֹן יִמְצָ֑א וְ֝חֶרְפָּת֗וֹ לֹ֣א תִמָּחֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He will meet with disease and disgrace;
His reproach will never be expunged.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־קִנְאָ֥ה חֲמַת־גָּ֑בֶר וְלֹא־יַ֝חְמ֗וֹל בְּי֣וֹם נָקָֽם׃
translations.english:
The fury of the husband will be passionate;
He will show no pity on his day of vengeance.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־יִ֭שָּׂא פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־כֹּ֑פֶר וְלֹא־יֹ֝אבֶ֗ה כִּ֣י תַרְבֶּה־שֹּֽׁחַד׃ {פ}
translations.english:
He will not have regard for any ransom;
He will refuse your bribe, however great.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי שְׁמֹ֣ר אֲמָרָ֑י וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י תִּצְפֹּ֥ן אִתָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
My son, heed my words;
And store up my commandments with you.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמֹ֣ר מִצְוֺתַ֣י וֶחְיֵ֑ה וְ֝תוֹרָתִ֗י כְּאִישׁ֥וֹן עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Keep my commandments and live,
My teaching, as the apple of your eye.

translations.hebrew: קׇשְׁרֵ֥ם עַל־אֶצְבְּעֹתֶ֑יךָ כׇּ֝תְבֵ֗ם עַל־ל֥וּחַ לִבֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Bind them on your fingers;
Write them on the tablet of your mind.

translations.hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר לַ֭חׇכְמָה אֲחֹ֣תִי אָ֑תְּ וּ֝מֹדָ֗ע לַבִּינָ֥ה תִקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
Say to Wisdom, “You are my sister,”
And call Understanding a kinswoman.

translations.hebrew: לִ֭שְׁמׇרְךָ מֵאִשָּׁ֣ה זָרָ֑ה מִ֝נׇּכְרִיָּ֗ה אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ הֶחֱלִֽיקָה׃
translations.english:
She will guard you from a forbiddenaLit. “strange.” woman;
From an alien woman whose talk is smooth.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י בְּחַלּ֣וֹן בֵּיתִ֑י בְּעַ֖ד אֶשְׁנַבִּ֣י נִשְׁקָֽפְתִּי׃
translations.english:
From the window of my house,
Through my lattice, I looked out

translations.hebrew: וָאֵ֤רֶא בַפְּתָאיִ֗ם אָ֘בִ֤ינָה בַבָּנִ֗ים נַ֣עַר חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
And saw among the simple,
Noticed among the youths,
A lad devoid of sense.

translations.hebrew: עֹבֵ֣ר בַּ֭שּׁוּק אֵ֣צֶל פִּנָּ֑הּ וְדֶ֖רֶךְ בֵּיתָ֣הּ יִצְעָֽד׃
translations.english:
He was crossing the street near her corner,
Walking toward her house

translations.hebrew: בְּנֶֽשֶׁף־בְּעֶ֥רֶב י֑וֹם בְּאִישׁ֥וֹן לַ֝֗יְלָה וַאֲפֵלָֽה׃
translations.english:
In the dusk of evening,
In the dark hours of night.

translations.hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה אִ֭שָּׁה לִקְרָאת֑וֹ שִׁ֥ית ז֝וֹנָ֗ה וּנְצֻ֥רַת לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
A woman comes toward him
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Dressed like a harlot, with set purpose.-b

translations.hebrew: הֹמִיָּ֣ה הִ֣יא וְסֹרָ֑רֶת בְּ֝בֵיתָ֗הּ לֹא־יִשְׁכְּנ֥וּ רַגְלֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
She is bustling and restive;
She is never at home.

translations.hebrew: פַּ֤עַם ׀ בַּח֗וּץ פַּ֥עַם בָּרְחֹב֑וֹת וְאֵ֖צֶל כׇּל־פִּנָּ֣ה תֶאֱרֹֽב׃
translations.english:
Now in the street, now in the square,
She lurks at every corner.

translations.hebrew: וְהֶחֱזִ֣יקָה בּ֭וֹ וְנָ֣שְׁקָה לּ֑וֹ הֵעֵ֥זָה פָ֝נֶ֗יהָ וַתֹּ֣אמַר לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
She lays hold of him and kisses him;
Brazenly she says to him,

translations.hebrew: זִבְחֵ֣י שְׁלָמִ֣ים עָלָ֑י הַ֝יּ֗וֹם שִׁלַּ֥מְתִּי נְדָרָֽי׃
translations.english:
“I had to make a sacrifice of well-being;
Today I fulfilled my vows.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן יָצָ֣אתִי לִקְרָאתֶ֑ךָ לְשַׁחֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וָאֶמְצָאֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Therefore I have come out to you,
Seeking you, and have found you.

translations.hebrew: מַ֭רְבַדִּים רָבַ֣דְתִּי עַרְשִׂ֑י חֲ֝טֻב֗וֹת אֵט֥וּן מִצְרָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
I have decked my couch with covers
Of dyed Egyptian linen;

translations.hebrew: נַ֥פְתִּי מִשְׁכָּבִ֑י מֹ֥ר אֲ֝הָלִ֗ים וְקִנָּמֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
I have sprinkled my bed
With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

translations.hebrew: לְכָ֤ה נִרְוֶ֣ה דֹ֭דִים עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר נִ֝תְעַלְּסָ֗ה בׇּאֳהָבִֽים׃
translations.english:
Let us drink our fill of love till morning;
Let us delight in amorous embrace.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ין הָאִ֣ישׁ בְּבֵית֑וֹ הָ֝לַ֗ךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ מֵרָחֽוֹק׃
translations.english:
For the man of the house is away;
He is off on a distant journey.

translations.hebrew: צְֽרוֹר־הַ֭כֶּסֶף לָקַ֣ח בְּיָד֑וֹ לְי֥וֹם הַ֝כֵּ֗סֶא יָבֹ֥א בֵיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He took his bag of money with him
And will return only at mid-month.”

translations.hebrew: הִ֭טַּתּוּ בְּרֹ֣ב לִקְחָ֑הּ בְּחֵ֥לֶק שְׂ֝פָתֶ֗יהָ תַּדִּיחֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
She sways him with her eloquence,
Turns him aside with her smooth talk.

translations.hebrew: ה֤וֹלֵ֥ךְ אַחֲרֶ֗יהָ פִּ֫תְאֹ֥ם כְּ֭שׁוֹר אֶל־טֶ֣בַח יָבֹ֑א וּ֝כְעֶ֗כֶס אֶל־מוּסַ֥ר אֱוִֽיל׃
translations.english:
Thoughtlessly he follows her,
Like an ox going to the slaughter,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Like a fool to the stocks for punishment-b—

translations.hebrew: עַ֤ד יְפַלַּ֪ח חֵ֡ץ כְּֽבֵד֗וֹ כְּמַהֵ֣ר צִפּ֣וֹר אֶל־פָּ֑ח וְלֹא־יָ֝דַ֗ע כִּֽי־בְנַפְשׁ֥וֹ הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
Until the arrow pierces his liver.
He is like a bird rushing into a trap,
Not knowing his life is at stake.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבוּ לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
translations.english:
Now, sons, listen to me;
Pay attention to my words;

translations.hebrew: אַל־יֵ֣שְׂטְ אֶל־דְּרָכֶ֣יהָ לִבֶּ֑ךָ אַל־תֵּ֝֗תַע בִּנְתִיבוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
Let your mind not wander down her ways;
Do not stray onto her paths.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־רַבִּ֣ים חֲלָלִ֣ים הִפִּ֑ילָה וַ֝עֲצֻמִ֗ים כׇּל־הֲרֻגֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
For many are those she has struck dead,
And numerous are her victims.

translations.hebrew: דַּרְכֵ֣י שְׁא֣וֹל בֵּיתָ֑הּ יֹ֝רְד֗וֹת אֶל־חַדְרֵי־מָֽוֶת׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Her house is a highway to Sheol
Leading down to Death’s inner chambers.

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־חׇכְמָ֥ה תִקְרָ֑א וּ֝תְבוּנָ֗ה תִּתֵּ֥ן קוֹלָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
It is Wisdom calling,
Understanding raising her voice.

translations.hebrew: בְּרֹאשׁ־מְרֹמִ֥ים עֲלֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ בֵּ֖ית נְתִיב֣וֹת נִצָּֽבָה׃
translations.english:
She takes her stand at the topmost heights,
By the wayside, at the crossroads,

translations.hebrew: לְיַד־שְׁעָרִ֥ים לְפִי־קָ֑רֶת מְב֖וֹא פְתָחִ֣ים תָּרֹֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
Near the gates at the city entrance;
At the entryways, she shouts,

translations.hebrew: אֲלֵיכֶ֣ם אִישִׁ֣ים אֶקְרָ֑א וְ֝קוֹלִ֗י אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
“O men, I call to you;
My cry is to all mankind.

translations.hebrew: הָבִ֣ינוּ פְתָאיִ֣ם עׇרְמָ֑ה וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים הָבִ֥ינוּ לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
O simple ones, learn shrewdness;
O dullards, instruct your minds.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֭מְעוּ כִּֽי־נְגִידִ֣ים אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וּמִפְתַּ֥ח שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י מֵישָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Listen, for I speak noble things;
Uprightness comes from my lips;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אֱ֭מֶת יֶהְגֶּ֣ה חִכִּ֑י וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת שְׂפָתַ֣י רֶֽשַׁע׃
translations.english:
My mouth utters truth;
Wickedness is abhorrent to my lips.

translations.hebrew: בְּצֶ֥דֶק כׇּל־אִמְרֵי־פִ֑י אֵ֥ין בָּ֝הֶ֗ם נִפְתָּ֥ל וְעִקֵּֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
All my words are just,
None of them perverse or crooked;

translations.hebrew: כֻּלָּ֣ם נְ֭כֹחִים לַמֵּבִ֑ין וִ֝ישָׁרִ֗ים לְמֹ֣צְאֵי דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
All are straightforward to the intelligent man,
And right to those who have attained knowledge.

translations.hebrew: קְחֽוּ־מוּסָרִ֥י וְאַל־כָּ֑סֶף וְ֝דַ֗עַת מֵחָר֥וּץ נִבְחָֽר׃
translations.english:
Accept my discipline rather than silver,
Knowledge rather than choice gold.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־טוֹבָ֣ה חׇ֭כְמָה מִפְּנִינִ֑ים וְכׇל־חֲ֝פָצִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִֽשְׁווּ־בָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
For wisdom is better than rubies;
No goods can equal her.

translations.hebrew: אֲֽנִי־חׇ֭כְמָה שָׁכַ֣נְתִּי עׇרְמָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת מְזִמּ֣וֹת אֶמְצָֽא׃
translations.english:
“I, Wisdom, live with Prudence;
I attain knowledge and foresight.

translations.hebrew: יִ֥רְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָה֮ שְֽׂנֹ֫את־רָ֥ע גֵּ֘אָ֤ה וְגָא֨וֹן ׀ וְדֶ֣רֶךְ רָ֭ע וּפִ֨י תַהְפֻּכ֬וֹת שָׂנֵֽאתִי׃
translations.english:
To fear the LORD is to hate evil;
I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way,
And duplicity in speech.

translations.hebrew: לִֽי־עֵ֭צָה וְתוּשִׁיָּ֑ה אֲנִ֥י בִ֝ינָ֗ה לִ֣י גְבוּרָֽה׃
translations.english:
Mine are counsel and resourcefulness;
I am understanding; courage is mine.

translations.hebrew: בִּ֭י מְלָכִ֣ים יִמְלֹ֑כוּ וְ֝רֹזְנִ֗ים יְחֹ֣קְקוּ צֶֽדֶק׃
translations.english:
Through me kings reign
And rulers decree just laws;

translations.hebrew: בִּ֭י שָׂרִ֣ים יָשֹׂ֑רוּ וּ֝נְדִיבִ֗ים כׇּל־שֹׁ֥פְטֵי צֶֽדֶק׃
translations.english:
Through me princes rule,
Great men and all the aAccording to some Heb. mss. and printed editions, “judges of the earth.”righteous judges.-a

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭נִי (אהביה) [אֹהֲבַ֣י] אֵהָ֑ב וּ֝מְשַׁחֲרַ֗י יִמְצָאֻֽנְנִי׃
translations.english:
Those who love me I love,
And those who seek me will find me.

translations.hebrew: עֹֽשֶׁר־וְכָב֥וֹד אִתִּ֑י ה֥וֹן עָ֝תֵ֗ק וּצְדָקָֽה׃
translations.english:
Riches and honor belong to me,
Enduring wealth and success.

translations.hebrew: ט֣וֹב פִּ֭רְיִי מֵחָר֣וּץ וּמִפָּ֑ז וּ֝תְבוּאָתִ֗י מִכֶּ֥סֶף נִבְחָֽר׃
translations.english:
My fruit is better than gold, fine gold,
And my produce better than choice silver.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֹֽרַח־צְדָקָ֥ה אֲהַלֵּ֑ךְ בְּ֝ת֗וֹךְ נְתִיב֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
I walk on the way of righteousness,
On the paths of justice.

translations.hebrew: לְהַנְחִ֖יל אֹהֲבַ֥י <small>׀</small> יֵ֑שׁ וְאֹצְרֹ֖תֵיהֶ֣ם אֲמַלֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
I endow those who love me with substance;
I will fill their treasuries.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה קָ֭נָנִי רֵאשִׁ֣ית דַּרְכּ֑וֹ קֶ֖דֶם מִפְעָלָ֣יו מֵאָֽז׃
translations.english:
“The LORD created me at the beginning of His course
As the first of His works of old.

translations.hebrew: מֵ֭עוֹלָם נִסַּ֥כְתִּי מֵרֹ֗אשׁ מִקַּדְמֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
In the distant past I was fashioned,
At the beginning, at the origin of earth.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֵין־תְּהֹמ֥וֹת חוֹלָ֑לְתִּי בְּאֵ֥ין מַ֝עְיָנ֗וֹת נִכְבַּדֵּי־מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
There was still no deep when I was brought forth,
No springs rich in water;

translations.hebrew: בְּטֶ֣רֶם הָרִ֣ים הׇטְבָּ֑עוּ לִפְנֵ֖י גְבָע֣וֹת חוֹלָֽלְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Before [the foundations of] the mountains were sunk,
Before the hills I was born.

translations.hebrew: עַד־לֹ֣א עָ֭שָׂה אֶ֣רֶץ וְחוּצ֑וֹת וְ֝רֹ֗אשׁ עַפְר֥וֹת תֵּבֵֽל׃
translations.english:
He had not yet made earth and fields,
Or the world’s first clumps of clay.

translations.hebrew: בַּהֲכִינ֣וֹ שָׁ֭מַיִם שָׁ֣ם אָ֑נִי בְּחֻ֥קוֹ ח֝֗וּג עַל־פְּנֵ֥י תְהֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
I was there when He set the heavens into place;
When He fixed the horizon upon the deep;

translations.hebrew: בְּאַמְּצ֣וֹ שְׁחָקִ֣ים מִמָּ֑עַל בַּ֝עֲז֗וֹז עִינ֥וֹת תְּהֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
When He made the heavens above firm,
And the fountains of the deep gushed forth;

translations.hebrew: בְּשׂ֘וּמ֤וֹ לַיָּ֨ם ׀ חֻקּ֗וֹ וּ֭מַיִם לֹ֣א יַֽעַבְרוּ־פִ֑יו בְּ֝חוּק֗וֹ מ֣וֹסְדֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
When He assigned the sea its limits,
So that its waters never transgress His command;
When He fixed the foundations of the earth,

translations.hebrew: וָאֶהְיֶ֥ה אֶצְל֗וֹ אָ֫מ֥וֹן וָאֶהְיֶ֣ה שַׁ֭עֲשׁוּעִים י֤וֹם ׀ י֑וֹם מְשַׂחֶ֖קֶת לְפָנָ֣יו בְּכׇל־עֵֽת׃
translations.english:
I was with Him as a confidant,
A source of delight every day,
Rejoicing before Him at all times,

translations.hebrew: מְ֭שַׂחֶקֶת בְּתֵבֵ֣ל אַרְצ֑וֹ וְ֝שַׁעֲשֻׁעַ֗י אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Rejoicing in His inhabited world,
Finding delight with mankind.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְ֝אַשְׁרֵ֗י דְּרָכַ֥י יִשְׁמֹֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
Now, sons, listen to me;
Happy are they who keep my ways.

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְע֖וּ מוּסָ֥ר וַחֲכָ֗מוּ וְאַל־תִּפְרָֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
Heed discipline and become wise;
Do not spurn it.

translations.hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־אָדָם֮ שֹׁמֵ֢עַֽ֫ לִ֥י לִשְׁקֹ֣ד עַל־דַּ֭לְתֹתַי י֤וֹם ׀ י֑וֹם לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר מְזוּזֹ֥ת פְּתָחָֽי׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man who listens to me,
Coming early to my gates each day,
Waiting outside my doors.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י מֹ֭צְאִי (מצאי) [מָצָ֣א] חַיִּ֑ים וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
For he who finds me finds life
And obtains favor from the LORD.

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭חֹטְאִי חֹמֵ֣ס נַפְשׁ֑וֹ כׇּל־מְ֝שַׂנְאַ֗י אָ֣הֲבוּ מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
But he who misses me destroys himself;
All who hate me love death.”

translations.hebrew: חׇ֭כְמוֹת בָּנְתָ֣ה בֵיתָ֑הּ חָצְבָ֖ה עַמּוּדֶ֣יהָ שִׁבְעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Wisdom has built her house,
She has hewn her seven pillars.

translations.hebrew: טָבְחָ֣ה טִ֭בְחָהּ מָסְכָ֣ה יֵינָ֑הּ אַ֝֗ף עָרְכָ֥ה שֻׁלְחָנָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
She has prepared the feast,
Mixed the wine,
And also set the table.

translations.hebrew: שָׁלְחָ֣ה נַעֲרֹתֶ֣יהָ תִקְרָ֑א עַל־גַּ֝פֵּ֗י מְרֹ֣מֵי קָֽרֶת׃
translations.english:
She has sent out her maids to announce
On the heights of the town,

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־פֶ֭תִי יָסֻ֣ר הֵ֑נָּה חֲסַר־לֵ֝֗ב אָ֣מְרָה לּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
“Let the simple enter here”;
To those devoid of sense she says,

translations.hebrew: לְ֭כוּ לַחֲמ֣וּ בְֽלַחֲמִ֑י וּ֝שְׁת֗וּ בְּיַ֣יִן מָסָֽכְתִּי׃
translations.english:
“Come, eat my food
And drink the wine that I have mixed;

translations.hebrew: עִזְב֣וּ פְתָאיִ֣ם וִֽחְי֑וּ וְ֝אִשְׁר֗וּ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ בִּינָֽה׃
translations.english:
Give up simpleness and live,
Walk in the way of understanding.”

translations.hebrew: יֹ֤סֵ֨ר ׀ לֵ֗ץ לֹקֵ֣חַֽ ל֣וֹ קָל֑וֹן וּמוֹכִ֖יחַ לְרָשָׁ֣ע מוּמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
To correct a scoffer,
aClauses transposed for clarity.Or rebuke a wicked man for his blemish,
Is to call down abuse on oneself.-a

translations.hebrew: אַל־תּ֣וֹכַח לֵ֭ץ פֶּן־יִשְׂנָאֶ֑ךָּ הוֹכַ֥ח לְ֝חָכָ֗ם וְיֶאֱהָבֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Do not rebuke a scoffer, for he will hate you;
Reprove a wise man, and he will love you.

translations.hebrew: תֵּ֣ן לְ֭חָכָם וְיֶחְכַּם־ע֑וֹד הוֹדַ֥ע לְ֝צַדִּ֗יק וְי֣וֹסֶף לֶֽקַח׃
translations.english:
Instruct a wise man, and he will grow wiser;
Teach a righteous man, and he will gain in learning.

translations.hebrew: תְּחִלַּ֣ת חׇ֭כְמָה יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת קְדֹשִׁ֣ים בִּינָֽה׃
translations.english:
The beginning of wisdom is fear of the LORD,
And knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־בִ֭י יִרְבּ֣וּ יָמֶ֑יךָ וְיוֹסִ֥יפוּ לְּ֝ךָ֗ שְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
For through me your days will increase,
And years be added to your life.

If you are wise, you are wise for yourself;
If you are a scoffer, you bear it alone.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֣שֶׁת כְּ֭סִילוּת הֹמִיָּ֑ה פְּ֝תַיּ֗וּת וּבַל־יָ֥דְעָה מָּֽה׃
translations.english:
The stupid woman bustles about;
She is simple and knows nothing.

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭יָשְׁבָה לְפֶ֣תַח בֵּיתָ֑הּ עַל־כִּ֝סֵּ֗א מְרֹ֣מֵי קָֽרֶת׃
translations.english:
She sits in the doorway of her house,
Or on a chair at the heights of the town,

translations.hebrew: לִקְרֹ֥א לְעֹֽבְרֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ הַֽ֝מְיַשְּׁרִ֗ים אֹֽרְחוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
Calling to all the wayfarers
Who go about their own affairs,

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־פֶ֭תִי יָסֻ֣ר הֵ֑נָּה וַחֲסַר־לֵ֝֗ב וְאָ֣מְרָה לּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
“Let the simple enter here”;
And to those devoid of sense she says,

translations.hebrew: מַֽיִם־גְּנוּבִ֥ים יִמְתָּ֑קוּ וְלֶ֖חֶם סְתָרִ֣ים יִנְעָֽם׃
translations.english:
“Stolen waters are sweet,
And bread eaten furtively is tasty.”

translations.hebrew: וְֽלֹא־יָ֭דַע כִּֽי־רְפָאִ֣ים שָׁ֑ם בְּעִמְקֵ֖י שְׁא֣וֹל קְרֻאֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
He does not know that the shades are there,
That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.

translations.hebrew: מִשְׁלֵ֗י שְׁלֹ֫מֹ֥ה בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם יְשַׂמַּח־אָ֑ב וּבֵ֥ן כְּ֝סִ֗יל תּוּגַ֥ת אִמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The proverbs of Solomon:

A wise son brings joy to his father;
A dull son is his mother’s sorrow.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־י֭וֹעִילוּ אוֹצְר֣וֹת רֶ֑שַׁע וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה תַּצִּ֥יל מִמָּֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
Ill-gotten wealth is of no avail,
But righteousness saves from death.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יַרְעִ֣יב יְ֭הֹוָה נֶ֣פֶשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וְהַוַּ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים יֶהְדֹּֽף׃
translations.english:
The LORD will not let the righteous go hungry,
But He denies the wicked what they crave.

translations.hebrew: רָ֗אשׁ עֹשֶׂ֥ה כַף־רְמִיָּ֑ה וְיַ֖ד חָרוּצִ֣ים תַּעֲשִֽׁיר׃
translations.english:
Negligent hands cause poverty,
But diligent hands enrich.

translations.hebrew: אֹגֵ֣ר בַּ֭קַּיִץ בֵּ֣ן מַשְׂכִּ֑יל נִרְדָּ֥ם בַּ֝קָּצִ֗יר בֵּ֣ן מֵבִֽישׁ׃
translations.english:
He who lays in stores during the summer is a capable son,
But he who sleeps during the harvest is an incompetent.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭רָכוֹת לְרֹ֣אשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְכַסֶּ֥ה חָמָֽס׃
translations.english:
Blessings light upon the head of the righteous,
But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: זֵ֣כֶר צַ֭דִּיק לִבְרָכָ֑ה וְשֵׁ֖ם רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִרְקָֽב׃
translations.english:
The name of the righteous is invoked in blessing,
But the fame of the wicked rots.

translations.hebrew: חֲכַם־לֵ֭ב יִקַּ֣ח מִצְוֺ֑ת וֶאֱוִ֥יל שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יִלָּבֵֽט׃
translations.english:
He whose heart is wise accepts commands,
But he whose speech is foolish comes to grief.

translations.hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בַּ֭תֹּם יֵ֣לֶךְ בֶּ֑טַח וּמְעַקֵּ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכָ֗יו יִוָּדֵֽעַ׃
translations.english:
He who lives blamelessly lives safely,
But he who walks a crooked path will be found out.

translations.hebrew: קֹ֣רֵֽץ עַ֭יִן יִתֵּ֣ן עַצָּ֑בֶת וֶאֱוִ֥יל שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יִלָּבֵֽט׃
translations.english:
He who winks his eye causes sorrow;
He whose speech is foolish comes to grief.

translations.hebrew: מְק֣וֹר חַ֭יִּים פִּ֣י צַדִּ֑יק וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְכַסֶּ֥ה חָמָֽס׃
translations.english:
The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: שִׂ֭נְאָה תְּעֹרֵ֣ר מְדָנִ֑ים וְעַ֥ל כׇּל־פְּ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תְּכַסֶּ֥ה אַהֲבָֽה׃
translations.english:
Hatred stirs up strife,
But love covers up all faults.

translations.hebrew: בְּשִׂפְתֵ֣י נָ֭בוֹן תִּמָּצֵ֣א חׇכְמָ֑ה וְ֝שֵׁ֗בֶט לְגֵ֣ו חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
Wisdom is to be found on the lips of the intelligent,
But a rod is ready for the back of the senseless.

translations.hebrew: חֲכָמִ֥ים יִצְפְּנוּ־דָ֑עַת וּפִֽי־אֱ֝וִ֗יל מְחִתָּ֥ה קְרֹבָֽה׃
translations.english:
The wise store up knowledge;
The mouth of the fool is an imminent ruin.

translations.hebrew: ה֣וֹן עָ֭שִׁיר קִרְיַ֣ת עֻזּ֑וֹ מְחִתַּ֖ת דַּלִּ֣ים רֵישָֽׁם׃
translations.english:
The wealth of a rich man is his fortress;
The poverty of the poor is his ruin.

translations.hebrew: פְּעֻלַּ֣ת צַדִּ֣יק לְחַיִּ֑ים תְּבוּאַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע לְחַטָּֽאת׃
translations.english:
The labor of the righteous man makes for life;
The produce of the wicked man makes for want.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֣רַח לְ֭חַיִּים שׁוֹמֵ֣ר מוּסָ֑ר וְעֹזֵ֖ב תּוֹכַ֣חַת מַתְעֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He who follows discipline shows the way to life,
But he who ignores reproof leads astray.

translations.hebrew: מְכַסֶּ֣ה שִׂ֭נְאָה שִׂפְתֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר וּמוֹצִ֥א דִ֝בָּ֗ה ה֣וּא כְסִֽיל׃
translations.english:
He who conceals hatred has lying lips,
While he who speaks forth slander is a dullard.

translations.hebrew: בְּרֹ֣ב דְּ֭בָרִים לֹ֣א יֶחְדַּל־פָּ֑שַׁע וְחוֹשֵׂ֖ךְ שְׂפָתָ֣יו מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
Where there is much talking, there is no lack of transgressing,
But he who curbs his tongueaLit. “lips.” shows sense.

translations.hebrew: כֶּ֣סֶף נִ֭בְחָר לְשׁ֣וֹן צַדִּ֑יק לֵ֖ב רְשָׁעִ֣ים כִּמְעָֽט׃
translations.english:
The tongue of a righteous man is choice silver,
But the mind of the wicked is of little worth.

translations.hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י צַ֭דִּיק יִרְע֣וּ רַבִּ֑ים וֶ֝אֱוִילִ֗ים בַּחֲסַר־לֵ֥ב יָמֽוּתוּ׃
translations.english:
The lips of the righteous sustain many,
But fools die for lack of sense.

translations.hebrew: בִּרְכַּ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה הִ֣יא תַעֲשִׁ֑יר וְלֹֽא־יוֹסִ֖ף עֶ֣צֶב עִמָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
It is the blessing of the LORD that enriches,
And no toil can increase it.

translations.hebrew: כִּשְׂח֣וֹק לִ֭כְסִיל עֲשׂ֣וֹת זִמָּ֑ה וְ֝חׇכְמָ֗ה לְאִ֣ישׁ תְּבוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
As mischief is sport for the dullard,
So is wisdom for the man of understanding.

translations.hebrew: מְגוֹרַ֣ת רָ֭שָׁע הִ֣יא תְבוֹאֶ֑נּוּ וְתַאֲוַ֖ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃
translations.english:
What the wicked man plots overtakes him;
What the righteous desire is granted.

translations.hebrew: כַּעֲב֣וֹר ס֭וּפָה וְאֵ֣ין רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק יְס֣וֹד עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
When the storm passes the wicked man is gone,
But the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

translations.hebrew: כַּחֹ֤מֶץ ׀ לַשִּׁנַּ֗יִם וְכֶעָשָׁ֥ן לָעֵינָ֑יִם כֵּ֥ן הֶ֝עָצֵ֗ל לְשֹׁלְחָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Like vinegar to the teeth,
Like smoke to the eyes,
Is a lazy man to those who send him on a mission.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה תּוֹסִ֣יף יָמִ֑ים וּשְׁנ֖וֹת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּקְצֹֽרְנָה׃
translations.english:
The fear of the LORD prolongs life,
While the years of the wicked will be shortened.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹחֶ֣לֶת צַדִּיקִ֣ים שִׂמְחָ֑ה וְתִקְוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֹּאבֵֽד׃
translations.english:
The righteous can look forward to joy,
But the hope of the wicked is doomed.

translations.hebrew: מָע֣וֹז לַ֭תֹּם דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝מְחִתָּ֗ה לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
The way of the LORD is a stronghold for the blameless,
But a ruin for evildoers.

translations.hebrew: צַ֭דִּיק לְעוֹלָ֣ם בַּל־יִמּ֑וֹט וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִשְׁכְּנוּ־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
The righteous will never be shaken;
The wicked will not inhabit the earth.

translations.hebrew: פִּֽי־צַ֭דִּיק יָנ֣וּב חׇכְמָ֑ה וּלְשׁ֥וֹן תַּ֝הְפֻּכ֗וֹת תִּכָּרֵֽת׃
translations.english:
The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom,
But the treacherous tongue shall be cut off.

translations.hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י צַ֭דִּיק יֵדְע֣וּן רָצ֑וֹן וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
The lips of the righteous know what is pleasing;
The mouth of the wicked [knows] duplicity.

translations.hebrew: מֹאזְנֵ֣י מִ֭רְמָה תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶ֖בֶן שְׁלֵמָ֣ה רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
False scales are an abomination to the LORD;
An honestaLit. “whole.” weight pleases Him.

translations.hebrew: בָּֽא־זָ֭דוֹן וַיָּבֹ֣א קָל֑וֹן וְֽאֶת־צְנוּעִ֥ים חׇכְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
When arrogance appears, disgrace follows,
But wisdom is with those who are unassuming.

translations.hebrew: תֻּמַּ֣ת יְשָׁרִ֣ים תַּנְחֵ֑ם וְסֶ֖לֶף בֹּגְדִ֣ים (ושדם) [יְשׇׁדֵּֽם]׃
translations.english:
The integrity of the upright guides them;
The deviousness of the treacherous leads them to ruin.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יוֹעִ֣יל ה֭וֹן בְּי֣וֹם עֶבְרָ֑ה וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה תַּצִּ֥יל מִמָּֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
Wealth is of no avail on the day of wrath,
But righteousness saves from death.

translations.hebrew: צִדְקַ֣ת תָּ֭מִים תְּיַשֵּׁ֣ר דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְרִשְׁעָת֗וֹ יִפֹּ֥ל רָשָֽׁע׃
translations.english:
The righteousness of the blameless man smooths his way,
But the wicked man is felled by his wickedness.

translations.hebrew: צִדְקַ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים תַּצִּילֵ֑ם וּ֝בְהַוַּ֗ת בֹּגְדִ֥ים יִלָּכֵֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
The righteousness of the upright saves them,
But the treacherous are trapped by their malice.

translations.hebrew: בְּמ֤וֹת אָדָ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע תֹּאבַ֣ד תִּקְוָ֑ה וְתוֹחֶ֖לֶת אוֹנִ֣ים אָבָֽדָה׃
translations.english:
At death the hopes of a wicked man are doomed,
And the ambition of evil men comes to nothing.

translations.hebrew: צַ֭דִּיק מִצָּרָ֣ה נֶחֱלָ֑ץ וַיָּבֹ֖א רָשָׁ֣ע תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
translations.english:
The righteous man is rescued from trouble
And the wicked man takes his place.

translations.hebrew: בְּפֶ֗ה חָ֭נֵף יַשְׁחִ֣ת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וּ֝בְדַ֗עַת צַדִּיקִ֥ים יֵחָלֵֽצוּ׃
translations.english:
The impious man destroys his neighbor through speech,
But through their knowledge the righteous are rescued.

translations.hebrew: בְּט֣וּב צַ֭דִּיקִים תַּעֲלֹ֣ץ קִרְיָ֑ה וּבַאֲבֹ֖ד רְשָׁעִ֣ים רִנָּֽה׃
translations.english:
When the righteous prosper the city exults;
When the wicked perish there are shouts of joy.

translations.hebrew: בְּבִרְכַּ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים תָּר֣וּם קָ֑רֶת וּבְפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תֵּהָרֵֽס׃
translations.english:
A city is built up by the blessing of the upright,
But it is torn down by the speech of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: בׇּז־לְרֵעֵ֥הוּ חֲסַר־לֵ֑ב וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּבוּנ֣וֹת יַחֲרִֽישׁ׃
translations.english:
He who speaks contemptuously of his fellowman is devoid of sense;
A prudent man keeps his peace.

translations.hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ רָ֭כִיל מְגַלֶּה־סּ֑וֹד וְנֶאֱמַן־ר֝֗וּחַ מְכַסֶּ֥ה דָבָֽר׃
translations.english:
A base fellow gives away secrets,
But a trustworthy soul keeps a confidence.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֵ֣ין תַּ֭חְבֻּלוֹת יִפׇּל־עָ֑ם וּ֝תְשׁוּעָ֗ה בְּרֹ֣ב יוֹעֵֽץ׃
translations.english:
For want of strategy an army falls,
But victory comes with much planning.

translations.hebrew: רַע־יֵ֭רוֹעַ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וְשֹׂנֵ֖א תֹקְעִ֣ים בּוֹטֵֽחַ׃
translations.english:
Harm awaits him who stands surety for another;bOr “a stranger.”
He who spurns pledging shall be secure.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽשֶׁת־חֵ֭ן תִּתְמֹ֣ךְ כָּב֑וֹד וְ֝עָרִיצִ֗ים יִתְמְכוּ־עֹֽשֶׁר׃
translations.english:
A graceful woman obtains honor;
Ruthless men obtain wealth.

translations.hebrew: גֹּמֵ֣ל נַ֭פְשׁוֹ אִ֣ישׁ חָ֑סֶד וְעֹכֵ֥ר שְׁ֝אֵר֗וֹ אַכְזָרִֽי׃
translations.english:
A kindly man benefits himself;
A cruel man makes trouble for himself.

translations.hebrew: רָשָׁ֗ע עֹשֶׂ֥ה פְעֻלַּת־שָׁ֑קֶר וְזֹרֵ֥עַ צְ֝דָקָ֗ה שֶׂ֣כֶר אֱמֶֽת׃
translations.english:
The wicked man earns illusory wages,
But he who sows righteousness has a true reward.

translations.hebrew: כֵּן־צְדָקָ֥ה לְחַיִּ֑ים וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף רָעָ֣ה לְמוֹתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Righteousness is a prop of life,
But to pursue evil leads to death.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה עִקְּשֵׁי־לֵ֑ב וּ֝רְצוֹנ֗וֹ תְּמִ֣ימֵי דָֽרֶךְ׃
translations.english:
Men of crooked mind are an abomination to the LORD,
But those whose way is blameless please Him.

translations.hebrew: יָ֣ד לְ֭יָד לֹא־יִנָּ֣קֶה רָּ֑ע וְזֶ֖רַע צַדִּיקִ֣ים נִמְלָֽט׃
translations.english:
Assuredly,cLit. “Hand to hand”; meaning of Heb. uncertain. the evil man will not escape,
But the offspring of the righteous will be safe.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֣זֶם זָ֭הָב בְּאַ֣ף חֲזִ֑יר אִשָּׁ֥ה יָ֝פָ֗ה וְסָ֣רַת טָֽעַם׃
translations.english:
Like a gold ring in the snout of a pig
Is a beautiful woman bereft of sense.

translations.hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים אַךְ־ט֑וֹב תִּקְוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים עֶבְרָֽה׃
translations.english:
What the righteous desire can only be good;
What the wicked hope for [stirs] wrath.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ מְ֭פַזֵּר וְנוֹסָ֥ף ע֑וֹד וְחֹשֵׂ֥ךְ מִ֝יֹּ֗שֶׁר אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
One man gives generously and ends with more;
Another stints on doing the right thing and incurs a loss.

translations.hebrew: נֶֽפֶשׁ־בְּרָכָ֥ה תְדֻשָּׁ֑ן וּ֝מַרְוֶ֗ה גַּם־ה֥וּא יוֹרֶֽא׃
translations.english:
A generous person enjoys prosperity;
He who satisfies others shall himself be sated.

translations.hebrew: מֹ֣נֵֽעַ בָּ֭ר יִקְּבֻ֣הוּ לְא֑וֹם וּ֝בְרָכָ֗ה לְרֹ֣אשׁ מַשְׁבִּֽיר׃
translations.english:
He who withholds grain earns the curses of the people,
But blessings are on the head of the one who dispenses it.

translations.hebrew: שֹׁ֣חֵֽר ט֭וֹב יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ רָצ֑וֹן וְדֹרֵ֖שׁ רָעָ֣ה תְבוֹאֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
He who earnestly seeks what is good pursues what is pleasing;
He who is bent on evil, upon him it shall come.

translations.hebrew: בּוֹטֵ֣חַ בְּ֭עׇשְׁרוֹ ה֣וּא יִפּ֑וֹל וְ֝כֶעָלֶ֗ה צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִפְרָֽחוּ׃
translations.english:
He who trusts in his wealth shall fall,
But the righteous shall flourish like foliage.

translations.hebrew: עֹכֵ֣ר בֵּ֭יתוֹ יִנְחַל־ר֑וּחַ וְעֶ֥בֶד אֱ֝וִ֗יל לַֽחֲכַם־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
He who makes trouble for his household shall inherit the wind;
A fool is a slave to the wise-hearted.

translations.hebrew: פְּֽרִי־צַ֭דִּיק עֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים וְלֹקֵ֖חַ נְפָשׁ֣וֹת חָכָֽם׃
translations.english:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life;
A wise man captivates people.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֣ן צַ֭דִּיק בָּאָ֣רֶץ יְשֻׁלָּ֑ם אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־רָשָׁ֥ע וְחוֹטֵֽא׃
translations.english:
If the righteous on earth get their deserts,
How much more the wicked man and the sinner.

translations.hebrew: אֹהֵ֣ב מ֭וּסָר אֹ֣הֵֽב דָּ֑עַת וְשׂוֹנֵ֖א תוֹכַ֣חַת בָּֽעַר׃
translations.english:
He who loves discipline loves knowledge;
He who spurns reproof is a brutish man.

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב יָפִ֣יק רָ֭צוֹן מֵיְהֹוָ֑ה וְאִ֖ישׁ מְזִמּ֣וֹת יַרְשִֽׁיעַ׃
translations.english:
A good man earns the favor of the LORD,
A man of intrigues, His condemnation.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יִכּ֣וֹן אָדָ֣ם בְּרֶ֑שַׁע וְשֹׁ֥רֶשׁ צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
A man cannot be established in wickedness,
But the root of the righteous will not be shaken loose.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽשֶׁת־חַ֭יִל עֲטֶ֣רֶת בַּעְלָ֑הּ וּכְרָקָ֖ב בְּעַצְמוֹתָ֣יו מְבִישָֽׁה׃
translations.english:
A capable wife is a crown for her husband,
But an incompetent one is like rot in his bones.

translations.hebrew: מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת צַדִּיקִ֣ים מִשְׁפָּ֑ט תַּחְבֻּל֖וֹת רְשָׁעִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
The purposes of the righteous are justice,
The schemes of the wicked are deceit.

translations.hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֱרׇב־דָּ֑ם וּפִ֥י יְ֝שָׁרִ֗ים יַצִּילֵֽם׃
translations.english:
The words of the wicked are a deadly ambush,
But the speech of the upright saves them.

translations.hebrew: הָפ֣וֹךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים וְאֵינָ֑ם וּבֵ֖ית צַדִּיקִ֣ים יַעֲמֹֽד׃
translations.english:
Overturn the wicked and they are gone,
But the house of the righteous will endure.

translations.hebrew: לְֽפִי־שִׂ֭כְלוֹ יְהֻלַּל־אִ֑ישׁ וְנַעֲוֵה־לֵ֝֗ב יִהְיֶ֥ה לָבֽוּז׃
translations.english:
A man is commended according to his intelligence;
A twisted mind is held up to contempt.

translations.hebrew: ט֣וֹב נִ֭קְלֶה וְעֶ֣בֶד ל֑וֹ מִ֝מִּתְכַּבֵּ֗ד וַחֲסַר־לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
Better to be lightly esteemed and have a servant
Than to put on airs and have no food.

translations.hebrew: יוֹדֵ֣עַ צַ֭דִּיק נֶ֣פֶשׁ בְּהֶמְתּ֑וֹ וְֽרַחֲמֵ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים אַכְזָרִֽי׃
translations.english:
A righteous man knows the needs of his beast,
But the compassion of the wicked is cruelty.

translations.hebrew: עֹבֵ֣ד אַ֭דְמָתוֹ יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָ֑חֶם וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף רֵיקִ֣ים חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
He who tills his land shall have food in plenty,
But he who pursues vanities is devoid of sense.

translations.hebrew: חָמַ֣ד רָ֭שָׁע מְצ֣וֹד רָעִ֑ים וְשֹׁ֖רֶשׁ צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The wicked covet the catch of evil men;
The root of the righteous yields [fruit].-a

translations.hebrew: בְּפֶ֣שַׁע שְׂ֭פָתַיִם מוֹקֵ֣שׁ רָ֑ע וַיֵּצֵ֖א מִצָּרָ֣ה צַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
Sinful speech is a trap for the evil man,
But the righteous escapes from trouble.

translations.hebrew: מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ יִשְׂבַּע־ט֑וֹב וּגְמ֥וּל יְדֵי־אָ֝דָ֗ם (ישוב) [יָשִׁ֥יב] לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A man gets his fill of good from the fruit of his speech;
One is repaid in kind for one’s deeds.

translations.hebrew: דֶּ֣רֶךְ אֱ֭וִיל יָשָׁ֣ר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְשֹׁמֵ֖עַ לְעֵצָ֣ה חָכָֽם׃
translations.english:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes;
But the wise man accepts advice.

translations.hebrew: אֱוִ֗יל בַּ֭יּוֹם יִוָּדַ֣ע כַּעְס֑וֹ וְכֹסֶ֖ה קָל֣וֹן עָרֽוּם׃
translations.english:
A fool’s vexation is known at once,
But a clever man conceals his humiliation.

translations.hebrew: יָפִ֣יחַ אֱ֭מוּנָה יַגִּ֣יד צֶ֑דֶק וְעֵ֖ד שְׁקָרִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
He who testifies faithfully tells the truth,
But a false witness, deceit.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ בּ֭וֹטֶה כְּמַדְקְר֣וֹת חָ֑רֶב וּלְשׁ֖וֹן חֲכָמִ֣ים מַרְפֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
There is blunt talk like sword-thrusts,
But the speech of the wise is healing.

translations.hebrew: שְֽׂפַת־אֱ֭מֶת תִּכּ֣וֹן לָעַ֑ד וְעַד־אַ֝רְגִּ֗יעָה לְשׁ֣וֹן שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
Truthful speech abides forever,
A lying tongue for but a moment.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭רְמָה בְּלֶב־חֹ֣רְשֵׁי רָ֑ע וּֽלְיֹעֲצֵ֖י שָׁל֣וֹם שִׂמְחָֽה׃
translations.english:
Deceit is in the minds of those who plot evil;
For those who plan good there is joy.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יְאֻנֶּ֣ה לַצַּדִּ֣יק כׇּל־אָ֑וֶן וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים מָ֣לְאוּ רָֽע׃
translations.english:
No harm befalls the righteous,
But the wicked have their fill of misfortune.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה שִׂפְתֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר וְעֹשֵׂ֖י אֱמוּנָ֣ה רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Lying speech is an abomination to the LORD,
But those who act faithfully please Him.

translations.hebrew: אָדָ֣ם עָ֭רוּם כֹּ֣סֶה דָּ֑עַת וְלֵ֥ב כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים יִקְרָ֥א אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
A clever man conceals what he knows,
But the mind of a dullard cries out folly.

translations.hebrew: יַד־חָרוּצִ֥ים תִּמְשׁ֑וֹל וּ֝רְמִיָּ֗ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָמַֽס׃
translations.english:
The hand of the diligent wields authority;
The negligent are held in subjection.

translations.hebrew: דְּאָגָ֣ה בְלֶב־אִ֣ישׁ יַשְׁחֶ֑נָּה וְדָבָ֖ר ט֣וֹב יְשַׂמְּחֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
If there is anxiety in a man’s mind let him quash it,
And turn it into joy with a good word.

translations.hebrew: יָתֵ֣ר מֵרֵעֵ֣הוּ צַדִּ֑יק וְדֶ֖רֶךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים תַּתְעֵֽם׃
translations.english:
A righteous man aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.gives his friend direction,-a
But the way of the wicked leads astray.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יַחֲרֹ֣ךְ רְמִיָּ֣ה צֵיד֑וֹ וְהוֹן־אָדָ֖ם יָקָ֣ר חָרֽוּץ׃
translations.english:
A negligent man never has game to roast;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.A diligent man has precious wealth.-a

translations.hebrew: בְּאֹֽרַח־צְדָקָ֥ה חַיִּ֑ים וְדֶ֖רֶךְ נְתִיבָ֣הֿ אַל־מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
The road of righteousness leads to life;
By way of its path there is no death.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם מ֣וּסַר אָ֑ב וְ֝לֵ֗ץ לֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע גְּעָרָֽה׃
translations.english:
A wise son—it is through the discipline of his father;
A scoffer—he never heard reproof.

translations.hebrew: מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ יֹ֣אכַל ט֑וֹב וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ בֹּגְדִ֣ים חָמָֽס׃
translations.english:
A man enjoys good from the fruit of his speech;
But out of the throat of the treacherous comes lawlessness.

translations.hebrew: נֹצֵ֣ר פִּ֭יו שֹׁמֵ֣ר נַפְשׁ֑וֹ פֹּשֵׂ֥ק שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו מְחִתָּה־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He who guards his tongueaLit. “mouth.” preserves his life;
He who opens wide his lips, it is his ruin.

translations.hebrew: מִתְאַוָּ֣ה וָ֭אַיִן נַפְשׁ֣וֹ עָצֵ֑ל וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ חָרֻצִ֣ים תְּדֻשָּֽׁן׃
translations.english:
A lazy man craves, but has nothing;
The diligent shall feast on rich fare.

translations.hebrew: דְּבַר־שֶׁ֭קֶר יִשְׂנָ֣א צַדִּ֑יק וְ֝רָשָׁ֗ע יַבְאִ֥ישׁ וְיַחְפִּֽיר׃
translations.english:
A righteous man hates lies;
The wicked man is vile and disgraceful.

translations.hebrew: צְ֭דָקָה תִּצֹּ֣ר תׇּם־דָּ֑רֶךְ וְ֝רִשְׁעָ֗ה תְּסַלֵּ֥ף חַטָּֽאת׃
translations.english:
Righteousness protects him whose way is blameless;
Wickedness subverts the sinner.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ מִ֭תְעַשֵּׁר וְאֵ֣ין כֹּ֑ל מִ֝תְרוֹשֵׁ֗שׁ וְה֣וֹן רָֽב׃
translations.english:
One man pretends to be rich and has nothing;
Another professes to be poor and has much wealth.

translations.hebrew: כֹּ֣פֶר נֶפֶשׁ־אִ֣ישׁ עׇשְׁר֑וֹ וְ֝רָ֗שׁ לֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע גְּעָרָֽה׃
translations.english:
Riches are ransom for a man’s life,
The poor never heard a reproof.

translations.hebrew: אוֹר־צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִשְׂמָ֑ח וְנֵ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
The light of the righteous is radiant;
The lamp of the wicked is extinguished.

translations.hebrew: רַק־בְּ֭זָדוֹן יִתֵּ֣ן מַצָּ֑ה וְאֶת־נ֖וֹעָצִ֣ים חׇכְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Arrogance yields nothing but strife;-b
Wisdom belongs to those who seek advice.

translations.hebrew: ה֭וֹן מֵהֶ֣בֶל יִמְעָ֑ט וְקֹבֵ֖ץ עַל־יָ֣ד יַרְבֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Wealth may dwindle to less than nothing,
But he who gathers little by little increases it.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹחֶ֣לֶת מְ֭מֻשָּׁכָה מַחֲלָה־לֵ֑ב וְעֵ֥ץ חַ֝יִּ֗ים תַּאֲוָ֥ה בָאָֽה׃
translations.english:
Hope deferred sickens the heart,
But desire realized is a tree of life.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֣ז לְ֭דָבָר יֵחָ֣בֶל ל֑וֹ וִירֵ֥א מִ֝צְוָ֗ה ה֣וּא יְשֻׁלָּֽם׃
translations.english:
He who disdains a precept will be injured thereby;
He who respects a command will be rewarded.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹרַ֣ת חָ֭כָם מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים לָ֝ס֗וּר מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
The instruction of a wise man is a fountain of life,
Enabling one to avoid deadly snares.

translations.hebrew: שֵֽׂכֶל־ט֭וֹב יִתֶּן־חֵ֑ן וְדֶ֖רֶךְ בֹּגְדִ֣ים אֵיתָֽן׃
translations.english:
Good sense wins favor;
The way of treacherous men is unchanging.cOr “harsh.”

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־עָ֭רוּם יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה בְדָ֑עַת וּ֝כְסִ֗יל יִפְרֹ֥שׂ אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
Every clever man acts knowledgeably,
But a dullard exposes his stupidity.

translations.hebrew: מַלְאָ֣ךְ רָ֭שָׁע יִפֹּ֣ל בְּרָ֑ע וְצִ֖יר אֱמוּנִ֣ים מַרְפֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
Harm befalls a wicked messenger;
A faithful courier brings healing.

translations.hebrew: רֵ֣ישׁ וְ֭קָלוֹן פּוֹרֵ֣עַ מוּסָ֑ר וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹכַ֣חַת יְכֻבָּֽד׃
translations.english:
Poverty and humiliation are for him who spurns discipline;
But he who takes reproof to heart gets honor.

translations.hebrew: תַּאֲוָ֣ה נִ֭הְיָה תֶּעֱרַ֣ב לְנָ֑פֶשׁ וְתוֹעֲבַ֥ת כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים ס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃
translations.english:
Desire realized is sweet to the soul;
To turn away from evil is abhorrent to the stupid.

translations.hebrew: (הלוך) [הוֹלֵ֣ךְ] אֶת־חֲכָמִ֣ים (וחכם) [יֶחְכָּ֑ם] וְרֹעֶ֖ה כְסִילִ֣ים יֵרֽוֹעַ׃
translations.english:
He who keeps company with the wise becomes wise,
But he who consorts with dullards comes to grief.

translations.hebrew: חַ֭טָּאִים תְּרַדֵּ֣ף רָעָ֑ה וְאֶת־צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים יְשַׁלֶּם־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Misfortune pursues sinners,
But the righteous are well rewarded.

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב יַנְחִ֥יל בְּנֵֽי־בָנִ֑ים וְצָפ֥וּן לַ֝צַּדִּ֗יק חֵ֣יל חוֹטֵֽא׃
translations.english:
A good man has what to bequeath to his grandchildren,
For the wealth of sinners is stored up for the righteous.

translations.hebrew: רׇב־אֹ֭כֶל נִ֣יר רָאשִׁ֑ים וְיֵ֥שׁ נִ֝סְפֶּ֗ה בְּלֹ֣א מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
The tillage of the poor yields much food;
But substance is swept away for lack of moderation.

translations.hebrew: חוֹשֵׂ֣ךְ שִׁ֭בְטוֹ שׂוֹנֵ֣א בְנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֹהֲב֗וֹ שִׁחֲר֥וֹ מוּסָֽר׃
translations.english:
He who spares the rod hates his son,
But he who loves him disciplines him early.

translations.hebrew: צַדִּ֗יק אֹ֭כֵֽל לְשֹׂ֣בַע נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּבֶ֖טֶן רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֶּחְסָֽר׃
translations.english:
The righteous man eats to his heart’s content,
But the belly of the wicked is empty.

translations.hebrew: חַכְמ֣וֹת נָ֭שִׁים בָּנְתָ֣ה בֵיתָ֑הּ וְ֝אִוֶּ֗לֶת בְּיָדֶ֥יהָ תֶהֶרְסֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
The wisest of women builds her house,
But folly tears it down with its own hands.

translations.hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּ֭יׇשְׁרוֹ יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּנְל֖וֹז דְּרָכָ֣יו בּוֹזֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
He who maintains his integrity fears the LORD;
A man of devious ways scorns Him.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽפִי־אֱ֭וִיל חֹ֣טֶר גַּאֲוָ֑ה וְשִׂפְתֵ֥י חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים תִּשְׁמוּרֵֽם׃
translations.english:
In the mouth of a fool is a rod of haughtiness,
But the lips of the wise protect them.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֵ֣ין אֲ֭לָפִים אֵב֣וּס בָּ֑ר וְרׇב־תְּ֝בוּא֗וֹת בְּכֹ֣חַ שֽׁוֹר׃
translations.english:
If there are no oxen the crib is clean,
But a rich harvest comes through the strength of the ox.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֣ד אֱ֭מוּנִים לֹ֣א יְכַזֵּ֑ב וְיָפִ֥יחַ כְּ֝זָבִ֗ים עֵ֣ד שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
An honest witness will not lie;
A false witness testifies lies.

translations.hebrew: בִּקֶּשׁ־לֵ֣ץ חׇכְמָ֣ה וָאָ֑יִן וְדַ֖עַת לְנָב֣וֹן נָקָֽל׃
translations.english:
A scoffer seeks wisdom in vain,
But knowledge comes easily to the intelligent man.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ךְ מִ֭נֶּגֶד לְאִ֣ישׁ כְּסִ֑יל וּבַל־יָ֝דַ֗עְתָּ שִׂפְתֵי־דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Keep your distance from a dullard,
For you will not learn wise speech.

translations.hebrew: חׇכְמַ֣ת עָ֭רוּם הָבִ֣ין דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְאִוֶּ֖לֶת כְּסִילִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
It is the wisdom of a clever man to understand his course;
But the stupidity of the dullard is delusion.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭וִלִים יָלִ֣יץ אָשָׁ֑ם וּבֵ֖ין יְשָׁרִ֣ים רָצֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Reparations mediate between fools,
Between the upright, good will.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֗ב י֭וֹדֵעַ מׇרַּ֣ת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּ֝בְשִׂמְחָת֗וֹ לֹא־יִתְעָ֥רַב זָֽר׃
translations.english:
The heart alone knows its bitterness,
And no outsider can share in its joy.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ית רְ֭שָׁעִים יִשָּׁמֵ֑ד וְאֹ֖הֶל יְשָׁרִ֣ים יַפְרִֽיחַ׃
translations.english:
The house of the wicked will be demolished,
But the tent of the upright will flourish.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֤שׁ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יָ֭שָׁר לִפְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ דַּרְכֵי־מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
A road may seem right to a man,
But in the end it is a road to death.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־בִּשְׂחֹ֥ק יִכְאַב־לֵ֑ב וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖הּ שִׂמְחָ֣ה תוּגָֽה׃
translations.english:
The heart may ache even in laughter,
And joy may end in grief.

translations.hebrew: מִדְּרָכָ֣יו יִ֭שְׂבַּע ס֣וּג לֵ֑ב וּ֝מֵעָלָ֗יו אִ֣ישׁ טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
An unprincipled man reaps the fruits of his ways;
aTaking ‘al as from ‘ll; cf. Hos. 12.3.A good man, of his deeds.-a

translations.hebrew: פֶּ֭תִי יַאֲמִ֣ין לְכׇל־דָּבָ֑ר וְ֝עָר֗וּם יָבִ֥ין לַאֲשֻׁרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A simple person believes anything;
A clever man ponders his course.

translations.hebrew: חָכָ֣ם יָ֭רֵא וְסָ֣ר מֵרָ֑ע וּ֝כְסִ֗יל מִתְעַבֵּ֥ר וּבוֹטֵֽחַ׃
translations.english:
A wise man is diffident and shuns evil,
But a dullard rushes in confidently.

translations.hebrew: קְֽצַר־אַ֭פַּיִם יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אִוֶּ֑לֶת וְאִ֥ישׁ מְ֝זִמּ֗וֹת יִשָּׂנֵֽא׃
translations.english:
An impatient man commits folly;
A man of intrigues will be hated.

translations.hebrew: נָחֲל֣וּ פְתָאיִ֣ם אִוֶּ֑לֶת וַ֝עֲרוּמִ֗ים יַכְתִּ֥רוּ דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Folly is the lot of the simple,
But clever men bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.glory in knowledge.-b

translations.hebrew: שַׁח֣וּ רָ֭עִים לִפְנֵ֣י טוֹבִ֑ים וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים עַֽל־שַׁעֲרֵ֥י צַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
Evil men are brought low before the good,
So are the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־לְ֭רֵעֵהוּ יִשָּׂ֣נֵא רָ֑שׁ וְאֹהֲבֵ֖י עָשִׁ֣יר רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
A pauper is despised even by his peers,
But a rich man has many friends.

translations.hebrew: בׇּז־לְרֵעֵ֥הוּ חוֹטֵ֑א וּמְחוֹנֵ֖ן (עניים) [עֲנָוִ֣ים] אַשְׁרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He who despises his fellow is wrong;
He who shows pity for the lowly is happy.

translations.hebrew: הֲֽלוֹא־יִ֭תְעוּ חֹ֣רְשֵׁי רָ֑ע וְחֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת חֹ֣רְשֵׁי טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Surely those who plan evil go astray,
While those who plan good earn steadfast love.

translations.hebrew: בְּכׇל־עֶ֭צֶב יִהְיֶ֣ה מוֹתָ֑ר וּדְבַר־שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
From all toil there is some gain,
But idle chatter is pure loss.

translations.hebrew: עֲטֶ֣רֶת חֲכָמִ֣ים עׇשְׁרָ֑ם אִוֶּ֖לֶת כְּסִילִ֣ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
The ornament of the wise is their wealth;
The stupidity of dullards is stupidity.

translations.hebrew: מַצִּ֣יל נְ֭פָשׁוֹת עֵ֣ד אֱמֶ֑ת וְיָפִ֖חַ כְּזָבִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
A truthful witness saves lives;
He who testifies lies [spreads] deceit.

translations.hebrew: בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מִבְטַח־עֹ֑ז וּ֝לְבָנָ֗יו יִהְיֶ֥ה מַחְסֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Fear of the LORD is a stronghold,
A refuge for a man’s children.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים לָ֝ס֗וּר מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
Fear of the LORD is a fountain of life,
Enabling one to avoid deadly snares.

translations.hebrew: בְּרׇב־עָ֥ם הַדְרַת־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבְאֶ֥פֶס לְ֝אֹ֗ם מְחִתַּ֥ת רָזֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
A numerous people is the glory of a king;
Without a nation a ruler is ruined.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם רַב־תְּבוּנָ֑ה וּקְצַר־ר֝֗וּחַ מֵרִ֥ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
Patience results in much understanding;
Impatience gets folly as its portion.

translations.hebrew: חַיֵּ֣י בְ֭שָׂרִים לֵ֣ב מַרְפֵּ֑א וּרְקַ֖ב עֲצָמ֣וֹת קִנְאָֽה׃
translations.english:
A calm disposition gives bodily health;
Passion is rot to the bones.

translations.hebrew: עֹ֣שֵֽׁק דָּ֭ל חֵרֵ֣ף עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ וּ֝מְכַבְּד֗וֹ חֹנֵ֥ן אֶבְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
He who withholds what is due to the poor affronts his Maker;
He who shows pity for the needy honors Him.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽ֭רָעָתוֹ יִדָּחֶ֣ה רָשָׁ֑ע וְחֹסֶ֖ה בְמוֹת֣וֹ צַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
The wicked man is felled by his own evil;
The righteous man finds security in his death.

translations.hebrew: בְּלֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן תָּנ֣וּחַ חׇכְמָ֑ה וּבְקֶ֥רֶב כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים תִּוָּדֵֽעַ׃
translations.english:
Wisdom rests quietly in the mind of a prudent man,
But among dullards it makes itself known.

translations.hebrew: צְדָקָ֥ה תְרוֹמֵֽם־גּ֑וֹי וְחֶ֖סֶד לְאֻמִּ֣ים חַטָּֽאת׃
translations.english:
Righteousness exalts a nation;
Sin is a reproach to any people.

translations.hebrew: רְֽצוֹן־מֶ֭לֶךְ לְעֶ֣בֶד מַשְׂכִּ֑יל וְ֝עֶבְרָת֗וֹ תִּהְיֶ֥ה מֵבִֽישׁ׃
translations.english:
The king favors a capable servant;
He rages at an incompetent one.

translations.hebrew: מַֽעֲנֶה־רַּ֭ךְ יָשִׁ֣יב חֵמָ֑ה וּדְבַר־עֶ֝֗צֶב יַעֲלֶה־אָֽף׃
translations.english:
A gentle response allays wrath;
A harsh word provokes anger.

translations.hebrew: לְשׁ֣וֹן חֲ֭כָמִים תֵּיטִ֣יב דָּ֑עַת וּפִ֥י כְ֝סִילִ֗ים יַבִּ֥יעַ אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
The tongue of the wise produces much knowledge,
But the mouth of dullards pours out folly.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽכׇל־מָ֭קוֹם עֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה צֹ֝פ֗וֹת רָעִ֥ים וְטוֹבִֽים׃
translations.english:
The eyes of the LORD are everywhere,
Observing the bad and the good.

translations.hebrew: מַרְפֵּ֣א לָ֭שׁוֹן עֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים וְסֶ֥לֶף בָּ֝֗הּ שֶׁ֣בֶר בְּרֽוּחַ׃
translations.english:
A healing tongue is a tree of life,
But a devious one makes for a broken spirit.

translations.hebrew: אֱוִ֗יל יִ֭נְאַץ מוּסַ֣ר אָבִ֑יו וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹכַ֣חַת יַעְרִֽים׃
translations.english:
A fool spurns the discipline of his father,
But one who heeds reproof becomes clever.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ית צַ֭דִּיק חֹ֣סֶן רָ֑ב וּבִתְבוּאַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע נֶעְכָּֽרֶת׃
translations.english:
In the house of the righteous there is much treasure,
But in the harvest of the wicked there is trouble.

translations.hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י חֲ֭כָמִים יְזָ֣רוּ דָ֑עַת וְלֵ֖ב כְּסִילִ֣ים לֹא־כֵֽן׃
translations.english:
The lips of the wise disseminate knowledge;
Not so the minds of dullards.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֣בַח רְ֭שָׁעִים תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּתְפִלַּ֖ת יְשָׁרִ֣ים רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD,
But the prayer of the upright pleases Him.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה דֶּ֣רֶךְ רָשָׁ֑ע וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף צְדָקָ֣ה יֶאֱהָֽב׃
translations.english:
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD,
But He loves him who pursues righteousness.

translations.hebrew: מוּסָ֣ר רָ֭ע לְעֹזֵ֣ב אֹ֑רַח שׂוֹנֵ֖א תוֹכַ֣חַת יָמֽוּת׃
translations.english:
Discipline seems bad to him who forsakes the way;
He who spurns reproof will die.

translations.hebrew: שְׁא֣וֹל וַ֭אֲבַדּוֹן נֶ֣גֶד יְהֹוָ֑ה אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לִבּ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
