Sheol and Abaddon lie exposed to the LORD,
How much more the minds of men!

translations.hebrew: לֹ֣א יֶאֱהַב־לֵ֭ץ הוֹכֵ֣חַֽ ל֑וֹ אֶל־חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים לֹ֣א יֵלֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
The scoffer dislikes being reproved;
He will not resort to the wise.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב שָׂ֭מֵחַ יֵיטִ֣ב פָּנִ֑ים וּבְעַצְּבַת־לֵ֝֗ב ר֣וּחַ נְכֵאָֽה׃
translations.english:
A joyful heart makes a cheerful face;
A sad heart makes a despondent mood.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן יְבַקֶּשׁ־דָּ֑עַת (ופני) [וּפִ֥י] כְ֝סִילִ֗ים יִרְעֶ֥ה אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
The mind of a prudent man seeks knowledge;
The mouth of the dullard pursues folly.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י עָנִ֣י רָעִ֑ים וְטֽוֹב־לֵ֝֗ב מִשְׁתֶּ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
All the days of a poor man are wretched,
But contentment is a feast without end.

translations.hebrew: טוֹב־מְ֭עַט בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה מֵאוֹצָ֥ר רָ֝֗ב וּמְה֥וּמָה בֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Better a little with fear of the LORD
Than great wealth with confusion.

translations.hebrew: ט֤וֹב אֲרֻחַ֣ת יָ֭רָק וְאַהֲבָה־שָׁ֑ם מִשּׁ֥וֹר אָ֝ב֗וּס וְשִׂנְאָה־בֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Better a meal of vegetables where there is love
Than a fattened ox where there is hate.

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ חֵ֭מָה יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וְאֶ֥רֶךְ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם יַשְׁקִ֥יט רִֽיב׃
translations.english:
A hot-tempered man provokes a quarrel;
A patient man calms strife.

translations.hebrew: דֶּ֣רֶךְ עָ֭צֵל כִּמְשֻׂ֣כַת חָ֑דֶק וְאֹ֖רַח יְשָׁרִ֣ים סְלֻלָֽה׃
translations.english:
The way of a lazy man is like a hedge of thorns,
But the path of the upright is paved.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם יְשַׂמַּח־אָ֑ב וּכְסִ֥יל אָ֝דָ֗ם בּוֹזֶ֥ה אִמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A wise son makes his father happy;
A fool of a man humiliates his mother.

translations.hebrew: אִ֭וֶּלֶת שִׂמְחָ֣ה לַחֲסַר־לֵ֑ב וְאִ֥ישׁ תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה יְיַשֶּׁר־לָֽכֶת׃
translations.english:
Folly is joy to one devoid of sense;
A prudent man walks a straight path.

translations.hebrew: הָפֵ֣ר מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת בְּאֵ֣ין ס֑וֹד וּבְרֹ֖ב יוֹעֲצִ֣ים תָּקֽוּם׃
translations.english:
Plans are foiled for want of counsel,
But they succeed through many advisers.

translations.hebrew: שִׂמְחָ֣ה לָ֭אִישׁ בְּמַעֲנֵה־פִ֑יו וְדָבָ֖ר בְּעִתּ֣וֹ מַה־טּֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
A ready response is a joy to a man,
And how good is a word rightly timed!

translations.hebrew: אֹ֣רַח חַ֭יִּים לְמַ֣עְלָה לְמַשְׂכִּ֑יל לְמַ֥עַן ס֝֗וּר מִשְּׁא֥וֹל מָֽטָּה׃
translations.english:
For an intelligent man the path of life leads upward,
In order to avoid Sheol below.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ית גֵּ֭אִים יִסַּ֥ח <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝יַצֵּ֗ב גְּב֣וּל אַלְמָנָֽה׃
translations.english:
The LORD will tear down the house of the proud,
But He will establish the homestead of the widow.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת רָ֑ע וּ֝טְהֹרִ֗ים אִמְרֵי־נֹֽעַם׃
translations.english:
Evil thoughts are an abomination to the LORD,
But pleasant words are pure.

translations.hebrew: עֹכֵ֣ר בֵּ֭יתוֹ בּוֹצֵ֣עַ בָּ֑צַע וְשׂוֹנֵ֖א מַתָּנֹ֣ת יִחְיֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He who pursues ill-gotten gain makes trouble for his household;
He who spurns gifts will live long.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב צַ֭דִּיק יֶהְגֶּ֣ה לַעֲנ֑וֹת וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יַבִּ֥יעַ רָעֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
The heartaFor leb as a source of speech, see note to Eccl. 5.1. of the righteous man rehearses his answer,
But the mouth of the wicked blurts out evil things.

translations.hebrew: רָח֣וֹק יְ֭הֹוָה מֵרְשָׁעִ֑ים וּתְפִלַּ֖ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִשְׁמָֽע׃
translations.english:
The LORD is far from the wicked,
But He hears the prayer of the righteous.

translations.hebrew: מְֽאוֹר־עֵ֭ינַיִם יְשַׂמַּֽח־לֵ֑ב שְׁמוּעָ֥ה ט֝וֹבָ֗ה תְּדַשֶּׁן־עָֽצֶם׃
translations.english:
What brightens the eye gladdens the heart;
Good news puts fat on the bones.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֗זֶן שֹׁ֭מַעַת תּוֹכַ֣חַת חַיִּ֑ים בְּקֶ֖רֶב חֲכָמִ֣ים תָּלִֽין׃
translations.english:
He whose ear heeds the discipline of life
Lodges among the wise.

translations.hebrew: פּוֹרֵ֣עַ מ֭וּסָר מוֹאֵ֣ס נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְשׁוֹמֵ֥עַ תּ֝וֹכַ֗חַת ק֣וֹנֶה לֵּֽב׃
translations.english:
He who spurns discipline hates himself;
He who heeds reproof gains understanding.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מוּסַ֣ר חׇכְמָ֑ה וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָב֣וֹד עֲנָוָֽה׃
translations.english:
The fear of the LORD is the discipline of wisdom;
Humility precedes honor.

translations.hebrew: לְאָדָ֥ם מַעַרְכֵי־לֵ֑ב וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה מַעֲנֵ֥ה לָשֽׁוֹן׃
translations.english:
A man may arrange his thoughts,
But what he says depends on the LORD.

translations.hebrew: כׇּֽל־דַּרְכֵי־אִ֭ישׁ זַ֣ךְ בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְתֹכֵ֖ן רוּח֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
All the ways of a man seem right to him,
But the LORD probes motives.

translations.hebrew: גֹּ֣ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וְ֝יִכֹּ֗נוּ מַחְשְׁבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Entrust your affairs to the LORD,
And your plans will succeed.

translations.hebrew: כֹּ֤ל פָּעַ֣ל יְ֭הֹוָה לַֽמַּעֲנֵ֑הוּ וְגַם־רָ֝שָׁ֗ע לְי֣וֹם רָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
The LORD made everything for a purpose,
Even the wicked for an evil day.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־גְּבַהּ־לֵ֑ב יָ֥ד לְ֝יָ֗ד לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Every haughty person is an abomination to the LORD;
Assuredly,aLit. “Hand to hand”; meaning of Heb. uncertain. he will not go unpunished.

translations.hebrew: בְּחֶ֣סֶד וֶ֭אֱמֶת יְכֻפַּ֣ר עָוֺ֑ן וּבְיִרְאַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה ס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃
translations.english:
Iniquity is expiated by loyalty and faithfulness,
And evil is avoided through fear of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: בִּרְצ֣וֹת יְ֭הֹוָה דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ גַּם־א֝וֹיְבָ֗יו יַשְׁלִ֥ם אִתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
When the LORD is pleased with a man’s conduct,
He may turn even his enemies into allies.

translations.hebrew: טוֹב־מְ֭עַט בִּצְדָקָ֑ה מֵרֹ֥ב תְּ֝בוּא֗וֹת בְּלֹ֣א מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
Better a little with righteousness
Than a large income with injustice.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב אָ֭דָם יְחַשֵּׁ֣ב דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה יָכִ֥ין צַעֲדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A man may plot out his course,
But it is the LORD who directs his steps.

translations.hebrew: קֶ֤סֶם ׀ עַֽל־שִׂפְתֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ בְּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט לֹ֣א יִמְעַל־פִּֽיו׃
translations.english:
There is magic on the lips of the king;
He cannot err in judgment.

translations.hebrew: פֶּ֤לֶס ׀ וּמֹאזְנֵ֣י מִ֭שְׁפָּט לַיהֹוָ֑ה מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗הוּ כׇּל־אַבְנֵי־כִֽיס׃
translations.english:
Honest scales and balances are the LORD’s;
All the weights in the bag are His work.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת מְ֭לָכִים עֲשׂ֣וֹת רֶ֑שַׁע כִּ֥י בִ֝צְדָקָ֗ה יִכּ֥וֹן כִּסֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
Wicked deeds are an abomination to kings,
For the throne is established by righteousness.

translations.hebrew: רְצ֣וֹן מְ֭לָכִים שִׂפְתֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וְדֹבֵ֖ר יְשָׁרִ֣ים יֶאֱהָֽב׃
translations.english:
Truthful speech wins the favor of kings;
They love those who speak honestly.

translations.hebrew: חֲמַת־מֶ֥לֶךְ מַלְאֲכֵי־מָ֑וֶת וְאִ֖ישׁ חָכָ֣ם יְכַפְּרֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
The king’s wrath is a messenger of death,
But a wise man can appease it.

translations.hebrew: בְּאוֹר־פְּנֵי־מֶ֥לֶךְ חַיִּ֑ים וּ֝רְצוֹנ֗וֹ כְּעָ֣ב מַלְקֽוֹשׁ׃
translations.english:
The king’s smile means life;
His favor is like a rain cloud in spring.

translations.hebrew: קְֽנֹה־חׇכְמָ֗ה מַה־טּ֥וֹב מֵחָר֑וּץ וּקְנ֥וֹת בִּ֝ינָ֗ה נִבְחָ֥ר מִכָּֽסֶף׃
translations.english:
How much better to acquire wisdom than gold;
To acquire understanding is preferable to silver.

translations.hebrew: מְסִלַּ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים ס֣וּר מֵרָ֑ע שֹׁמֵ֥ר נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ נֹצֵ֥ר דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The highway of the upright avoids evil;
He who would preserve his life watches his way.

translations.hebrew: לִפְנֵי־שֶׁ֥בֶר גָּא֑וֹן וְלִפְנֵ֥י כִ֝שָּׁל֗וֹן גֹּ֣בַהּ רֽוּחַ׃
translations.english:
Pride goes before ruin,
Arrogance, before failure.

translations.hebrew: ט֣וֹב שְׁפַל־ר֭וּחַ אֶת־[עֲנָוִ֑ים] (עניים) מֵחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁ֝לָ֗ל אֶת־גֵּאִֽים׃
translations.english:
Better to be humble and among the lowly
Than to share spoils with the proud.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֣יל עַל־דָּ֭בָר יִמְצָא־ט֑וֹב וּבוֹטֵ֖חַ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אַשְׁרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He who is adept in a matter will attain success;
Happy is he who trusts in the LORD.

translations.hebrew: לַֽחֲכַם־לֵ֭ב יִקָּרֵ֣א נָב֑וֹן וּמֶ֥תֶק שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יֹסִ֥יף לֶֽקַח׃
translations.english:
The wise-hearted is called discerning;
One whose speech is pleasing gains wisdom.

translations.hebrew: מְק֣וֹר חַ֭יִּים שֵׂ֣כֶל בְּעָלָ֑יו וּמוּסַ֖ר אֱוִלִ֣ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
Good sense is a fountain of life to those who have it,
And folly is the punishment of fools.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב חָ֭כָם יַשְׂכִּ֣יל פִּ֑יהוּ וְעַל־שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו יֹסִ֥יף לֶֽקַח׃
translations.english:
The mind of the wise man makes his speech effective
And increases the wisdom on his lips.

translations.hebrew: צוּף־דְּ֭בַשׁ אִמְרֵי־נֹ֑עַם מָת֥וֹק לַ֝נֶּ֗פֶשׁ וּמַרְפֵּ֥א לָעָֽצֶם׃
translations.english:
Pleasant words are like a honeycomb,
Sweet to the palate and a cure for the body.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֤שׁ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יָ֭שָׁר לִפְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ דַּרְכֵי־מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
A road may seem right to a man,
But in the end it is a road to death.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֣פֶשׁ עָ֭מֵל עָ֣מְלָה לּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־אָכַ֖ף עָלָ֣יו פִּֽיהוּ׃
translations.english:
The appetite of a laborer labors for him,
Because his hungerbLit. “mouth.” cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.forces him on.-c

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ בְּ֭לִיַּעַל כֹּרֶ֣ה רָעָ֑ה וְעַל־[שְׂ֝פָת֗וֹ] (שפתיו) כְּאֵ֣שׁ צָרָֽבֶת׃
translations.english:
A scoundrel plotscMeaning of Heb. uncertain. evil;
What is on his lips is like a scorching fire.

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ תַּ֭הְפֻּכוֹת יְשַׁלַּ֣ח מָד֑וֹן וְ֝נִרְגָּ֗ן מַפְרִ֥יד אַלּֽוּף׃
translations.english:
A shifty man stirs up strife,
And a querulous one alienates his friend.

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ חָ֭מָס יְפַתֶּ֣ה רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝הוֹלִיכ֗וֹ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ לֹא־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
A lawless man misleads his friend,
Making him take the wrong way.

translations.hebrew: עֹצֶ֣ה עֵ֭ינָיו לַחְשֹׁ֣ב תַּהְפֻּכ֑וֹת קֹרֵ֥ץ שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו כִּלָּ֥ה רָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
He closes his eyes while meditating deception;
He purses his lips while deciding upon evil.

translations.hebrew: עֲטֶ֣רֶת תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת שֵׂיבָ֑ה בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ צְ֝דָקָ֗ה תִּמָּצֵֽא׃
translations.english:
Gray hair is a crown of glory;
It is attained by the way of righteousness.

translations.hebrew: ט֤וֹב אֶ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם מִגִּבּ֑וֹר וּמֹשֵׁ֥ל בְּ֝רוּח֗וֹ מִלֹּכֵ֥ד עִֽיר׃
translations.english:
Better to be forbearing than mighty,
To have self-control than to conquer a city.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭חֵיק יוּטַ֣ל אֶת־הַגּוֹרָ֑ל וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־מִשְׁפָּטֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Lots are cast into the lap;
The decision depends on the LORD.

translations.hebrew: ט֤וֹב פַּ֣ת חֲ֭רֵבָה וְשַׁלְוָה־בָ֑הּ מִ֝בַּ֗יִת מָלֵ֥א זִבְחֵי־רִֽיב׃
translations.english:
Better a dry crust with peace
Than a house full of feasting with strife.

translations.hebrew: עֶֽבֶד־מַשְׂכִּ֗יל יִ֭מְשֹׁל בְּבֵ֣ן מֵבִ֑ישׁ וּבְת֥וֹךְ אַ֝חִ֗ים יַחֲלֹ֥ק נַחֲלָֽה׃
translations.english:
A capable servant will dominate an incompetent son
And share the inheritance with the brothers.

translations.hebrew: מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וּבֹחֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
For silver—the crucible;
For gold—the furnace,
And the LORD tests the mind.

translations.hebrew: מֵ֭רַע מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־שְׂפַת־אָ֑וֶן שֶׁ֥קֶר מֵ֝זִ֗ין עַל־לְשׁ֥וֹן הַוֺּֽת׃
translations.english:
An evildoer listens to mischievous talk;
A liar gives ear to malicious words.

translations.hebrew: לֹעֵ֣ג לָ֭רָשׁ חֵרֵ֣ף עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ שָׂמֵ֥חַ לְ֝אֵ֗יד לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He who mocks the poor affronts his Maker;
He who rejoices over another’s misfortune will not go unpunished.

translations.hebrew: עֲטֶ֣רֶת זְ֭קֵנִים בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים וְתִפְאֶ֖רֶת בָּנִ֣ים אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
Grandchildren are the crown of their elders,
And the glory of children is their parents.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־נָאוָ֣ה לְנָבָ֣ל שְׂפַת־יֶ֑תֶר אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְנָדִ֥יב שְׂפַת־שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
Lofty words are not fitting for a villain;
Much less lying words for a great man.

translations.hebrew: אֶבֶן־חֵ֣ן הַ֭שֹּׁחַד בְּעֵינֵ֣י בְעָלָ֑יו אֶֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִפְנֶ֣ה יַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
A bribe seems like a charm to him who uses it;
He succeeds at every turn.

translations.hebrew: מְֽכַסֶּה־פֶּ֭שַׁע מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אַהֲבָ֑ה וְשֹׁנֶ֥ה בְ֝דָבָ֗ר מַפְרִ֥יד אַלּֽוּף׃
translations.english:
He who seeks love overlooks faults,
But he who harps on a matter alienates his friend.

translations.hebrew: תֵּ֣חַת גְּעָרָ֣ה בְמֵבִ֑ין מֵהַכּ֖וֹת כְּסִ֣יל מֵאָֽה׃
translations.english:
A rebuke works on an intelligent man
More than one hundred blows on a fool.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־מְרִ֥י יְבַקֶּשׁ־רָ֑ע וּמַלְאָ֥ךְ אַ֝כְזָרִ֗י יְשֻׁלַּח־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
An evil man seeks only to rebel;
A ruthless messenger will be sent against him.

translations.hebrew: פָּג֬וֹשׁ דֹּ֣ב שַׁכּ֣וּל בְּאִ֑ישׁ וְאַל־כְּ֝סִ֗יל בְּאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Sooner meet a bereaved she-bear
Than a fool with his nonsense.

translations.hebrew: מֵשִׁ֣יב רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה לֹא־[תָמ֥וּשׁ] (תמיש) רָ֝עָ֗ה מִבֵּיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Evil will never depart from the house
Of him who repays good with evil.

translations.hebrew: פּ֣וֹטֵֽר מַ֭יִם רֵאשִׁ֣ית מָד֑וֹן וְלִפְנֵ֥י הִ֝תְגַּלַּ֗ע הָרִ֥יב נְטֽוֹשׁ׃
translations.english:
To start a quarrel is to open a sluice;
Before a dispute aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.flares up,-a drop it.

translations.hebrew: מַצְדִּ֣יק רָ֭שָׁע וּמַרְשִׁ֣יעַ צַדִּ֑יק תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
To acquit the guilty and convict the innocent—
Both are an abomination to the LORD.

translations.hebrew: לָמָּה־זֶּ֣ה מְחִ֣יר בְּיַד־כְּסִ֑יל לִקְנ֖וֹת חׇכְמָ֣ה וְלֶב־אָֽיִן׃
translations.english:
What good is money in the hand of a fool
To purchase wisdom, when he has no mind?

translations.hebrew: בְּכׇל־עֵ֭ת אֹהֵ֣ב הָרֵ֑עַ וְאָ֥ח לְ֝צָרָ֗ה יִוָּלֵֽד׃
translations.english:
A friend is devoted at all times;
A brother is born to share adversity.

translations.hebrew: אָדָ֣ם חֲסַר־לֵ֭ב תּוֹקֵ֣עַ כָּ֑ף עֹרֵ֥ב עֲ֝רֻבָּ֗ה לִפְנֵ֥י רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Devoid of sense is he who gives his hand
To stand surety for his fellow.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֣הֵֽב פֶּ֭שַׁע אֹהֵ֣ב מַצָּ֑ה מַגְבִּ֥יהַּ פִּ֝תְח֗וֹ מְבַקֶּשׁ־שָֽׁבֶר׃
translations.english:
He who loves transgression loves strife;
He who builds a high threshold invites broken bones.

translations.hebrew: עִקֶּשׁ־לֵ֭ב לֹ֣א יִמְצָא־ט֑וֹב וְנֶהְפָּ֥ךְ בִּ֝לְשׁוֹנ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Man of crooked mind comes to no good,
And he who speaks duplicity falls into trouble.

translations.hebrew: יֹלֵ֣ד כְּ֭סִיל לְת֣וּגָה ל֑וֹ וְלֹא־יִ֝שְׂמַ֗ח אֲבִ֣י נָבָֽל׃
translations.english:
One begets a dullard to one’s own grief;
The father of a villain has no joy.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב שָׂ֭מֵחַ יֵיטִ֣יב גֵּהָ֑ה וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה תְּיַבֶּשׁ־גָּֽרֶם׃
translations.english:
A joyful heart makes for bOr “a cheerful face”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.good health;-b
Despondency dries up the bones.

translations.hebrew: שֹׁ֣חַד מֵ֭חֵק רָשָׁ֣ע יִקָּ֑ח לְ֝הַטּ֗וֹת אׇרְח֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
The wicked man draws a bribe out of his bosom
To pervert the course of justice.

translations.hebrew: אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י מֵבִ֣ין חׇכְמָ֑ה וְעֵינֵ֥י כְ֝סִ֗יל בִּקְצֵה־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Wisdom lies before the intelligent man;
The eyes of the dullard range to the ends of the earth.

translations.hebrew: כַּ֣עַס לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וּ֝מֶ֗מֶר לְיֽוֹלַדְתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A stupid son is vexation for his father
And a heartache for the woman who bore him.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֤ם עֲנ֣וֹשׁ לַצַּדִּ֣יק לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַכּ֖וֹת נְדִיבִ֣ים עַל־יֹֽשֶׁר׃
translations.english:
To punish the innocent is surely not right,
Or to flog the great for their uprightness.

translations.hebrew: חוֹשֵׂ֣ךְ אֲ֭מָרָיו יוֹדֵ֣עַ דָּ֑עַת (וקר) [יְקַר־]ר֝֗וּחַ אִ֣ישׁ תְּבוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
A knowledgeable man is sparing with his words;
A man of understanding is reticent.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֤ם אֱוִ֣יל מַ֭חֲרִישׁ חָכָ֣ם יֵחָשֵׁ֑ב אֹטֵ֖ם שְׂפָתָ֣יו נָבֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Even a fool, if he keeps silent, is deemed wise;
Intelligent, if he seals his lips.

translations.hebrew: לְֽ֭תַאֲוָה יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ נִפְרָ֑ד בְּכׇל־תּ֝וּשִׁיָּ֗ה יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.He who isolates himself pursues his desires;
He disdains all competence.-a

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יַחְפֹּ֣ץ כְּ֭סִיל בִּתְבוּנָ֑ה כִּ֝֗י אִֽם־בְּהִתְגַּלּ֥וֹת לִבּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The fool does not desire understanding,
But only to air his thoughts.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽבוֹא־רָ֭שָׁע בָּ֣א גַם־בּ֑וּז וְֽעִם־קָל֥וֹן חֶרְפָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Comes the wicked man comes derision,
And with the rogue, contempt.

translations.hebrew: מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים דִּבְרֵ֣י פִי־אִ֑ישׁ נַ֥חַל נֹ֝בֵ֗עַ מְק֣וֹר חׇכְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
The words a man speaks are deep waters,
A flowing stream, a fountain of wisdom.

translations.hebrew: שְׂאֵ֣ת פְּנֵי־רָשָׁ֣ע לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַטּ֥וֹת צַ֝דִּ֗יק בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
It is not right to be partial to the guilty
And subvert the innocent in judgment.

translations.hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל יָבֹ֣אוּ בְרִ֑יב וּ֝פִ֗יו לְֽמַהֲלֻמ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
The words of a fool lead to strife;
His speech invites blows.

translations.hebrew: פִּֽי־כְ֭סִיל מְחִתָּה־ל֑וֹ וּ֝שְׂפָתָ֗יו מוֹקֵ֥שׁ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
The fool’s speech is his ruin;
His words are a trap for him.

translations.hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
translations.english:
The words of a querulous man are bruising;aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.
They penetrate one’s inmost parts.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֭ם מִתְרַפֶּ֣ה בִמְלַאכְתּ֑וֹ אָ֥ח ה֝֗וּא לְבַ֣עַל מַשְׁחִֽית׃
translations.english:
One who is slack in his work
Is a brother to a vandal.

translations.hebrew: מִגְדַּל־עֹ֭ז שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה בּֽוֹ־יָר֖וּץ צַדִּ֣יק וְנִשְׂגָּֽב׃
translations.english:
The name of the LORD is a tower of strength
To which the righteous man runs and is safe.

translations.hebrew: ה֣וֹן עָ֭שִׁיר קִרְיַ֣ת עֻזּ֑וֹ וּכְחוֹמָ֥ה נִ֝שְׂגָּבָ֗ה בְּמַשְׂכִּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The wealth of a rich man is his fortress;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.In his fancy-a it is a protective wall.

translations.hebrew: לִפְנֵי־שֶׁ֭בֶר יִגְבַּ֣הּ לֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָב֣וֹד עֲנָוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Before ruin a man’s heart is proud;
Humility goes before honor.

translations.hebrew: מֵשִׁ֣יב דָּ֭בָר בְּטֶ֣רֶם יִשְׁמָ֑ע אִוֶּ֥לֶת הִיא־ל֝֗וֹ וּכְלִמָּֽה׃
translations.english:
To answer a man before hearing him out
Is foolish and disgraceful.

translations.hebrew: רֽוּחַ־אִ֭ישׁ יְכַלְכֵּ֣ל מַחֲלֵ֑הוּ וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה מִ֣י יִשָּׂאֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
A man’s spirit can sustain him through illness;
But low spirits—who can bear them?

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן יִקְנֶה־דָּ֑עַת וְאֹ֥זֶן חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים תְּבַקֶּשׁ־דָּֽעַת׃
translations.english:
The mind of an intelligent man acquires knowledge;
The ears of the wise seek out knowledge.

translations.hebrew: מַתָּ֣ן אָ֭דָם יַרְחִ֣יב ל֑וֹ וְלִפְנֵ֖י גְדֹלִ֣ים יַנְחֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
A man’s gift eases his way
And gives him access to the great.

translations.hebrew: צַדִּ֣יק הָרִאשׁ֣וֹן בְּרִיב֑וֹ (יבא) [וּבָֽא־]רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ וַחֲקָרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The first to plead his case seems right
Till the other party examines him.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭דְיָנִים יַשְׁבִּ֣ית הַגּוֹרָ֑ל וּבֵ֖ין עֲצוּמִ֣ים יַפְרִֽיד׃
translations.english:
The lot puts an end to strife
And separates those locked in dispute.

translations.hebrew: אָ֗ח נִפְשָׁ֥ע מִקִּרְיַת־עֹ֑ז (ומדונים) [וּ֝מִדְיָנִ֗ים] כִּבְרִ֥יחַ אַרְמֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
A brother offended is more formidable than a stronghold;
Such strife is like the bars of a fortress.

translations.hebrew: מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ תִּשְׂבַּ֣ע בִּטְנ֑וֹ תְּבוּאַ֖ת שְׂפָתָ֣יו יִשְׂבָּֽע׃
translations.english:
A man’s belly is filled by the fruit of his mouth;
He will be filled by the produce of his lips.

translations.hebrew: מָ֣וֶת וְ֭חַיִּים בְּיַד־לָשׁ֑וֹן וְ֝אֹהֲבֶ֗יהָ יֹאכַ֥ל פִּרְיָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue;
Those who love it will eat its fruit.

translations.hebrew: מָצָ֣א אִ֭שָּׁה מָ֣צָא ט֑וֹב וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
He who finds a wife has found happiness
And has won the favor of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: תַּחֲנוּנִ֥ים יְדַבֶּר־רָ֑שׁ וְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר יַעֲנֶ֥ה עַזּֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
The poor man speaks beseechingly;
The rich man’s answer is harsh.

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ רֵ֭עִים לְהִתְרֹעֵ֑עַ וְיֵ֥שׁ אֹ֝הֵ֗ב דָּבֵ֥ק מֵאָֽח׃
translations.english:
There are companions to keep one company,
And there is a friend more devoted than a brother.

translations.hebrew: טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו וְה֣וּא כְסִֽיל׃
translations.english:
Better a poor man who lives blamelessly
Than one who speaks perversely and is a dullard.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֤ם בְּלֹא־דַ֣עַת נֶ֣פֶשׁ לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְאָ֖ץ בְּרַגְלַ֣יִם חוֹטֵֽא׃
translations.english:
A person without knowledge is surely not good;
He who moves hurriedly blunders.

translations.hebrew: אִוֶּ֣לֶת אָ֭דָם תְּסַלֵּ֣ף דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְעַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִזְעַ֥ף לִבּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A man’s folly subverts his way,
And his heart rages against the LORD.

translations.hebrew: ה֗וֹן יֹ֭סִיף רֵעִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝דָ֗ל מֵרֵעֵ֥הוּ יִפָּרֵֽד׃
translations.english:
Wealth makes many friends,
But a poor man loses his last friend.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֥יחַ כְּ֝זָבִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִמָּלֵֽט׃
translations.english:
A false witness will not go unpunished;
He who testifies lies will not escape.

translations.hebrew: רַ֭בִּים יְחַלּ֣וּ פְנֵֽי־נָדִ֑יב וְכׇל־הָ֝רֵ֗עַ לְאִ֣ישׁ מַתָּֽן׃
translations.english:
Many court the favor of a great man,
And all are the friends of a dispenser of gifts.

translations.hebrew: כׇּ֥ל־אֲחֵי־רָ֨שׁ ׀ שְֽׂנֵאֻ֗הוּ אַ֤ף כִּ֣י מְ֭רֵעֵהוּ רָחֲק֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ מְרַדֵּ֖ף אֲמָרִ֣ים (לא) [לוֹ־]הֵֽמָּה׃
translations.english:
All the brothers of a poor man despise him;
How much more is he shunned by his friends!
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.He who pursues words—they are of no avail.-a

translations.hebrew: קֹֽנֶה־לֵּ֭ב אֹהֵ֣ב נַפְשׁ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֥ר תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה לִמְצֹא־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
He who acquires wisdom is his own best friend;
He preserves understanding and attains happiness.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֖יחַ כְּזָבִ֣ים יֹאבֵֽד׃ {פ}
translations.english:
A false witness will not go unpunished;
He who testifies falsely is doomed.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־נָאוֶ֣ה לִכְסִ֣יל תַּעֲנ֑וּג אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְעֶ֤בֶד ׀ מְשֹׁ֬ל בְּשָׂרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Luxury is not fitting for a dullard,
Much less that a servant rule over princes.

translations.hebrew: שֵׂ֣כֶל אָ֭דָם הֶאֱרִ֣יךְ אַפּ֑וֹ וְ֝תִפְאַרְתּ֗וֹ עֲבֹ֣ר עַל־פָּֽשַׁע׃
translations.english:
A man shows intelligence by his forebearance;
It is his glory when he overlooks an offense.

translations.hebrew: נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר זַ֣עַף מֶ֑לֶךְ וּכְטַ֖ל עַל־עֵ֣שֶׂב רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The rage of a king is like the roar of a lion;
His favor is like dew upon the grass.

translations.hebrew: הַוֺּ֣ת לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וְדֶ֥לֶף טֹ֝רֵ֗ד מִדְיְנֵ֥י אִשָּֽׁה׃
translations.english:
A stupid son is a calamity to his father;
The nagging of a wife is like the endless dripping of water.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֣יִת וָ֭הוֹן נַחֲלַ֣ת אָב֑וֹת וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה אִשָּׁ֥ה מַשְׂכָּֽלֶת׃
translations.english:
Property and riches are bequeathed by fathers,
But an efficient wife comes from the LORD.

translations.hebrew: עַ֭צְלָה תַּפִּ֣יל תַּרְדֵּמָ֑ה וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ רְמִיָּ֣ה תִרְעָֽב׃
translations.english:
Laziness induces sleep,
And a negligent person will go hungry.

translations.hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֣ר מִ֭צְוָה שֹׁמֵ֣ר נַפְשׁ֑וֹ בּוֹזֵ֖ה דְרָכָ֣יו (יומת) [יָמֽוּת]׃
translations.english:
He who has regard for his life pays regard to commandments;
He who is heedless of his ways will die.

translations.hebrew: מַלְוֵ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה ח֣וֹנֵֽן דָּ֑ל וּ֝גְמֻל֗וֹ יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He who is generous to the poor makes a loan to the LORD;
He will repay him his due.

translations.hebrew: יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ כִּֽי־יֵ֣שׁ תִּקְוָ֑ה וְאֶל־הֲ֝מִית֗וֹ אַל־תִּשָּׂ֥א נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
translations.english:
Discipline your son while there is still hope,
AndbOr “But.” do not cOr “pay attention to his moaning.”set your heart on his destruction.-c

translations.hebrew: (גרל) [גְּֽדׇל־]חֵ֭מָה נֹ֣שֵׂא עֹ֑נֶשׁ כִּ֥י אִם־תַּ֝צִּ֗יל וְע֣וֹד תּוֹסִֽף׃
translations.english:
A hot-tempered man incurs punishment;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.If you try to save him you will only make it worse.-a

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע עֵ֭צָה וְקַבֵּ֣ל מוּסָ֑ר לְ֝מַ֗עַן תֶּחְכַּ֥ם בְּאַחֲרִיתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Listen to advice and accept discipline
In order that you may be wise in the end.

translations.hebrew: רַבּ֣וֹת מַחֲשָׁב֣וֹת בְּלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וַעֲצַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הִ֣יא תָקֽוּם׃
translations.english:
Many designs are in a man’s mind,
But it is the LORD’s plan that is accomplished.

translations.hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת אָדָ֣ם חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְטֽוֹב־רָ֝֗שׁ מֵאִ֥ישׁ כָּזָֽב׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Greed is a reproach to a man;-a
Better be poor than a liar.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה לְחַיִּ֑ים וְשָׂבֵ֥עַ יָ֝לִ֗ין בַּל־יִפָּ֥קֶד רָֽע׃
translations.english:
He who fears the LORD earns life;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.He shall abide in contentment,-a
Free from misfortune.

translations.hebrew: טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת גַּם־אֶל־פִּ֝֗יהוּ לֹ֣א יְשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl;
He will not even bring it to his mouth.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ץ תַּ֭כֶּה וּפֶ֣תִי יַעְרִ֑ם וְהוֹכִ֥יחַ לְ֝נָב֗וֹן יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Beat the scoffer and the simple will become clever;
Reprove an intelligent man and he gains knowledge.

translations.hebrew: מְֽשַׁדֶּד־אָ֭ב יַבְרִ֣יחַ אֵ֑ם בֵּ֝֗ן מֵבִ֥ישׁ וּמַחְפִּֽיר׃
translations.english:
A son who causes shame and disgrace
Plunders his father, puts his mother to flight.

translations.hebrew: חֲֽדַל־בְּ֭נִי לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ מוּסָ֑ר לִ֝שְׁג֗וֹת מֵאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
My son, cease to stray from words of knowledge
And receive discipline.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֣ד בְּ֭לִיַּעַל יָלִ֣יץ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְבַלַּע־אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
A malicious witness scoffs at justice,
And the speech of the wicked conceals mischief.

translations.hebrew: נָכ֣וֹנוּ לַלֵּצִ֣ים שְׁפָטִ֑ים וּ֝מַהֲלֻמ֗וֹת לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃
translations.english:
Punishments are in store for scoffers
And blows for the backs of dullards.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ץ הַ֭יַּיִן הֹמֶ֣ה שֵׁכָ֑ר וְכׇל־שֹׁ֥גֶה בּ֝֗וֹ לֹ֣א יֶחְכָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Wine is a scoffer, strong drink a roisterer;
He who is muddled by them will not grow wise.

translations.hebrew: נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר אֵ֣ימַת מֶ֑לֶךְ מִ֝תְעַבְּר֗וֹ חוֹטֵ֥א נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
The terror of a king is like the roar of a lion;
He who provokes his anger risks his life.

translations.hebrew: כָּב֣וֹד לָ֭אִישׁ שֶׁ֣בֶת מֵרִ֑יב וְכׇל־אֱ֝וִ֗יל יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃
translations.english:
It is honorable for a man to desist from strife,
But every fool aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.becomes embroiled.-a

translations.hebrew: מֵ֭חֹרֶף עָצֵ֣ל לֹא־יַחֲרֹ֑שׁ (ישאל) [וְשָׁאַ֖ל] בַּקָּצִ֣יר וָאָֽיִן׃
translations.english:
In winter the lazy man does not plow;
At harvesttime he seeks, and finds nothing.

translations.hebrew: מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים עֵצָ֣ה בְלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּבוּנָ֣ה יִדְלֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
The designs in a man’s mind are deep waters,
But a man of understanding can draw them out.

translations.hebrew: רׇב־אָדָ֗ם יִ֭קְרָא אִ֣ישׁ חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֱ֝מוּנִ֗ים מִ֣י יִמְצָֽא׃
translations.english:
He calls many a man his loyal friend,
But who can find a faithful man?

translations.hebrew: מִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֣וֹ צַדִּ֑יק אַשְׁרֵ֖י בָנָ֣יו אַחֲרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
The righteous man lives blamelessly;
Happy are his children who come after him.

translations.hebrew: מֶ֗לֶךְ יוֹשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסֵּא־דִ֑ין מְזָרֶ֖ה בְעֵינָ֣יו כׇּל־רָֽע׃
translations.english:
The king seated on the throne of judgment
Can winnow out all evil by his glance.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־יֹ֭אמַר זִכִּ֣יתִי לִבִּ֑י טָ֝הַ֗רְתִּי מֵחַטָּאתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart,
I am purged of my sin”?

translations.hebrew: אֶ֣בֶן וָ֭אֶבֶן אֵיפָ֣ה וְאֵיפָ֑ה תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
False weights and false measures,
Both are an abomination to the LORD.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֣ם בְּ֭מַעֲלָלָיו יִתְנַכֶּר־נָ֑עַר אִם־זַ֖ךְ וְאִם־יָשָׁ֣ר פׇּעֳלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A child may be dissembling in his behavior
Even though his actions are blameless and proper.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֣זֶן שֹׁ֭מַעַת וְעַ֣יִן רֹאָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עָשָׂ֥ה גַם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
The ear that hears, the eye that sees—
The LORD made them both.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֶּאֱהַ֣ב שֵׁ֭נָה פֶּן־תִּוָּרֵ֑שׁ פְּקַ֖ח עֵינֶ֣יךָ שְֽׂבַֽע־לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
Do not love sleep lest you be impoverished;
Keep your eyes open and you will have plenty of food.

translations.hebrew: רַ֣ע רַ֭ע יֹאמַ֣ר הַקּוֹנֶ֑ה וְאֹזֵ֥ל ל֝֗וֹ אָ֣ז יִתְהַלָּֽל׃
translations.english:
“Bad, bad,” says the buyer,
But having moved off, he congratulates himself.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ זָ֭הָב וְרׇב־פְּנִינִ֑ים וּכְלִ֥י יְ֝קָ֗ר שִׂפְתֵי־דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Gold is plentiful, jewels abundant,
But wise speech is a precious object.

translations.hebrew: לְֽקַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד (נכרים) [נׇכְרִיָּ֣ה] חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another;bOr “a stranger.”
Take it as a pledge, [for he stood surety] for an unfamiliar woman.

translations.hebrew: עָרֵ֣ב לָ֭אִישׁ לֶ֣חֶם שָׁ֑קֶר וְ֝אַחַ֗ר יִמָּֽלֵא־פִ֥יהוּ חָצָֽץ׃
translations.english:
Bread gained by fraud may be tasty to a man,
But later his mouth will be filled with gravel.

translations.hebrew: מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת בְּעֵצָ֣ה תִכּ֑וֹן וּ֝בְתַחְבֻּל֗וֹת עֲשֵׂ֣ה מִלְחָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Plans laid in council will succeed;
Wage war with stratagems.

translations.hebrew: גּֽוֹלֶה־סּ֭וֹד הוֹלֵ֣ךְ רָכִ֑יל וּלְפֹתֶ֥ה שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִתְעָרָֽב׃
translations.english:
He who gives away secrets is a base fellow;
Do not take up with a garrulous man.

translations.hebrew: מְ֭קַלֵּל אָבִ֣יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ יִֽדְעַ֥ךְ נֵ֝ר֗וֹ (באישון) [בֶּאֱשׁ֥וּן] חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
translations.english:
One who reviles his father or mother,
Light will fail him when darkness comes.

translations.hebrew: נַ֭חֲלָה (מבחלת) [מְבֹהֶ֣לֶת] בָּרִאשׁוֹנָ֑ה וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ לֹ֣א תְבֹרָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
An estate acquired in haste at the outset
Will not be blessed in the end.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֹּאמַ֥ר אֲשַׁלְּמָה־רָ֑ע קַוֵּ֥ה לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה וְיֹ֣שַֽׁע לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Do not say, “I will requite evil”;
Put your hope in the LORD and He will deliver you.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה אֶ֣בֶן וָאָ֑בֶן וּמֹאזְנֵ֖י מִרְמָ֣ה לֹא־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
False weights are an abomination to the LORD;
Dishonest scales are not right.

translations.hebrew: מֵיְהֹוָ֥ה מִצְעֲדֵי־גָ֑בֶר וְ֝אָדָ֗ם מַה־יָּבִ֥ין דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A man’s steps are decided by the LORD;
What does a man know about his own way?

translations.hebrew: מוֹקֵ֣שׁ אָ֭דָם יָ֣לַע קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְאַחַ֖ר נְדָרִ֣ים לְבַקֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
It is a snare for a man aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.to pledge a sacred gift rashly-a
And to give thought to his vows only after they have been made.

translations.hebrew: מְזָרֶ֣ה רְ֭שָׁעִים מֶ֣לֶךְ חָכָ֑ם וַיָּ֖שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם אוֹפָֽן׃
translations.english:
A wise king winnows out the wicked,
And turns the wheel upon them.

translations.hebrew: נֵ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה נִשְׁמַ֣ת אָדָ֑ם חֹ֝פֵ֗שׂ כׇּל־חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
translations.english:
The lifebreath of man is the lamp of the LORD
Revealing all his inmost parts.

translations.hebrew: חֶ֣סֶד וֶ֭אֱמֶת יִצְּרוּ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְסָעַ֖ד בַּחֶ֣סֶד כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Faithfulness and loyalty protect the king;
He maintains his throne by faithfulness.

translations.hebrew: תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת בַּחוּרִ֣ים כֹּחָ֑ם וַהֲדַ֖ר זְקֵנִ֣ים שֵׂיבָֽה׃
translations.english:
The glory of youths is their strength;
The majesty of old men is their gray hair.

translations.hebrew: חַבֻּר֣וֹת פֶּ֭צַע (תמריק) [תַּמְר֣וּק] בְּרָ֑ע וּ֝מַכּ֗וֹת חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
translations.english:
Bruises and wounds are repaymentaMeaning of Heb. uncertain. for evil,
Striking at one’s inmost parts.

translations.hebrew: פַּלְגֵי־מַ֣יִם לֶב־מֶ֭לֶךְ בְּיַד־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יַחְפֹּ֣ץ יַטֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
Like channeled water is the mind of the king in the LORD’s hand;
He directs it to whatever He wishes.

translations.hebrew: כׇּֽל־דֶּרֶךְ־אִ֭ישׁ יָשָׁ֣ר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְתֹכֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
All the ways of a man seem right to him,
But the LORD probes the mind.

translations.hebrew: עֲ֭שֹׂה צְדָקָ֣ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט נִבְחָ֖ר לַיהֹוָ֣ה מִזָּֽבַח׃
translations.english:
To do what is right and just
Is more desired by the LORD than sacrifice.

translations.hebrew: רוּם־עֵ֭ינַיִם וּרְחַב־לֵ֑ב נִ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים חַטָּֽאת׃
translations.english:
Haughty looks, a proud heart—
The tillage of the wicked is sinful.

translations.hebrew: מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת חָ֭רוּץ אַךְ־לְמוֹתָ֑ר וְכׇל־אָ֝֗ץ אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
The plans of the diligent make only for gain;
All rash haste makes only for loss.

translations.hebrew: פֹּ֣עַל אֹ֭צָרוֹת בִּלְשׁ֣וֹן שָׁ֑קֶר הֶ֥בֶל נִ֝דָּ֗ף מְבַקְשֵׁי־מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
Treasures acquired by a lying tongue
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Are like driven vapor, heading for extinction.-a

translations.hebrew: שֹׁד־רְשָׁעִ֥ים יְגוֹרֵ֑ם כִּ֥י מֵ֝אֲנ֗וּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
The violence of the wicked sweeps them away,
For they refuse to act justly.

translations.hebrew: הֲפַכְפַּ֬ךְ דֶּ֣רֶךְ אִ֣ישׁ וָזָ֑ר וְ֝זַ֗ךְ יָשָׁ֥ר פׇּעֳלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The way of a man may be tortuous and strange,
Though his actions are blameless and proper.

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב לָשֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃
translations.english:
Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better
Than a contentious wife in a aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.spacious house.-a

translations.hebrew: נֶ֣פֶשׁ רָ֭שָׁע אִוְּתָה־רָ֑ע לֹֽא־יֻחַ֖ן בְּעֵינָ֣יו רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
The desire of the wicked is set upon evil;
His fellowman finds no favor in his eyes.

translations.hebrew: בַּֽעֲנׇשׁ־לֵ֭ץ יֶחְכַּם־פֶּ֑תִי וּבְהַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְ֝חָכָ֗ם יִקַּח־דָּֽעַת׃
translations.english:
When a scoffer is punished, the simple man is edified;
When a wise man is taught, he gains insight.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֣יל צַ֭דִּיק לְבֵ֣ית רָשָׁ֑ע מְסַלֵּ֖ף רְשָׁעִ֣ים לָרָֽע׃
translations.english:
The Righteous One observes the house of the wicked man;
He subverts the wicked to their ruin.

translations.hebrew: אֹטֵ֣ם אׇ֭זְנוֹ מִזַּעֲקַת־דָּ֑ל גַּֽם־ה֥וּא יִ֝קְרָ֗א וְלֹ֣א יֵעָנֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Who stops his ears at the cry of the wretched,
He too will call and not be answered.

translations.hebrew: מַתָּ֣ן בַּ֭סֵּתֶר יִכְפֶּה־אָ֑ף וְשֹׁ֥חַד בַּ֝חֵ֗ק חֵמָ֥ה עַזָּֽה׃
translations.english:
A gift in secret subdues anger,
A present in private, fierce rage.

translations.hebrew: שִׂמְחָ֣ה לַ֭צַּדִּיק עֲשׂ֣וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝מְחִתָּ֗ה לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Justice done is a joy to the righteous,
To evildoers, ruination.

translations.hebrew: אָדָ֗ם תּ֭וֹעֶה מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ הַשְׂכֵּ֑ל בִּקְהַ֖ל רְפָאִ֣ים יָנֽוּחַ׃
translations.english:
A man who strays from the path of prudence
Will rest in the company of ghosts.

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ מַ֭חְסוֹר אֹהֵ֣ב שִׂמְחָ֑ה אֹהֵ֥ב יַֽיִן־וָ֝שֶׁ֗מֶן לֹ֣א יַעֲשִֽׁיר׃
translations.english:
He who loves pleasure comes to want;
He who loves wine and oil does not grow rich.

translations.hebrew: כֹּ֣פֶר לַצַּדִּ֣יק רָשָׁ֑ע וְתַ֖חַת יְשָׁרִ֣ים בּוֹגֵֽד׃
translations.english:
The wicked are the ransom of the righteous;
The traitor comes in place of the upright.

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִדְבָּ֑ר מֵאֵ֖שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִדְיָנִ֣ים] וָכָֽעַס׃
translations.english:
It is better to live in the desert
Than with a contentious, vexatious wife.

translations.hebrew: אוֹצָ֤ר ׀ נֶחְמָ֣ד וָ֭שֶׁמֶן בִּנְוֵ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וּכְסִ֖יל אָדָ֣ם יְבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
Precious treasure and oil are in the house of the wise man,
And a fool of a man will run through them.

translations.hebrew: רֹ֭דֵף צְדָקָ֣ה וָחָ֑סֶד יִמְצָ֥א חַ֝יִּ֗ים צְדָקָ֥ה וְכָבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
He who strives to do good and kind deeds
Attains life, success, and honor.

translations.hebrew: עִ֣יר גִּ֭בֹּרִים עָלָ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וַ֝יֹּ֗רֶד עֹ֣ז מִבְטֶחָֽהֿ׃
translations.english:
One wise man prevailed over a city of warriors
And brought down its mighty stronghold.

translations.hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֣ר פִּ֭יו וּלְשׁוֹנ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֖ר מִצָּר֣וֹת נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
He who guards his mouth and tongue
Guards himself from trouble.

translations.hebrew: זֵ֣ד יָ֭הִיר לֵ֣ץ שְׁמ֑וֹ ע֝וֹשֶׂ֗ה בְּעֶבְרַ֥ת זָדֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
The proud, insolent man, scoffer is his name,
Acts in a frenzy of insolence.

translations.hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת עָצֵ֣ל תְּמִיתֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־מֵאֲנ֖וּ יָדָ֣יו לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
translations.english:
The craving of a lazy man kills him,
For his hands refuse to work.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם הִתְאַוָּ֣ה תַאֲוָ֑ה וְצַדִּ֥יק יִ֝תֵּ֗ן וְלֹ֣א יַחְשֹֽׂךְ׃
translations.english:
All day long he is seized with craving
While the righteous man gives without stint.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֣בַח רְ֭שָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָ֑ה אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־בְזִמָּ֥ה יְבִיאֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
The sacrifice of the wicked man is an abomination,
The more so as he offers it in depravity.

translations.hebrew: עֵד־כְּזָבִ֥ים יֹאבֵ֑ד וְאִ֥ישׁ שׁ֝וֹמֵ֗עַ לָנֶ֥צַח יְדַבֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
A false witness is doomed,
But one who really heard will testify with success.

translations.hebrew: הֵעֵ֬ז אִ֣ישׁ רָשָׁ֣ע בְּפָנָ֑יו וְ֝יָשָׁ֗ר ה֤וּא ׀ (יכין דרכיו) [יָבִ֬ין דַּרְכּֽוֹ]׃
translations.english:
The wicked man is brazen-faced;
The upright man discerns his course.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֣ין חׇ֭כְמָה וְאֵ֣ין תְּבוּנָ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין עֵ֝צָ֗ה לְנֶ֣גֶד יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
translations.english:
No wisdom, no prudence, and no counsel
Can prevail against the LORD.

translations.hebrew: ס֗וּס מ֭וּכָן לְי֣וֹם מִלְחָמָ֑ה וְ֝לַיהֹוָ֗ה הַתְּשׁוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
The horse is readied for the day of battle,
But victory comes from the LORD.

translations.hebrew: נִבְחָ֣ר שֵׁ֭ם מֵעֹ֣שֶׁר רָ֑ב מִכֶּ֥סֶף וּ֝מִזָּהָ֗ב חֵ֣ן טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Repute is preferable to great wealth,
Grace is better than silver and gold.

translations.hebrew: עָשִׁ֣יר וָרָ֣שׁ נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ עֹשֵׂ֖ה כֻלָּ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Rich man and poor man meet;
The LORD made them both.

translations.hebrew: עָר֤וּם ׀ רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה (ויסתר) [וְנִסְתָּ֑ר] וּ֝פְתָיִ֗ים עָבְר֥וּ וְֽנֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover;
The simple kept going and paid the penalty.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֣קֶב עֲ֭נָוָה יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֖שֶׁר וְכָב֣וֹד וְחַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
The effect of humility is fear of the LORD,
Wealth, honor, and life.

translations.hebrew: צִנִּ֣ים פַּ֭חִים בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ עִקֵּ֑שׁ שׁוֹמֵ֥ר נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ יִרְחַ֥ק מֵהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Thorns and snares are in the path of the crooked;
He who values his life will keep far from them.

translations.hebrew: חֲנֹ֣ךְ לַ֭נַּעַר עַל־פִּ֣י דַרְכּ֑וֹ גַּ֥ם כִּי־יַ֝זְקִ֗ין לֹא־יָס֥וּר מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
Train a lad in the way he ought to go;
He will not swerve from it even in old age.

translations.hebrew: עָ֭שִׁיר בְּרָשִׁ֣ים יִמְשׁ֑וֹל וְעֶ֥בֶד לֹ֝וֶ֗ה לְאִ֣ישׁ מַלְוֶֽה׃
translations.english:
The rich rule the poor,
And the borrower is a slave to the lender.

translations.hebrew: זוֹרֵ֣עַ עַ֭וְלָה (יקצור) [יִקְצׇר־]אָ֑וֶן וְשֵׁ֖בֶט עֶבְרָת֣וֹ יִכְלֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He who sows injustice shall reap misfortune;
His rod of wrath shall fail.

translations.hebrew: טֽוֹב־עַ֭יִן ה֣וּא יְבֹרָ֑ךְ כִּֽי־נָתַ֖ן מִלַּחְמ֣וֹ לַדָּֽל׃
translations.english:
The generous man is blessed,
For he gives of his bread to the poor.

translations.hebrew: גָּ֣רֵֽשׁ לֵ֭ץ וְיֵצֵ֣א מָד֑וֹן וְ֝יִשְׁבֹּ֗ת דִּ֣ין וְקָלֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Expel the scoffer and contention departs,
Quarrel and contumely cease.

translations.hebrew: אֹהֵ֥ב (טהור) [טְהׇר־]לֵ֑ב חֵ֥ן שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו רֵעֵ֥הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ׃
translations.english:
A pure-hearted friend,
His speech is gracious;
He has the king for his companion.

translations.hebrew: עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה נָ֣צְרוּ דָ֑עַת וַ֝יְסַלֵּ֗ף דִּבְרֵ֥י בֹגֵֽד׃
translations.english:
The eyes of the LORD watch the wise man;
He subverts the words of the treacherous.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל אֲרִ֣י בַח֑וּץ בְּת֥וֹךְ רְ֝חֹב֗וֹת אֵרָצֵֽחַ׃
translations.english:
The lazy man says, “There’s a lion in the street;
I shall be killed aLit. “in the square.”if I step outside.”-a

translations.hebrew: שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲ֭מֻקָּה פִּ֣י זָר֑וֹת זְע֥וּם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה (יפול) [יִפׇּל־]שָֽׁם׃
translations.english:
The mouth of a forbiddenbLit. “strange.” woman is a deep pit;
He who is doomed by the LORD falls into it.

translations.hebrew: אִ֭וֶּלֶת קְשׁוּרָ֣ה בְלֶב־נָ֑עַר שֵׁ֥בֶט מ֝וּסָ֗ר יַרְחִיקֶ֥נָּה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
If folly settles in the heart of a lad,
The rod of discipline will remove it.

translations.hebrew: עֹ֣שֵֽׁק דָּ֭ל לְהַרְבּ֣וֹת ל֑וֹ נֹתֵ֥ן לְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
To profit by withholding what is due to the poor
Is like making gifts to the rich—pure loss.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥ט אׇזְנְךָ֗ וּ֭שְׁמַע דִּבְרֵ֣י חֲכָמִ֑ים וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ תָּשִׁ֥ית לְדַעְתִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Incline your ear and listen to the words of the sages;
Pay attention to my wisdom.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־נָ֭עִים כִּֽי־תִשְׁמְרֵ֣ם בְּבִטְנֶ֑ךָ יִכֹּ֥נוּ יַ֝חְדָּ֗ו עַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
It is good that you store them inside you,
And that all of them be constantly on your lips,

translations.hebrew: לִֽהְי֣וֹת בַּ֭יהֹוָה מִבְטַחֶ֑ךָ הוֹדַעְתִּ֖יךָ הַיּ֣וֹם אַף־אָֽתָּה׃
translations.english:
That you may put your trust in the LORD.
I let you know today—yes, you—

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹ֤א כָתַ֣בְתִּֽי לְ֭ךָ (שלשום) [שָׁלִישִׁ֑ים] בְּמֹ֖עֵצ֣וֹת וָדָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Indeed, I wrote down for you cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.a threefold lore,-c
Wise counsel,

translations.hebrew: לְהֽוֹדִיעֲךָ֗ קֹ֭שְׁטְ אִמְרֵ֣י אֱמֶ֑ת לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֲמָרִ֥ים אֱ֝מֶ֗ת לְשֹׁלְחֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
To let you know truly reliable words,
That you may give a faithful reply to him who sent you.

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־תִּגְזׇל־דָּ֭ל כִּ֣י דַל־ה֑וּא וְאַל־תְּדַכֵּ֖א עָנִ֣י בַשָּֽׁעַר׃
translations.english:
Do not rob the wretched because he is wretched;
Do not crush the poor man in the gate;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יְ֭הֹוָה יָרִ֣יב רִיבָ֑ם וְקָבַ֖ע אֶת־קֹבְעֵיהֶ֣ם נָֽפֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
For the LORD will take up their cause
And despoil those who despoil them of life.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭תְרַע אֶת־בַּ֣עַל אָ֑ף וְאֶת־אִ֥ישׁ חֵ֝מ֗וֹת לֹ֣א תָבֽוֹא׃
translations.english:
Do not associate with an irascible man,
Or go about with one who is hot-tempered,

translations.hebrew: פֶּן־תֶּאֱלַ֥ף אֹרְחֹתָ֑ו וְלָקַחְתָּ֖ מוֹקֵ֣שׁ לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
translations.english:
Lest you learn his ways
And find yourself ensnared.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְתֹֽקְעֵי־כָ֑ף בַּ֝עֹרְבִ֗ים מַשָּׁאֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Do not be one of those who give their hand,
Who stand surety for debts,

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֵֽין־לְךָ֥ לְשַׁלֵּ֑ם לָ֥מָּה יִקַּ֥ח מִ֝שְׁכָּבְךָ֗ מִתַּחְתֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Lest your bed be taken from under you
When you have no money to pay.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֲבוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Do not remove the ancient boundary stone
That your ancestors set up.

translations.hebrew: חָזִ֡יתָ אִ֤ישׁ ׀ מָ֘הִ֤יר בִּמְלַאכְתּ֗וֹ לִֽפְנֵי־מְלָכִ֥ים יִתְיַצָּ֑ב בַּל־יִ֝תְיַצֵּ֗ב לִפְנֵ֥י חֲשֻׁכִּֽים׃ {פ}
translations.english:
See a man skilled at his work—
He shall attend upon kings;
He shall not attend upon cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.obscure men.-c

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵ֭שֵׁב לִלְח֣וֹם אֶת־מוֹשֵׁ֑ל בִּ֥ין תָּ֝בִ֗ין אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
When you sit down to dine with a ruler,
Consider well who is before you.

translations.hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ שַׂכִּ֣ין בְּלֹעֶ֑ךָ אִם־בַּ֖עַל נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָֽתָּה׃
translations.english:
Thrust a knife into your gullet
If you have a large appetite.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭תְאָו לְמַטְעַמּוֹתָ֑יו וְ֝ה֗וּא לֶ֣חֶם כְּזָבִֽים׃
translations.english:
Do not crave for his dainties,
For they are counterfeit food.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּיגַ֥ע לְֽהַעֲשִׁ֑יר מִֽבִּינָתְךָ֥ חֲדָֽל׃
translations.english:
Do not toil to gain wealth;
Have the sense to desist.

translations.hebrew: (התעוף) [הֲתָ֤עִיף]־עֵינֶ֥יךָ בּ֗וֹ וְֽאֵ֫ינֶ֥נּוּ כִּ֤י עָשֹׂ֣ה יַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ כְנָפַ֑יִם כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר (ועיף) [יָע֥וּף] הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {פ}
translations.english:
You see it, then it is gone;
It grows wings and flies away,
Like an eagle, heavenward.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּלְחַ֗ם אֶת־לֶ֭חֶם רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְאַל־תִּ֝תְאָ֗ו לְמַטְעַמֹּתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Do not eat of a stingy man’s food;
Do not crave for his dainties;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ כְּמ֥וֹ שָׁעַ֥ר בְּנַפְשׁ֗וֹ כֶּ֫ן־ה֥וּא אֱכ֣וֹל וּ֭שְׁתֵה יֹ֣אמַר לָ֑ךְ וְ֝לִבּ֗וֹ בַּל־עִמָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
He is like one keeping accounts;
“Eat and drink,” he says to you,
But he does not really mean it.

translations.hebrew: פִּֽתְּךָ־אָכַ֥לְתָּ תְקִיאֶ֑נָּה וְ֝שִׁחַ֗תָּ דְּבָרֶ֥יךָ הַנְּעִימִֽים׃
translations.english:
The morsel you eat you will vomit;
You will waste your courteous words.

translations.hebrew: בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל אַל־תְּדַבֵּ֑ר כִּי־יָ֝ב֗וּז לְשֵׂ֣כֶל מִלֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Do not speak to a dullard,
For he will disdain your sensible words.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם וּבִשְׂדֵ֥י יְ֝תוֹמִ֗ים אַל־תָּבֹֽא׃
translations.english:
Do not remove ancient boundary stones;
Do not encroach upon the field of orphans,

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־גֹאֲלָ֥ם חָזָ֑ק הֽוּא־יָרִ֖יב אֶת־רִיבָ֣ם אִתָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For they have a mighty Kinsman,
And He will surely take up their cause with you.

translations.hebrew: הָבִ֣יאָה לַמּוּסָ֣ר לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝אׇזְנֶ֗ךָ לְאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Apply your mind to discipline
And your ears to wise sayings.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּמְנַ֣ע מִנַּ֣עַר מוּסָ֑ר כִּֽי־תַכֶּ֥נּוּ בַ֝שֵּׁ֗בֶט לֹ֣א יָמֽוּת׃
translations.english:
Do not withhold discipline from a child;
If you beat him with a rod he will not die.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭תָּה בַּשֵּׁ֣בֶט תַּכֶּ֑נּוּ וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ מִשְּׁא֥וֹל תַּצִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
Beat him with a rod
And you will save him from the grave.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אִם־חָכַ֣ם לִבֶּ֑ךָ יִשְׂמַ֖ח לִבִּ֣י גַם־אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
My son, if your mind gets wisdom,
My mind, too, will be gladdened.

translations.hebrew: וְתַעְלֹ֥זְנָה כִלְיוֹתָ֑י בְּדַבֵּ֥ר שְׂ֝פָתֶ֗יךָ מֵישָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
I shall rejoice with all my heartaLit. “kidneys.”
When your lips speak right things.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יְקַנֵּ֣א לִ֭בְּךָ בַּחַטָּאִ֑ים כִּ֥י אִם־בְּיִרְאַת־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Do not envy sinners in your heart,
But only God-fearing men, at all times,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י אִם־יֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃
translations.english:
For then you will have a future,
And your hope will never fail.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַע־אַתָּ֣ה בְנִ֣י וַחֲכָ֑ם וְאַשֵּׁ֖ר בַּדֶּ֣רֶךְ לִבֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Listen, my son, and get wisdom;
Lead your mind in a [proper] path.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְסֹֽבְאֵי־יָ֑יִן בְּזֹלְלֵ֖י בָשָׂ֣ר לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
Do not be of those who guzzle wine,
Or glut themselves on meat;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־סֹבֵ֣א וְ֭זוֹלֵל יִוָּרֵ֑שׁ וּ֝קְרָעִ֗ים תַּלְבִּ֥ישׁ נוּמָֽה׃
translations.english:
For guzzlers and gluttons will be impoverished,
And drowsing will clothe you in tatters.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע לְ֭אָבִיךָ זֶ֣ה יְלָדֶ֑ךָ וְאַל־תָּ֝ב֗וּז כִּֽי־זָקְנָ֥ה אִמֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Listen to your father who begot you;
Do not disdain your mother when she is old.

translations.hebrew: אֱמֶ֣ת קְ֭נֵה וְאַל־תִּמְכֹּ֑ר חׇכְמָ֖ה וּמוּסָ֣ר וּבִינָֽה׃
translations.english:
Buy truth and never sell it,
And wisdom, discipline, and understanding.

translations.hebrew: (גול) [גִּ֣יל] יָ֭גִיל אֲבִ֣י צַדִּ֑יק (יולד) [וְיוֹלֵ֥ד] חָ֝כָ֗ם (וישמח) [יִשְׂמַח־]בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The father of a righteous man will exult;
He who begets a wise son will rejoice in him.

translations.hebrew: יִֽשְׂמַח־אָבִ֥יךָ וְאִמֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝תָגֵ֗ל יוֹלַדְתֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Your father and mother will rejoice;
She who bore you will exult.

translations.hebrew: תְּנָה־בְנִ֣י לִבְּךָ֣ לִ֑י וְ֝עֵינֶ֗יךָ דְּרָכַ֥י (תרצנה) [תִּצֹּֽרְנָה]׃
translations.english:
Give your mind to me, my son;
Let your eyes watch my ways.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲמֻקָּ֣ה זוֹנָ֑ה וּבְאֵ֥ר צָ֝רָ֗ה נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
A harlot is a deep pit;
A forbiddenbLit. “alien.” woman is a narrow well.

translations.hebrew: אַף־הִ֭יא כְּחֶ֣תֶף תֶּאֱרֹ֑ב וּ֝בוֹגְדִ֗ים בְּאָדָ֥ם תּוֹסִֽף׃
translations.english:
She too lies in wait as if for prey,
And destroys the unfaithful among men.

translations.hebrew: לְמִ֨י א֥וֹי לְמִ֪י אֲב֡וֹי לְמִ֤י (מדונים) [מִדְיָנִ֨ים ׀] לְמִ֥י שִׂ֗יחַ לְ֭מִי פְּצָעִ֣ים חִנָּ֑ם לְ֝מִ֗י חַכְלִל֥וּת עֵינָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
Who cries, “Woe!” who, “Alas!”;
Who has quarrels, who complaints;
Who has wounds without cause;
Who has bleary eyes?

translations.hebrew: לַֽמְאַחֲרִ֥ים עַל־הַיָּ֑יִן לַ֝בָּאִ֗ים לַחְקֹ֥ר מִמְסָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Those whom wine keeps till the small hours,
Those who gather to drain the cups.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֵּ֥רֶא יַּיִן֮ כִּ֤י יִתְאַ֫דָּ֥ם כִּֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן (בכיס) [בַּכּ֣וֹס] עֵינ֑וֹ יִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בְּמֵֽישָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Do not ogle that red wine
As it lends its color to the cup,
As it flows on smoothly;

translations.hebrew: אַ֭חֲרִיתוֹ כְּנָחָ֣שׁ יִשָּׁ֑ךְ וּֽכְצִפְעֹנִ֥י יַפְרִֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
In the end, it bites like a snake;
It spits like a basilisk.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֭ינֶיךָ יִרְא֣וּ זָר֑וֹת וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ יְדַבֵּ֥ר תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Your eyes will see strange sights;
Your heartcSee note to 15.28. will speak distorted things.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭הָיִיתָ כְּשֹׁכֵ֣ב בְּלֶב־יָ֑ם וּ֝כְשֹׁכֵ֗ב בְּרֹ֣אשׁ חִבֵּֽל׃
translations.english:
You will be like one lying in bed on high seas,
Like one lying dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.on top of the rigging.-d

translations.hebrew: הִכּ֥וּנִי בַל־חָלִיתִי֮ הֲלָמ֗וּנִי בַּל־יָ֫דָ֥עְתִּי מָתַ֥י אָקִ֑יץ א֝וֹסִ֗יף אֲבַקְשֶׁ֥נּוּ עֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
“They struck me, but I felt no hurt;
They beat me, but I was unaware;
As often as I wake,
I go after it again.”

translations.hebrew: אַל־תְּ֭קַנֵּא בְּאַנְשֵׁ֣י רָעָ֑ה וְאַל־תִּ֝תְאָ֗ו לִֽהְי֥וֹת אִתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Do not envy evil men;
Do not desire to be with them;

translations.hebrew: כִּי־שֹׁ֭ד יֶהְגֶּ֣ה לִבָּ֑ם וְ֝עָמָ֗ל שִׂפְתֵיהֶ֥ם תְּדַבֵּֽרְנָה׃
translations.english:
For their heartsaSee note to 15.28. talk violence,
And their lips speak mischief.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭חׇכְמָה יִבָּ֣נֶה בָּ֑יִת וּ֝בִתְבוּנָ֗ה יִתְכּוֹנָֽן׃
translations.english:
A house is built by wisdom,
And is established by understanding;

translations.hebrew: וּ֭בְדַעַת חֲדָרִ֣ים יִמָּלְא֑וּ כׇּל־ה֖וֹן יָקָ֣ר וְנָעִֽים׃
translations.english:
By knowledge are its rooms filled
With all precious and beautiful things.

translations.hebrew: גֶּבֶר־חָכָ֥ם בַּע֑וֹז וְאִֽישׁ־דַּ֝֗עַת מְאַמֶּץ־כֹּֽחַ׃
translations.english:
A wise man is strength;
A knowledgeable man exerts power;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י בְ֭תַחְבֻּלוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֣ מִלְחָמָ֑ה וּ֝תְשׁוּעָ֗ה בְּרֹ֣ב יוֹעֵֽץ׃
translations.english:
For by stratagems you wage war,
And victory comes with much planning.

translations.hebrew: רָאמ֣וֹת לֶאֱוִ֣יל חׇכְמ֑וֹת בַּ֝שַּׁ֗עַר לֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּֽיהוּ׃
translations.english:
Wisdom is too lofty for a fool;
He does not open his mouth in the gate.

translations.hebrew: מְחַשֵּׁ֥ב לְהָרֵ֑עַ ל֝֗וֹ בַּעַל־מְזִמּ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
He who lays plans to do harm
Is called by men a schemer.

translations.hebrew: זִמַּ֣ת אִוֶּ֣לֶת חַטָּ֑את וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת לְאָדָ֣ם לֵֽץ׃
translations.english:
The schemes of folly are sin,
And a scoffer is an abomination to men.

translations.hebrew: הִ֭תְרַפִּיתָ בְּי֥וֹם צָרָ֗ה צַ֣ר כֹּחֶֽכָה׃
translations.english:
If you showed yourself slack in time of trouble,
Wanting in power,

translations.hebrew: הַ֭צֵּל לְקֻחִ֣ים לַמָּ֑וֶת וּמָטִ֥ים לַ֝הֶ֗רֶג אִם־תַּחְשֽׂוֹךְ׃
translations.english:
If you refrained from rescuing those taken off to death,
Those condemned to slaughter—

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־תֹאמַ֗ר הֵן֮ לֹא־יָדַ֢עְנ֫וּ זֶ֥ה הֲֽלֹא־תֹ֘כֵ֤ן לִבּ֨וֹת ׀ הֽוּא־יָבִ֗ין וְנֹצֵ֣ר נַ֭פְשְׁךָ ה֣וּא יֵדָ֑ע וְהֵשִׁ֖יב לְאָדָ֣ם כְּפׇעֳלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
If you say, “We knew nothing of it,”
Surely He who fathoms hearts will discern [the truth],
He who watches over your life will know it,
And He will pay each man as he deserves.

translations.hebrew: אֱכׇל־בְּנִ֣י דְבַ֣שׁ כִּי־ט֑וֹב וְנֹ֥פֶת מָ֝ת֗וֹק עַל־חִכֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My son, eat honey, for it is good;
Let its sweet drops be on your palate.

translations.hebrew: כֵּ֤ן ׀ דְּעֶ֥ה חׇכְמָ֗ה לְנַ֫פְשֶׁ֥ךָ אִם־מָ֭צָאתָ וְיֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Know: such is wisdom for your soul;
If you attain it, there is a future;
Your hope will not be cut off.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֶּאֱרֹ֣ב רָ֭שָׁע לִנְוֵ֣ה צַדִּ֑יק אַֽל־תְּשַׁדֵּ֥ד רִבְצֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Wicked man! Do not lurk by the home of the righteous man;
Do no violence to his dwelling.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שֶׁ֨בַע ׀ יִפּ֣וֹל צַדִּ֣יק וָקָ֑ם וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים יִכָּשְׁל֥וּ בְרָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Seven times the righteous man falls and gets up,
While the wicked are tripped by one misfortune.

translations.hebrew: בִּנְפֹ֣ל (אויביך) [א֭וֹיִבְךָ] אַל־תִּשְׂמָ֑ח וּ֝בִכָּשְׁל֗וֹ אַל־יָגֵ֥ל לִבֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
If your enemy falls, do not exult;
If he trips, let your heart not rejoice,

translations.hebrew: פֶּן־יִרְאֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה וְרַ֣ע בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְהֵשִׁ֖יב מֵעָלָ֣יו אַפּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Lest the LORD see it and be displeased,
And avert His wrath from him.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּתְחַ֥ר בַּמְּרֵעִ֑ים אַל־תְּ֝קַנֵּ֗א בָּֽרְשָׁעִֽים׃
translations.english:
Do not be vexed by evildoers;
Do not be incensed by the wicked;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־תִהְיֶ֣ה אַחֲרִ֣ית לָרָ֑ע נֵ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For there is no future for the evil man;
The lamp of the wicked goes out.

translations.hebrew: יְרָא־אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּנִ֣י וָמֶ֑לֶךְ עִם־שׁ֝וֹנִ֗ים אַל־תִּתְעָרָֽב׃
translations.english:
Fear the LORD, my son, and the king,
And do not mix with dissenters,

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־פִ֭תְאֹם יָק֣וּם אֵידָ֑ם וּפִ֥יד שְׁ֝נֵיהֶ֗ם מִ֣י יוֹדֵֽעַ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
For disaster comes from them suddenly;
The doom both decree who can foreknow?

translations.hebrew: גַּם־אֵ֥לֶּה לַחֲכָמִ֑ים הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֖ים בְּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט בַּל־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
These also are by the sages:

It is not right to be partial in judgment.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֤מֵ֨ר ׀ לְרָשָׁע֮ צַדִּ֢יק אָ֥֫תָּה יִקְּבֻ֥הוּ עַמִּ֑ים יִזְעָמ֥וּהוּ לְאֻמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
He who says to the guilty, “You are innocent,”
Shall be cursed by peoples,
Damned by nations;

translations.hebrew: וְלַמּוֹכִיחִ֥ים יִנְעָ֑ם וַ֝עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם תָּב֥וֹא בִרְכַּת־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
But it shall go well with them who decide justly;
Blessings of good things will light upon them.

translations.hebrew: שְׂפָתַ֥יִם יִשָּׁ֑ק מֵ֝שִׁ֗יב דְּבָרִ֥ים נְכֹחִֽים׃
translations.english:
Giving a straightforward reply
Is like giving a kiss.

translations.hebrew: הָ֘כֵ֤ן בַּח֨וּץ ׀ מְלַאכְתֶּ֗ךָ וְעַתְּדָ֣הּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֣ה לָ֑ךְ אַ֝חַ֗ר וּבָנִ֥יתָ בֵיתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Put your external affairs in order,
Get ready what you have in the field,
Then build yourself a home.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֣י עֵד־חִנָּ֣ם בְּרֵעֶ֑ךָ וַ֝הֲפִתִּ֗יתָ בִּשְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Do not be a witness against your fellow without good cause;
Would you mislead with your speech?

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֹּאמַ֗ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָֽשָׂה־לִ֭י כֵּ֤ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לּ֑וֹ אָשִׁ֖יב לָאִ֣ישׁ כְּפׇעֳלֽוֹ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Do not say, “I will do to him what he did to me;
I will pay the man what he deserves.”

translations.hebrew: עַל־שְׂדֵ֣ה אִישׁ־עָצֵ֣ל עָבַ֑רְתִּי וְעַל־כֶּ֝֗רֶם אָדָ֥ם חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
I passed by the field of a lazy man,
By the vineyard of a man lacking sense.

translations.hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה עָ֘לָ֤ה כֻלּ֨וֹ ׀ קִמְּשֹׂנִ֗ים כׇּסּ֣וּ פָנָ֣יו חֲרֻלִּ֑ים וְגֶ֖דֶר אֲבָנָ֣יו נֶהֱרָֽסָה׃
translations.english:
It was all overgrown with thorns;
Its surface was covered with chickweed,
And its stone fence lay in ruins.

translations.hebrew: וָאֶחֱזֶ֣ה אָ֭נֹכִי אָשִׁ֣ית לִבִּ֑י רָ֝אִ֗יתִי לָקַ֥חְתִּי מוּסָֽר׃
translations.english:
I observed and took it to heart;
I saw it and learned a lesson.

translations.hebrew: מְעַ֣ט שֵׁ֭נוֹת מְעַ֣ט תְּנוּמ֑וֹת מְעַ֓ט ׀ חִבֻּ֖ק יָדַ֣יִם לִשְׁכָּֽב׃
translations.english:
A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber,
A bit more hugging yourself in bed,

translations.hebrew: וּבָֽא־מִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ רֵישֶׁ֑ךָ וּ֝מַחְסֹרֶ֗יךָ כְּאִ֣ישׁ מָגֵֽן׃ {פ}
translations.english:
And poverty will come bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.calling upon you,-b
And want, like a man with a shield.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־אֵ֭לֶּה מִשְׁלֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶ֝עְתִּ֗יקוּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י ׀ חִזְקִיָּ֬ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃
translations.english: These too are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of King Hezekiah of Judah copied:

translations.hebrew: כְּבֹ֣ד אֱ֭לֹהִים הַסְתֵּ֣ר דָּבָ֑ר וּכְבֹ֥ד מְ֝לָכִ֗ים חֲקֹ֣ר דָּבָֽר׃
translations.english:
It is the glory of God to conceal a matter,
And the glory of a king to plumb a matter.

translations.hebrew: שָׁמַ֣יִם לָ֭רוּם וָאָ֣רֶץ לָעֹ֑מֶק וְלֵ֥ב מְ֝לָכִ֗ים אֵ֣ין חֵֽקֶר׃
translations.english:
Like the heavens in their height, like the earth in its depth,
Is the mind of kings—unfathomable.

translations.hebrew: הָג֣וֹ סִיגִ֣ים מִכָּ֑סֶף וַיֵּצֵ֖א לַצֹּרֵ֣ף כֶּֽלִי׃
translations.english:
The dross having been separated from the silver,
A vessel emerged for the smith.

translations.hebrew: הָג֣וֹ רָ֭שָׁע לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְיִכּ֖וֹן בַּצֶּ֣דֶק כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Remove the wicked from the king’s presence,
And his throne will be established in justice.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּתְהַדַּ֥ר לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבִמְק֥וֹם גְּ֝דֹלִ֗ים אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹֽד׃
translations.english:
Do not exalt yourself in the king’s presence;
Do not stand in the place of nobles.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ט֥וֹב אֲמׇר־לְךָ֗ עֲֽלֵ֫ה־הֵ֥נָּה מֵ֭הַשְׁפִּ֣ילְךָ לִפְנֵ֣י נָדִ֑יב אֲשֶׁ֖ר רָא֣וּ עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
For it is better to be told, “Step up here,”
Than to be degraded in the presence of the great.

Do not let what your eyes have seen

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֵּצֵ֥א לָרִ֗ב מַ֫הֵ֥ר פֶּ֣ן מַה־תַּ֭עֲשֶׂה בְּאַחֲרִיתָ֑הּ בְּהַכְלִ֖ים אֹתְךָ֣ רֵעֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Be vented rashly in a quarrel;
ThinkaLit. “Lest.” of what it will effect in the end,
When your fellow puts you to shame.

translations.hebrew: רִ֭יבְךָ רִ֣יב אֶת־רֵעֶ֑ךָ וְס֖וֹד אַחֵ֣ר אַל־תְּגָֽל׃
translations.english:
Defend your right against your fellow,
But do not give away the secrets of another,

translations.hebrew: פֶּֽן־יְחַסֶּדְךָ֥ שֹׁמֵ֑עַ וְ֝דִבָּתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תָשֽׁוּב׃
translations.english:
Lest he who hears it reproach you,
And your bad repute never end.

translations.hebrew: תַּפּוּחֵ֣י זָ֭הָב בְּמַשְׂכִּיּ֣וֹת כָּ֑סֶף דָּ֝בָ֗ר דָּבֻ֥ר עַל־אׇפְנָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Like golden apples in silver showpiecesbMeaning of Heb. uncertain.
Is a phrase well turned.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֣זֶם זָ֭הָב וַחֲלִי־כָ֑תֶם מוֹכִ֥יחַ חָ֝כָ֗ם עַל־אֹ֥זֶן שֹׁמָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Like a ring of gold, a golden ornament,
Is a wise man’s reproof in a receptive ear.

translations.hebrew: כְּצִנַּת־שֶׁ֨לֶג ׀ בְּי֬וֹם קָצִ֗יר צִ֣יר נֶ֭אֱמָן לְשֹׁלְחָ֑יו וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ אֲדֹנָ֣יו יָשִֽׁיב׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Like the coldness of snow at harvesttime
Is a trusty messenger to those who send him;
He lifts his master’s spirits.

translations.hebrew: נְשִׂיאִ֣ים וְ֭רוּחַ וְגֶ֣שֶׁם אָ֑יִן אִ֥ישׁ מִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ל בְּמַתַּת־שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
Like clouds, wind—but no rain—
Is one who boasts of gifts not given.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֹ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם יְפֻתֶּ֣ה קָצִ֑ין וְלָשׁ֥וֹן רַ֝כָּ֗ה תִּשְׁבׇּר־גָּֽרֶם׃
translations.english:
Through forbearance a ruler may be won over;
A gentle tongue can break bones.

translations.hebrew: דְּבַ֣שׁ מָ֭צָאתָ אֱכֹ֣ל דַּיֶּ֑ךָּ פֶּן־תִּ֝שְׂבָּעֶ֗נּוּ וַהֲקֵאתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
If you find honey, eat only what you need,
Lest, surfeiting yourself, you throw it up.

translations.hebrew: הֹקַ֣ר רַ֭גְלְךָ מִבֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ פֶּן־יִ֝שְׂבָּעֲךָ֗ וּשְׂנֵאֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Visit your neighbor sparingly,
Lest he have his surfeit of you and loathe you.

translations.hebrew: מֵפִ֣יץ וְ֭חֶרֶב וְחֵ֣ץ שָׁנ֑וּן אִ֥ישׁ עֹנֶ֥ה בְ֝רֵעֵ֗הוּ עֵ֣ד שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
Like a club, a sword, a sharpened arrow,
Is a man who testifies falsely against his fellow.

translations.hebrew: שֵׁ֣ן רֹ֭עָה וְרֶ֣גֶל מוּעָ֑דֶת מִבְטָ֥ח בּ֝וֹגֵ֗ד בְּי֣וֹם צָרָֽה׃
translations.english:
Like a loose tooth and an unsteady leg,
Is a treacherous support in time of trouble.

translations.hebrew: מַ֥עֲדֶה־בֶּ֨גֶד ׀ בְּי֣וֹם קָ֭רָה חֹ֣מֶץ עַל־נָ֑תֶר וְשָׁ֥ר בַּ֝שִּׁרִ֗ים עַ֣ל לֶב־רָֽע׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Disrobing on a chilly day,
Like vinegar on natron,
Is one who sings songs to a sorrowful soul.

translations.hebrew: אִם־רָעֵ֣ב שֹׂ֭נַאֲךָ הַאֲכִלֵ֣הוּ לָ֑חֶם וְאִם־צָ֝מֵ֗א הַשְׁקֵ֥הוּ מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat;
If he is thirsty, give him water to drink.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י גֶחָלִ֗ים אַ֭תָּה חֹתֶ֣ה עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה יְשַׁלֶּם־לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
You will be heaping live coals on his head,
And the LORD will reward you.

translations.hebrew: ר֣וּחַ צָ֭פוֹן תְּח֣וֹלֵֽל גָּ֑שֶׁם וּפָנִ֥ים נִ֝זְעָמִ֗ים לְשׁ֣וֹן סָֽתֶר׃
translations.english:
A north wind produces rain,
And whispered words, a glowering face.

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃
translations.english:
Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better
Than a contentious woman in bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.a spacious house.-b

translations.hebrew: מַ֣יִם קָ֭רִים עַל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ עֲיֵפָ֑ה וּשְׁמוּעָ֥ה ט֝וֹבָ֗ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מֶרְחָֽק׃
translations.english:
Like cold water to a parched throat
Is good news from a distant land.

translations.hebrew: מַעְיָ֣ן נִ֭רְפָּשׂ וּמָק֣וֹר מׇשְׁחָ֑ת צַ֝דִּ֗יק מָ֣ט לִפְנֵֽי־רָשָֽׁע׃
translations.english:
Like a muddied spring, a ruined fountain,
Is a righteous man fallen before a wicked one.

translations.hebrew: אָ֘כֹ֤ל דְּבַ֣שׁ הַרְבּ֣וֹת לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְחֵ֖קֶר כְּבֹדָ֣ם כָּבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
It is not good to eat much honey,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Nor is it honorable to search for honor.-b

translations.hebrew: עִ֣יר פְּ֭רוּצָה אֵ֣ין חוֹמָ֑ה אִ֝֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵ֖ין מַעְצָ֣ר לְרוּחֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Like an open city without walls
Is a man whose temper is uncurbed.

translations.hebrew: כַּשֶּׁ֤לֶג ׀ בַּקַּ֗יִץ וְכַמָּטָ֥ר בַּקָּצִ֑יר כֵּ֤ן לֹֽא־נָאוֶ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
Like snow in summer and rain at harvesttime,
So honor is not fitting for a dullard.

translations.hebrew: כַּצִּפּ֣וֹר לָ֭נוּד כַּדְּר֣וֹר לָע֑וּף כֵּ֥ן קִֽלְלַ֥ת חִ֝נָּ֗ם (לא) [ל֣וֹ] תָבֹֽא׃
translations.english:
As a sparrow must flit and a swallow fly,
So a gratuitous curse must backfire.aKethib, “fail.”

translations.hebrew: שׁ֣וֹט לַ֭סּוּס מֶ֣תֶג לַחֲמ֑וֹר וְ֝שֵׁ֗בֶט לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃
translations.english:
A whip for a horse and a bridle for a donkey,
And a rod for the back of dullards.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּ֣עַן כְּ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּֽן־תִּשְׁוֶה־לּ֥וֹ גַם־אָֽתָּה׃
translations.english:
Do not answer a dullard in accord with his folly,
Else you will become like him.

translations.hebrew: עֲנֵ֣ה כְ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֖ה חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Answer a dullard in accord with his folly,
Else he will think himself wise.

translations.hebrew: מְקַצֶּ֣ה רַ֭גְלַיִם חָמָ֣ס שֹׁתֶ֑ה שֹׁלֵ֖חַ דְּבָרִ֣ים בְּיַד־כְּסִֽיל׃
translations.english:
He who sends a message by a dullard
Will wear out legs and bLit. “drink.”must put up with-b lawlessness.

translations.hebrew: דַּלְי֣וּ שֹׁ֭קַיִם מִפִּסֵּ֑חַ וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃
translations.english:
As legs hang limp on a cripple,
So is a proverb in the mouth of dullards.

translations.hebrew: כִּצְר֣וֹר אֶ֭בֶן בְּמַרְגֵּמָ֑ה כֵּן־נוֹתֵ֖ן לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
Like a pebble in a sling,
So is paying honor to a dullard.

translations.hebrew: ח֭וֹחַ עָלָ֣ה בְיַד־שִׁכּ֑וֹר וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃
translations.english:
As a thorn comes to the hand of a drunkard,
So a proverb to the mouth of a dullard.

translations.hebrew: רַ֥ב מְחוֹלֵֽל־כֹּ֑ל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר כְּ֝סִ֗יל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר עֹבְרִֽים׃
translations.english:
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.A master can produce anything,-c
But he who hires a dullard is as one who hires transients.-c

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭כֶלֶב שָׁ֣ב עַל־קֵא֑וֹ כְּ֝סִ֗יל שׁוֹנֶ֥ה בְאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
As a dog returns to his vomit,
So a dullard repeats his folly.

translations.hebrew: רָאִ֗יתָ אִ֭ישׁ חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָ֑יו תִּקְוָ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
If you see a man who thinks himself wise,
There is more hope for a dullard than for him.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל שַׁ֣חַל בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ אֲ֝רִ֗י בֵּ֣ין הָרְחֹבֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
A lazy man says,
“There’s a cub on the road, a lion in the squares.”

translations.hebrew: הַ֭דֶּלֶת תִּסּ֣וֹב עַל־צִירָ֑הּ וְ֝עָצֵ֗ל עַל־מִטָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The door turns on its hinge,
And the lazy man on his bed.

translations.hebrew: טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת נִ֝לְאָ֗ה לַהֲשִׁיבָ֥הּ אֶל־פִּֽיו׃
translations.english:
The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl;
He will not even bring it to his mouth.

translations.hebrew: חָכָ֣ם עָצֵ֣ל בְּעֵינָ֑יו מִ֝שִּׁבְעָ֗ה מְשִׁ֣יבֵי טָֽעַם׃
translations.english:
The lazy man thinks himself wiser
Than seven men who give good advice.

translations.hebrew: מַחֲזִ֥יק בְּאׇזְנֵי־כָ֑לֶב עֹבֵ֥ר מִ֝תְעַבֵּ֗ר עַל־רִ֥יב לֹּא־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A passerby who gets embroiled in someone else’s quarrel
Is like one who seizes a dog by its ears.

translations.hebrew: כְּֽ֭מִתְלַהְלֵהַּ הַיֹּרֶ֥ה זִקִּ֗ים חִצִּ֥ים וָמָֽוֶת׃
translations.english: Like a madmancMeaning of Heb. uncertain. scattering deadly firebrands, arrows,

translations.hebrew: כֵּֽן־אִ֭ישׁ רִמָּ֣ה אֶת־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אָמַ֗ר הֲֽלֹא־מְשַׂחֵ֥ק אָֽנִי׃
translations.english: Is one who cheats his fellow and says, “I was only joking.”

translations.hebrew: בְּאֶ֣פֶס עֵ֭צִים תִּכְבֶּה־אֵ֑שׁ וּבְאֵ֥ין נִ֝רְגָּ֗ן יִשְׁתֹּ֥ק מָדֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
For lack of wood a fire goes out,
And without a querulous man contention is stilled.

translations.hebrew: פֶּחָ֣ם לְ֭גֶחָלִים וְעֵצִ֣ים לְאֵ֑שׁ וְאִ֥ישׁ (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] לְחַרְחַר־רִֽיב׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Charcoal for embers and wood for a fire
And a contentious man for kindling strife.

translations.hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
translations.english:
The words of a querulous man are bruising;cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.
They penetrate one’s inmost parts.

translations.hebrew: כֶּ֣סֶף סִ֭יגִים מְצֻפֶּ֣ה עַל־חָ֑רֶשׂ שְׂפָתַ֖יִם דֹּלְקִ֣ים וְלֶב־רָֽע׃
translations.english:
Base silver laid over earthenware
Are ardent lips with an evil mind.

translations.hebrew: בִּ֭שְׂפָתָו יִנָּכֵ֣ר שׂוֹנֵ֑א וּ֝בְקִרְבּ֗וֹ יָשִׁ֥ית מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
An enemy dissembles with his speech,
Inwardly he harbors deceit.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יְחַנֵּ֣ן ק֭וֹלוֹ אַל־תַּאֲמֶן־בּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י שֶׁ֖בַע תּוֹעֵב֣וֹת בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Though he be fair-spoken do not trust him,
For seven abominations are in his mind.

translations.hebrew: תִּכַּסֶּ֣ה שִׂ֭נְאָה בְּמַשָּׁא֑וֹן תִּגָּלֶ֖ה רָעָת֣וֹ בְקָהָֽל׃
translations.english:
His hatred may be concealed by dissimulation,
But his evil will be exposed to public view.

translations.hebrew: כֹּֽרֶה־שַּׁ֭חַת בָּ֣הּ יִפּ֑וֹל וְג֥וֹלֵֽל אֶ֝֗בֶן אֵלָ֥יו תָּשֽׁוּב׃
translations.english:
He who digs a pit will fall in it,
And whoever rolls a stone, it will roll back on him.

translations.hebrew: לְֽשׁוֹן־שֶׁ֭קֶר יִשְׂנָ֣א דַכָּ֑יו וּפֶ֥ה חָ֝לָ֗ק יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה מִדְחֶֽה׃
translations.english:
A lying tongue hates cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.those crushed by it;-c
Smooth speech throws one down.

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־תִּ֭תְהַלֵּל בְּי֣וֹם מָחָ֑ר כִּ֤י לֹֽא־תֵ֝דַ֗ע מַה־יֵּ֥לֶד יֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Do not boast of tomorrow,
For you do not know what the day will bring.

translations.hebrew: יְהַלֶּלְךָ֣ זָ֣ר וְלֹא־פִ֑יךָ נׇ֝כְרִ֗י וְאַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Let the mouth of another praise you, not yours,
The lips of a stranger, not your own.

translations.hebrew: כֹּֽבֶד־אֶ֭בֶן וְנֵ֣טֶל הַח֑וֹל וְכַ֥עַס אֱ֝וִ֗יל כָּבֵ֥ד מִשְּׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
A stone has weight, sand is heavy,
But a fool’s vexation outweighs them both.

translations.hebrew: אַכְזְרִיּ֣וּת חֵ֭מָה וְשֶׁ֣טֶף אָ֑ף וּמִ֥י יַ֝עֲמֹ֗ד לִפְנֵ֥י קִנְאָֽה׃
translations.english:
There is the cruelty of fury, the overflowing of anger,
But who can withstand jealousy?

translations.hebrew: ט֭וֹבָה תּוֹכַ֣חַת מְגֻלָּ֑ה מֵאַהֲבָ֥ה מְסֻתָּֽרֶת׃
translations.english: Open reproof is better than concealed love.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֭אֱמָנִים פִּצְעֵ֣י אוֹהֵ֑ב וְ֝נַעְתָּר֗וֹת נְשִׁיק֥וֹת שׂוֹנֵֽא׃
translations.english:
Wounds by a loved one are long lasting;
The kisses of an enemy are profuse.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֣פֶשׁ שְׂ֭בֵעָה תָּב֣וּס נֹ֑פֶת וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ רְ֝עֵבָ֗ה כׇּל־מַ֥ר מָתֽוֹק׃
translations.english:
A sated person disdains honey,
But to a hungry man anything bitter seems sweet.

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭צִפּוֹר נוֹדֶ֣דֶת מִן־קִנָּ֑הּ כֵּֽן־אִ֝֗ישׁ נוֹדֵ֥ד מִמְּקוֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Like a sparrow wandering from its nest
Is a man who wanders from his home.

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֣מֶן וּ֭קְטֹרֶת יְשַׂמַּֽח־לֵ֑ב וּמֶ֥תֶק רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ מֵעֲצַת־נָֽפֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
Oil and incense gladden the heart,
And the sweetness of a friend is better than one’s own counsel.

translations.hebrew: רֵ֥עֲךָ֨ (ורעה) [וְרֵ֪עַ] אָבִ֡יךָ אַֽל־תַּעֲזֹ֗ב וּבֵ֥ית אָחִ֗יךָ אַל־תָּ֭בוֹא בְּי֣וֹם אֵידֶ֑ךָ ט֥וֹב שָׁכֵ֥ן קָ֝ר֗וֹב מֵאָ֥ח רָחֽוֹק׃
translations.english:
Do not desert your friend and your father’s friend;
Do not enter your brother’s house in your time of misfortune;
A close neighbor is better than a distant brother.

translations.hebrew: חֲכַ֣ם בְּ֭נִי וְשַׂמַּ֣ח לִבִּ֑י וְאָשִׁ֖יבָה חֹרְפִ֣י דָבָֽר׃
translations.english:
Get wisdom, my son, and gladden my heart,
That I may have what to answer those who taunt me.

translations.hebrew: עָר֤וּם ׀ רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה נִסְתָּ֑ר פְּ֝תָאיִ֗ם עָבְר֥וּ נֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover;
The simple kept going and paid the penalty.

translations.hebrew: קַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד נׇכְרִיָּ֣ה חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another;aOr “a stranger.”
Take it as a pledge, [for he stood surety] for an unfamiliar woman.

translations.hebrew: מְבָ֘רֵ֤ךְ רֵעֵ֨הוּ ׀ בְּק֣וֹל גָּ֭דוֹל בַּבֹּ֣קֶר הַשְׁכֵּ֑ים קְ֝לָלָ֗ה תֵּחָ֥שֶׁב לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He who greets his fellow loudly early in the morning
Shall have it reckoned to him as a curse.

translations.hebrew: דֶּ֣לֶף ט֭וֹרֵד בְּי֣וֹם סַגְרִ֑יר וְאֵ֥שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] נִשְׁתָּוָֽה׃
translations.english:
An endless dripping on a rainy day
And a contentious wife are alike;

translations.hebrew: צֹפְנֶ֥יהָ צָפַן־ר֑וּחַ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן יְמִינ֣וֹ יִקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
As soon repress her as repress the wind,
Or declare one’s right hand to be oil.

translations.hebrew: בַּרְזֶ֣ל בְּבַרְזֶ֣ל יָ֑חַד וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ יַ֣חַד פְּנֵֽי־רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
As iron sharpens iron
So a man sharpens the witbLit. “face.” of his friend.

translations.hebrew: נֹצֵ֣ר תְּ֭אֵנָה יֹאכַ֣ל פִּרְיָ֑הּ וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣יו יְכֻבָּֽד׃
translations.english:
He who tends a fig tree will enjoy its fruit,
And he who cares for his master will be honored.

translations.hebrew: כַּ֭מַּיִם הַפָּנִ֣ים לַפָּנִ֑ים כֵּ֤ן לֵֽב־הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לָאָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
As face answers to face in water,
So does one man’s heart to another.

translations.hebrew: שְׁא֣וֹל וַ֭אֲבַדֹּה לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּ֑עְנָה וְעֵינֵ֥י הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּֽעְנָה׃
translations.english:
Sheol and Abaddon cannot be satisfied,
Nor can the eyes of man be satisfied.

translations.hebrew: מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ לְפִ֣י מַהֲלָלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For silver—the crucible, for gold—the furnace,
And a man is tested by his praise.

translations.hebrew: אִ֥ם־תִּכְתּֽוֹשׁ־אֶת־הָאֱוִ֨יל ׀ בַּ֥מַּכְתֵּ֡שׁ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָ֭רִיפוֹת בַּעֱלִ֑י לֹא־תָס֥וּר מֵ֝עָלָ֗יו אִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Even if you pound the fool in a mortar
With a pestle along with grain,
His folly will not leave him.

translations.hebrew: יָדֹ֣עַ תֵּ֭דַע פְּנֵ֣י צֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁ֥ית לִ֝בְּךָ֗ לַעֲדָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Mind well the looks of your flock;
Pay attention to your herds;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א לְעוֹלָ֣ם חֹ֑סֶן וְאִם־נֵ֝֗זֶר לְד֣וֹר (דור) [וָדֽוֹר]׃
translations.english:
For property does not last forever,
Or a crown for all generations.

translations.hebrew: גָּלָ֣ה חָ֭צִיר וְנִרְאָה־דֶ֑שֶׁא וְ֝נֶאֶסְפ֗וּ עִשְּׂב֥וֹת הָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Grass vanishes, new grass appears,
And the herbage of the hills is gathered in.

translations.hebrew: כְּבָשִׂ֥ים לִלְבוּשֶׁ֑ךָ וּמְחִ֥יר שָׂ֝דֶ֗ה עַתּוּדִֽים׃
translations.english:
The lambs will provide you with clothing,
The he-goats, the price of a field.

translations.hebrew: וְדֵ֤י ׀ חֲלֵ֬ב עִזִּ֗ים לְֽ֭לַחְמְךָ לְלֶ֣חֶם בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְ֝חַיִּ֗ים לְנַעֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
The goats’ milk will suffice for your food,
The food of your household,
And the maintenance of your maids.

translations.hebrew: נָ֣סוּ וְאֵין־רֹדֵ֣ף רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים כִּכְפִ֥יר יִבְטָֽח׃
translations.english:
The wicked flee though no one gives chase,
But the righteous are as confident as a lion.

translations.hebrew: בְּפֶ֣שַֽׁע אֶ֭רֶץ רַבִּ֣ים שָׂרֶ֑יהָ וּבְאָדָ֥ם מֵבִ֥ין יֹ֝דֵ֗עַ כֵּ֣ן יַאֲרִֽיךְ׃
translations.english:
When there is rebellion in the land, many are its rulers;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.But with a man who has understanding and knowledge, stability will last.-a

translations.hebrew: גֶּֽבֶר־רָ֭שׁ וְעֹשֵׁ֣ק דַּלִּ֑ים מָטָ֥ר סֹ֝חֵ֗ף וְאֵ֣ין לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
A poor man who withholds what is due to the wretched
Is like a destructive rain that leaves no food.

translations.hebrew: עֹזְבֵ֣י ת֭וֹרָה יְהַלְל֣וּ רָשָׁ֑ע וְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י ת֝וֹרָ֗ה יִתְגָּ֥רוּ בָֽם׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Those who forsake instruction praise the wicked,
But those who heed instruction fight them.

translations.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי־רָ֭ע לֹא־יָבִ֣ינוּ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּמְבַקְשֵׁ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יָבִ֥ינוּ כֹֽל׃
translations.english:
Evil men cannot discern judgment,
But those who seek the LORD discern all things.

translations.hebrew: טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם וְה֣וּא עָשִֽׁיר׃
translations.english:
Better is a poor man who lives blamelessly
Than a rich man whose ways are crooked.

translations.hebrew: נוֹצֵ֣ר תּ֭וֹרָה בֵּ֣ן מֵבִ֑ין וְרֹעֶ֥ה ז֝וֹלְלִ֗ים יַכְלִ֥ים אָבִֽיו׃
translations.english:
An intelligent son heeds instruction,
But he who keeps company with gluttons disgraces his father.

translations.hebrew: מַרְבֶּ֣ה ה֭וֹנוֹ בְּנֶ֣שֶׁךְ (ובתרבית) [וְתַרְבִּ֑ית] לְחוֹנֵ֖ן דַּלִּ֣ים יִקְבְּצֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
He who increases his wealth by loans at discount or interest
Amasses it for one who is generous to the poor.

translations.hebrew: מֵסִ֣יר אׇ֭זְנוֹ מִשְּׁמֹ֣עַ תּוֹרָ֑ה גַּ֥ם תְּ֝פִלָּת֗וֹ תּוֹעֵבָֽה׃
translations.english:
He who turns a deaf ear to instruction—
His prayer is an abomination.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׁגֶּ֤ה יְשָׁרִ֨ים ׀ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ רָ֗ע בִּשְׁחוּת֥וֹ הֽוּא־יִפּ֑וֹל וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים יִנְחֲלוּ־טֽוֹב׃ {פ}
translations.english:
He who misleads the upright into an evil course
Will fall into his own pit,
But the blameless will prosper.

translations.hebrew: חָכָ֣ם בְּ֭עֵינָיו אִ֣ישׁ עָשִׁ֑יר וְדַ֖ל מֵבִ֣ין יַחְקְרֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
A rich man is clever in his own eyes,
But a perceptive poor man can see through him.

translations.hebrew: בַּעֲלֹ֣ץ צַ֭דִּיקִים רַבָּ֣ה תִפְאָ֑רֶת וּבְק֥וּם רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְחֻפַּ֥שׂ אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
When the righteous exult there is great glory,
But when the wicked rise up men make themselves scarce.

translations.hebrew: מְכַסֶּ֣ה פְ֭שָׁעָיו לֹ֣א יַצְלִ֑יחַ וּמוֹדֶ֖ה וְעֹזֵ֣ב יְרֻחָֽם׃
translations.english:
He who covers up his faults will not succeed;
He who confesses and gives them up will find mercy.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם מְפַחֵ֣ד תָּמִ֑יד וּמַקְשֶׁ֥ה לִ֝בּ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man who is anxious always,
But he who hardens his heart falls into misfortune.

translations.hebrew: אֲֽרִי־נֹ֭הֵם וְדֹ֣ב שׁוֹקֵ֑ק מוֹשֵׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע עַ֣ל עַם־דָּֽל׃
translations.english:
A roaring lion and a prowling bear
Is a wicked man ruling a helpless people.

translations.hebrew: נָגִ֗יד חֲסַ֣ר תְּ֭בוּנוֹת וְרַ֥ב מַעֲשַׁקּ֑וֹת (שנאי) [שֹׂ֥נֵא] בֶ֝֗צַע יַאֲרִ֥יךְ יָמִֽים׃ {פ}
translations.english:
A prince who lacks understanding is very oppressive;
He who spurns ill-gotten gains will live long.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭<small>דָ</small>ם עָשֻׁ֣ק בְּדַם־נָ֑פֶשׁ עַד־בּ֥וֹר יָ֝נ֗וּס אַל־יִתְמְכוּ־בֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A man oppressed by bloodguilt will flee to a pit;
Let none give him support.

translations.hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ תָּ֭מִים יִוָּשֵׁ֑עַ וְנֶעְקַ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם יִפּ֥וֹל בְּאֶחָֽת׃
translations.english:
He who lives blamelessly will be delivered,
But he who is crooked in his ways will fall all at once.

translations.hebrew: עֹבֵ֣ד אַ֭דְמָתוֹ יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָ֑חֶם וּמְרַדֵּ֥ף רֵ֝יקִ֗ים יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־רִֽישׁ׃
translations.english:
He who tills his land will have food in plenty,
But he who pursues vanities will have poverty in plenty.

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ אֱ֭מוּנוֹת רַב־בְּרָכ֑וֹת וְאָ֥ץ לְ֝הַעֲשִׁ֗יר לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃
translations.english:
A dependable man will receive many blessings,
But one in a hurry to get rich will not go unpunished.

translations.hebrew: הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֥ים לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְעַל־פַּת־לֶ֝֗חֶם יִפְשַׁע־גָּֽבֶר׃
translations.english:
To be partial is not right;
A man may do wrong for a piece of bread.

translations.hebrew: נִ֥בְהָֽל־לַה֗וֹן אִ֭ישׁ רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְלֹא־יֵ֝דַ֗ע כִּי־חֶ֥סֶר יְבֹאֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
A miserly man runs after wealth;
He does not realize that loss will overtake it.

translations.hebrew: מ֘וֹכִ֤יחַ אָדָ֣ם אַ֭חֲרַי חֵ֣ן יִמְצָ֑א מִֽמַּחֲלִ֥יק לָשֽׁוֹן׃
translations.english:
He who reproves a man will in the end
Find more favor than he who flatters him.

translations.hebrew: גּוֹזֵ֤ל ׀ אָ֘בִ֤יו וְאִמּ֗וֹ וְאֹמֵ֥ר אֵֽין־פָּ֑שַׁע חָבֵ֥ר ה֝֗וּא לְאִ֣ישׁ מַשְׁחִֽית׃
