translations.english:
He who robs his father and mother and says, “It is no offense,”
Is a companion to vandals.

translations.hebrew: רְחַב־נֶ֭פֶשׁ יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וּבֹטֵ֖חַ עַל־יְהֹוָ֣ה יְדֻשָּֽׁן׃
translations.english:
A greedy man provokes quarrels,
But he who trusts the LORD shall enjoy prosperity.

translations.hebrew: בּוֹטֵ֣חַ בְּ֭לִבּוֹ ה֣וּא כְסִ֑יל וְהוֹלֵ֥ךְ בְּ֝חׇכְמָ֗ה ה֣וּא יִמָּלֵֽט׃
translations.english:
He who trusts his own instinct is a dullard,
But he who lives by wisdom shall escape.

translations.hebrew: נוֹתֵ֣ן לָ֭רָשׁ אֵ֣ין מַחְס֑וֹר וּמַעְלִ֥ים עֵ֝ינָ֗יו רַב־מְאֵרֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
He who gives to the poor will not be in want,
But he who shuts his eyes will be roundly cursed.

translations.hebrew: בְּק֣וּם רְ֭שָׁעִים יִסָּתֵ֣ר אָדָ֑ם וּ֝בְאׇבְדָ֗ם יִרְבּ֥וּ צַדִּיקִֽים׃
translations.english:
When the wicked rise up, men go into hiding,
But when they perish the righteous increase.

translations.hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ תּ֭וֹכָחוֹת מַקְשֶׁה־עֹ֑רֶף פֶּ֥תַע יִ֝שָּׁבֵ֗ר וְאֵ֣ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
One oft reproved may become stiffnecked,
But he will be suddenly broken beyond repair.

translations.hebrew: בִּרְב֣וֹת צַ֭דִּיקִים יִשְׂמַ֣ח הָעָ֑ם וּבִמְשֹׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע יֵאָ֥נַֽח עָֽם׃
translations.english:
When the righteous become great the people rejoice,
But when the wicked dominate the people groan.

translations.hebrew: אִישׁ־אֹהֵ֣ב חׇ֭כְמָה יְשַׂמַּ֣ח אָבִ֑יו וְרֹעֶ֥ה ז֝וֹנ֗וֹת יְאַבֶּד־הֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father,
But he who keeps company with harlots will lose his wealth.

translations.hebrew: מֶ֗לֶךְ בְּ֭מִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִ֣יד אָ֑רֶץ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּרוּמ֣וֹת יֶהֶרְסֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
By justice a king sustains the land,
But a fraudulent man tears it down.

translations.hebrew: גֶּ֭בֶר מַחֲלִ֣יק עַל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ רֶ֝֗שֶׁת פּוֹרֵ֥שׂ עַל־פְּעָמָֽיו׃
translations.english:
A man who flatters his fellow
Spreads a net for his feet.

translations.hebrew: בְּפֶ֤שַֽׁע אִ֣ישׁ רָ֣ע מוֹקֵ֑שׁ וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק יָר֥וּן וְשָׂמֵֽחַ׃
translations.english:
An evil man’s offenses are a trap for himself,
But the righteous sing out joyously.

translations.hebrew: יֹדֵ֣עַ צַ֭דִּיק דִּ֣ין דַּלִּ֑ים רָ֝שָׁ֗ע לֹא־יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃
translations.english:
A righteous man is concerned with the cause of the wretched;
A wicked man cannot understand such concern.

translations.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י לָ֭צוֹן יָפִ֣יחוּ קִרְיָ֑ה וַ֝חֲכָמִ֗ים יָשִׁ֥יבוּ אָֽף׃
translations.english:
Scoffers inflame a city,
But the wise allay anger.

translations.hebrew: אִֽישׁ־חָכָ֗ם נִ֭שְׁפָּט אֶת־אִ֣ישׁ אֱוִ֑יל וְרָגַ֥ז וְ֝שָׂחַ֗ק וְאֵ֣ין נָֽחַת׃
translations.english:
When a wise man enters into litigation with a fool
There is ranting and ridicule, but no satisfaction.

translations.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י דָ֭מִים יִשְׂנְאוּ־תָ֑ם וִ֝ישָׁרִ֗ים יְבַקְשׁ֥וּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
Bloodthirsty men detest the blameless,
But the upright seek them out.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־ר֭וּחוֹ יוֹצִ֣יא כְסִ֑יל וְ֝חָכָ֗ם בְּאָח֥וֹר יְשַׁבְּחֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
A dullard vents all his rage,
But a wise man calms it down.

translations.hebrew: מֹ֭שֵׁל מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־דְּבַר־שָׁ֑קֶר כׇּֽל־מְשָׁרְתָ֥יו רְשָׁעִֽים׃
translations.english:
A ruler who listens to lies,
All his ministers will be wicked.

translations.hebrew: רָ֤שׁ וְאִ֣ישׁ תְּכָכִ֣ים נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ מֵ֤אִיר־עֵינֵ֖י שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
A poor man and a fraudulent man meet;
The LORD gives luster to the eyes of both.

translations.hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ שׁוֹפֵ֣ט בֶּאֱמֶ֣ת דַּלִּ֑ים כִּ֝סְא֗וֹ לָעַ֥ד יִכּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
A king who judges the wretched honestly,
His throne will be established forever.

translations.hebrew: שֵׁ֣בֶט וְ֭תוֹכַחַת יִתֵּ֣ן חׇכְמָ֑ה וְנַ֥עַר מְ֝שֻׁלָּ֗ח מֵבִ֥ישׁ אִמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Rod and reproof produce wisdom,
But a lad out of control is a disgrace to his mother.

translations.hebrew: בִּרְב֣וֹת רְ֭שָׁעִים יִרְבֶּה־פָּ֑שַׁע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים בְּֽמַפַּלְתָּ֥ם יִרְאֽוּ׃
translations.english:
When the wicked increase, offenses increase,
But the righteous will see their downfall.

translations.hebrew: יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ וִינִיחֶ֑ךָ וְיִתֵּ֖ן מַעֲדַנִּ֣ים לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Discipline your son and he will give you peace;
He will gratify you with dainties.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֵ֣ין חָ֭זוֹן יִפָּ֣רַֽע עָ֑ם וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹרָ֣ה אַשְׁרֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
For lack of vision a people lose restraint,
But happy is he who heeds instruction.

translations.hebrew: בִּ֭דְבָרִים לֹא־יִוָּ֣סֶר עָ֑בֶד כִּי־יָ֝בִ֗ין וְאֵ֣ין מַעֲנֶֽה׃
translations.english:
A slave cannot be disciplined by words;
Though he may comprehend, he does not respond.

translations.hebrew: חָזִ֗יתָ אִ֭ישׁ אָ֣ץ בִּדְבָרָ֑יו תִּקְוָ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
If you see a man hasty in speech,
There is more hope for a fool than for him.

translations.hebrew: מְפַנֵּ֣ק מִנֹּ֣עַר עַבְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝אַחֲרִית֗וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה מָנֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
A slave pampered from youth
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Will come to a bad end.-a

translations.hebrew: אִֽישׁ־אַ֭ף יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וּבַ֖עַל חֵמָ֣ה רַב־פָּֽשַׁע׃
translations.english:
An angry man provokes a quarrel;
A hot-tempered man commits many offenses.

translations.hebrew: גַּאֲוַ֣ת אָ֭דָם תַּשְׁפִּילֶ֑נּוּ וּשְׁפַל־ר֝֗וּחַ יִתְמֹ֥ךְ כָּבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
A man’s pride will humiliate him,
But a humble man will obtain honor.

translations.hebrew: חוֹלֵ֣ק עִם־גַּ֭נָּב שׂוֹנֵ֣א נַפְשׁ֑וֹ אָלָ֥ה יִ֝שְׁמַ֗ע וְלֹ֣א יַגִּֽיד׃
translations.english:
He who shares with a thief is his own enemy;
He hears the imprecation and does not tell.bCf. Lev. 5.1.

translations.hebrew: חֶרְדַּ֣ת אָ֭דָם יִתֵּ֣ן מוֹקֵ֑שׁ וּבוֹטֵ֖חַ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה יְשֻׂגָּֽב׃
translations.english:
A man’s fears become a trap for him,
But he who trusts in the LORD shall be safeguarded.

translations.hebrew: רַ֭בִּים מְבַקְשִׁ֣ים פְּנֵֽי־מוֹשֵׁ֑ל וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה מִשְׁפַּט־אִֽישׁ׃
translations.english:
Many seek audience with a ruler,
But it is from the LORD that a man gets justice.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת צַ֭דִּיקִים אִ֣ישׁ עָ֑וֶל וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע יְשַׁר־דָּֽרֶךְ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
The unjust man is an abomination to the righteous,
And he whose way is straight is an abomination to the wicked.

translations.hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֤י ׀ אָג֥וּר בִּן־יָקֶ֗ה הַמַּ֫שָּׂ֥א נְאֻ֣ם הַ֭גֶּבֶר לְאִיתִיאֵ֑ל לְאִ֖יתִיאֵ֣ל וְאֻכָֽל׃
translations.english: The words of Agur son of Jakeh, [man of] Massa; The speech of the man to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י בַ֣עַר אָנֹכִ֣י מֵאִ֑ישׁ וְלֹֽא־בִינַ֖ת אָדָ֣ם לִֽי׃
translations.english:
I am brutish, less than a man;
I lack common sense.

translations.hebrew: וְלֹֽא־לָמַ֥דְתִּי חׇכְמָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת קְדֹשִׁ֣ים אֵדָֽע׃
translations.english:
I have not learned wisdom,
Nor do I possess knowledge of the Holy One.

translations.hebrew: מִ֤י עָלָֽה־שָׁמַ֨יִם ׀ וַיֵּרַ֡ד מִ֤י אָֽסַף־ר֨וּחַ ׀ בְּחׇפְנָ֡יו מִ֤י צָֽרַר־מַ֨יִם ׀ בַּשִּׂמְלָ֗ה מִ֭י הֵקִ֣ים כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ מַה־שְּׁמ֥וֹ וּמַֽה־שֶּׁם־בְּ֝נ֗וֹ כִּ֣י תֵדָֽע׃
translations.english:
Who has ascended heaven and come down?
Who has gathered up the wind in the hollow of his hand?
Who has wrapped the waters in his garment?
Who has established all the extremities of the earth?
What is his name or his son’s name, if you know it?

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־אִמְרַ֣ת אֱל֣וֹהַּ צְרוּפָ֑ה מָגֵ֥ן ה֝֗וּא לַחֹסִ֥ים בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Every word of God is pure,
A shield to those who take refuge in Him.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תּ֥וֹסְףְּ עַל־דְּבָרָ֑יו פֶּן־יוֹכִ֖יחַ בְּךָ֣ וְנִכְזָֽבְתָּ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Do not add to His words,
Lest He indict you and you be proved a liar.

translations.hebrew: שְׁ֭תַּיִם שָׁאַ֣לְתִּי מֵאִתָּ֑ךְ אַל־תִּמְנַ֥ע מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי בְּטֶ֣רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
translations.english: Two things I ask of You; do not deny them to me before I die:

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֤וְא ׀ וּֽדְבַר־כָּזָ֡ב הַרְחֵ֬ק מִמֶּ֗נִּי רֵ֣אשׁ וָ֭עֹשֶׁר אַל־תִּֽתֶּן־לִ֑י הַ֝טְרִיפֵ֗נִי לֶ֣חֶם חֻקִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Keep lies and false words far from me;
Give me neither poverty nor riches,
But provide me with my daily bread,

translations.hebrew: פֶּ֥ן־אֶשְׂבַּ֨ע ׀ וְכִחַשְׁתִּי֮ וְאָמַ֗רְתִּי מִ֥י־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה וּפֶֽן־אִוָּרֵ֥שׁ וְגָנַ֑בְתִּי וְ֝תָפַ֗שְׂתִּי שֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהָֽי׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Lest, being sated, I renounce, saying,
“Who is the LORD?”
Or, being impoverished, I take to theft
And profaneaMeaning of Heb. uncertain. the name of my God.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּלְשֵׁ֣ן עֶ֭בֶד אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֑ו פֶּֽן־יְקַלֶּלְךָ֥ וְאָשָֽׁמְתָּ׃
translations.english:
Do not inform on a slave to his master,
Lest he curse you and you incur guilt.

translations.hebrew: דּ֭וֹר אָבִ֣יו יְקַלֵּ֑ל וְאֶת־אִ֝מּ֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְבָרֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
There is a breed of men that brings a curse on its fathers
And brings no blessing to its mothers,

translations.hebrew: דּ֭וֹר טָה֣וֹר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וּ֝מִצֹּאָת֗וֹ לֹ֣א רֻחָֽץ׃
translations.english:
A breed that thinks itself pure,
Though it is not washed of its filth;

translations.hebrew: דּ֭וֹר מָה־רָמ֣וּ עֵינָ֑יו וְ֝עַפְעַפָּ֗יו יִנָּשֵֽׂאוּ׃
translations.english: A breed so haughty of bearing, so supercilious;

translations.hebrew: דּ֤וֹר ׀ חֲרָב֣וֹת שִׁנָּיו֮ וּֽמַאֲכָל֢וֹת מְֽתַלְּעֹ֫תָ֥יו לֶאֱכֹ֣ל עֲנִיִּ֣ים מֵאֶ֑רֶץ וְ֝אֶבְיוֹנִ֗ים מֵאָדָֽם׃ {פ}
translations.english:
A breed whose teeth are swords,
Whose jaws are knives,
Ready to devour the poor of the land,
The needy among men.

translations.hebrew: לַ֥עֲלוּקָ֨ה ׀ שְׁתֵּ֥י בָנוֹת֮ הַ֤ב ׀ הַ֥֫ב שָׁל֣וֹשׁ הֵ֭נָּה לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּ֑עְנָה אַ֝רְבַּ֗ע לֹא־אָ֥מְרוּ הֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
The leech has two daughters, “Give!” and “Give!”
Three things are insatiable;
Four never say, “Enough!”:

translations.hebrew: שְׁאוֹל֮ וְעֹ֢צֶ֫ר רָ֥חַם אֶ֭רֶץ לֹא־שָׂ֣בְעָה מַּ֑יִם וְ֝אֵ֗שׁ לֹא־אָ֥מְרָה הֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Sheol, a barren womb,
Earth that cannot get enough water,
And fire which never says, “Enough!”

translations.hebrew: עַ֤יִן ׀ תִּ֥לְעַ֣ג לְאָב֮ וְתָבֻ֢ז לִֽיקְּהַ֫ת־אֵ֥ם יִקְּר֥וּהָ עֹֽרְבֵי־נַ֑חַל וְֽיֹאכְל֥וּהָ בְנֵי־נָֽשֶׁר׃ {פ}
translations.english:
The eye that mocks a father
And disdains the homage due a mother—
The ravens of the brook will gouge it out,
Young eagles will devour it.

translations.hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה הֵ֭מָּה נִפְלְא֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נִּי (וארבע) [וְ֝אַרְבָּעָ֗ה] לֹ֣א יְדַעְתִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Three things are beyond me;
Four I cannot fathom:

translations.hebrew: דֶּ֤רֶךְ הַנֶּ֨שֶׁר ׀ בַּשָּׁמַיִם֮ דֶּ֥רֶךְ נָחָ֗שׁ עֲלֵ֫י־צ֥וּר דֶּרֶךְ־אֳנִיָּ֥ה בְלֶב־יָ֑ם וְדֶ֖רֶךְ גֶּ֣בֶר בְּעַלְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
How an eagle makes its way over the sky;
How a snake makes its way over a rock;
How a ship makes its way through the high seas;
How a man has his way with a maiden.

translations.hebrew: כֵּ֤ן ׀ דֶּ֥רֶךְ אִשָּׁ֗ה מְנָ֫אָ֥פֶת אָ֭כְלָה וּמָ֣חֲתָה פִ֑יהָ וְ֝אָמְרָ֗ה לֹא־פָעַ֥לְתִּי אָֽוֶן׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Such is the way of an adulteress:
She eats, wipes her mouth,
And says, “I have done no wrong.”

translations.hebrew: תַּ֣חַת שָׁ֭לוֹשׁ רָ֣גְזָה אֶ֑רֶץ וְתַ֥חַת אַ֝רְבַּ֗ע לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל שְׂאֵֽת׃
translations.english:
The earth shudders at three things,
At four which it cannot bear:

translations.hebrew: תַּֽחַת־עֶ֭בֶד כִּ֣י יִמְל֑וֹךְ וְ֝נָבָ֗ל כִּ֣י יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
A slave who becomes king;
A scoundrel sated with food;

translations.hebrew: תַּ֣חַת שְׂ֭נוּאָה כִּ֣י תִבָּעֵ֑ל וְ֝שִׁפְחָ֗ה כִּֽי־תִירַ֥שׁ גְּבִרְתָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
A loathsome woman who gets married;
A slave-girl who supplants her mistress.

translations.hebrew: אַרְבָּ֣עָה הֵ֭ם קְטַנֵּי־אָ֑רֶץ וְ֝הֵ֗מָּה חֲכָמִ֥ים מְחֻכָּמִֽים׃
translations.english:
Four are among the tiniest on earth,
Yet they are the wisest of the wise:

translations.hebrew: הַ֭נְּמָלִים עַ֣ם לֹא־עָ֑ז וַיָּכִ֖ינוּ בַקַּ֣יִץ לַחְמָֽם׃
translations.english:
Ants are a folk without power,
Yet they prepare food for themselves in summer;

translations.hebrew: שְׁ֭פַנִּים עַ֣ם לֹא־עָצ֑וּם וַיָּשִׂ֖ימוּ בַסֶּ֣לַע בֵּיתָֽם׃
translations.english:
The badger is a folk without strength,
Yet it makes its home in the rock;

translations.hebrew: מֶ֭לֶךְ אֵ֣ין לָאַרְבֶּ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֖א חֹצֵ֣ץ כֻּלּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The locusts have no king,
Yet they all march forth in formation;

translations.hebrew: שְׂ֭מָמִית בְּיָדַ֣יִם תְּתַפֵּ֑שׂ וְ֝הִ֗יא בְּהֵ֣יכְלֵי מֶֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
translations.english:
You can catch the lizardbOr “spider.” in your hand,
Yet it is found in royal palaces.

translations.hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה הֵ֭מָּה מֵיטִ֣יבֵי צָ֑עַד וְ֝אַרְבָּעָ֗ה מֵיטִ֥בֵי לָֽכֶת׃
translations.english:
There are three that are stately of stride,
Four that carry themselves well:

translations.hebrew: לַ֭יִשׁ גִּבּ֣וֹר בַּבְּהֵמָ֑ה וְלֹא־יָ֝שׁ֗וּב מִפְּנֵי־כֹֽל׃
translations.english:
The lion is mightiest among the beasts,
And recoils before none;

translations.hebrew: זַרְזִ֣יר מׇתְנַ֣יִם אוֹ־תָ֑יִשׁ וּ֝מֶ֗לֶךְ אַלְק֥וּם עִמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The greyhound, the he-goat,
The king whom none dares resist.-a

translations.hebrew: אִם־נָבַ֥לְתָּ בְהִתְנַשֵּׂ֑א וְאִם־זַ֝מּ֗וֹתָ יָ֣ד לְפֶֽה׃
translations.english:
If you have been scandalously arrogant,
If you have been a schemer,
Then clap your hand to your mouth.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י מִ֪יץ חָלָ֡ב י֘וֹצִ֤יא חֶמְאָ֗ה וּֽמִיץ־אַ֭ף י֣וֹצִיא דָ֑ם וּמִ֥יץ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם י֣וֹצִיא רִֽיב׃ {פ}
translations.english:
As milk under pressure produces butter,
And a nose under pressure produces blood,
So patience under pressure produces strife.

translations.hebrew: דִּ֭בְרֵי לְמוּאֵ֣ל מֶ֑לֶךְ מַ֝שָּׂ֗א אֲֽשֶׁר־יִסְּרַ֥תּוּ אִמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english: The words of Lemuel, king of Massa, with which his mother admonished him:

translations.hebrew: מַה־בְּ֭רִי וּמַֽה־בַּר־בִּטְנִ֑י וּ֝מֶ֗ה בַּר־נְדָרָֽי׃
translations.english:
No, my son!
No, O son of my womb!
No, O son of my vows!

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן לַנָּשִׁ֣ים חֵילֶ֑ךָ וּ֝דְרָכֶ֗יךָ לַֽמְח֥וֹת מְלָכִֽין׃
translations.english:
Do not give your strength to women,
Your vigor,aLit. “ways.” bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.to those who destroy kings.-b

translations.hebrew: אַ֤ל לַֽמְלָכִ֨ים ׀ לְֽמוֹאֵ֗ל אַ֣ל לַֽמְלָכִ֣ים שְׁתוֹ־יָ֑יִן וּ֝לְרוֹזְנִ֗ים (או) [אֵ֣י] שֵׁכָֽר׃
translations.english:
Wine is not for kings, O Lemuel;
Not for kings to drink,
Nor any strong drink for princes,

translations.hebrew: פֶּן־יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח מְחֻקָּ֑ק וִ֝ישַׁנֶּ֗ה דִּ֣ין כׇּל־בְּנֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Lest they drink and forget what has been ordained,
And infringe on the rights of the poor.

translations.hebrew: תְּנוּ־שֵׁכָ֥ר לְאוֹבֵ֑ד וְ֝יַ֗יִן לְמָ֣רֵי נָֽפֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
Give strong drink to the hapless
And wine to the embittered.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח רִישׁ֑וֹ וַ֝עֲמָל֗וֹ לֹ֣א יִזְכׇּר־עֽוֹד׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Let them drink and forget their poverty,
And put their troubles out of mind.

translations.hebrew: פְּתַח־פִּ֥יךָ לְאִלֵּ֑ם אֶל־דִּ֝֗ין כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י חֲלֽוֹף׃
translations.english:
Speak up for the dumb,
For the rights of all the unfortunate.

translations.hebrew: פְּתַח־פִּ֥יךָ שְׁפׇט־צֶ֑דֶק וְ֝דִ֗ין עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְיֽוֹן׃ {פ}
translations.english:
Speak up, judge righteously,
Champion the poor and the needy.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽשֶׁת־חַ֭יִל מִ֣י יִמְצָ֑א וְרָחֹ֖ק מִפְּנִינִ֣ים מִכְרָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
What a rare find is a capable wife!
Her worth is far beyond that of rubies.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֣טַח בָּ֭הּ לֵ֣ב בַּעְלָ֑הּ וְ֝שָׁלָ֗ל לֹ֣א יֶחְסָֽר׃
translations.english:
Her husband puts his confidence in her,
And lacks no good thing.

translations.hebrew: גְּמָלַ֣תְהוּ ט֣וֹב וְלֹא־רָ֑ע כֹּ֝֗ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
She is good to him, never bad,
All the days of her life.

translations.hebrew: דָּ֭רְשָׁה צֶ֣מֶר וּפִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַ֝תַּ֗עַשׂ בְּחֵ֣פֶץ כַּפֶּֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
She looks for wool and flax,
And sets her hand to them with a will.

translations.hebrew: הָ֭יְתָה כׇּאֳנִיּ֣וֹת סוֹחֵ֑ר מִ֝מֶּרְחָ֗ק תָּבִ֥יא לַחְמָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
She is like a merchant fleet,
Bringing her food from afar.

translations.hebrew: וַתָּ֤קׇם ׀ בְּע֬וֹד לַ֗יְלָה וַתִּתֵּ֣ן טֶ֣רֶף לְבֵיתָ֑הּ וְ֝חֹ֗ק לְנַעֲרֹתֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
She rises while it is still night,
And supplies provisions for her household,
The daily fare of her maids.

translations.hebrew: זָמְמָ֣ה שָׂ֭דֶה וַתִּקָּחֵ֑הוּ מִפְּרִ֥י כַ֝פֶּ֗יהָ (נטע) [נָ֣טְעָה] כָּֽרֶם׃
translations.english:
She sets her mind on an estate and acquires it;
She plants a vineyard by her own labors.

translations.hebrew: חָֽגְרָ֣ה בְע֣וֹז מׇתְנֶ֑יהָ וַ֝תְּאַמֵּ֗ץ זְרוֹעֹתֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
She girds herself with strength,
cLit. “And exerts her arms.”And performs her tasks with vigor.-c

translations.hebrew: טָ֭עֲמָה כִּי־ט֣וֹב סַחְרָ֑הּ לֹא־יִכְבֶּ֖ה (בליל) [בַלַּ֣יְלָה] נֵרָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
She seesdLit. “tastes.” that her business thrives;
Her lamp never goes out at night.

translations.hebrew: יָ֭דֶיהָ שִׁלְּחָ֣ה בַכִּישׁ֑וֹר וְ֝כַפֶּ֗יהָ תָּ֣מְכוּ פָֽלֶךְ׃
translations.english:
She sets her hand to the distaff;
Her fingers work the spindle.

translations.hebrew: כַּ֭פָּהּ פָּֽרְשָׂ֣ה לֶעָנִ֑י וְ֝יָדֶ֗יהָ שִׁלְּחָ֥ה לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
She gives generously to the poor;
Her hands are stretched out to the needy.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־תִירָ֣א לְבֵיתָ֣הּ מִשָּׁ֑לֶג כִּ֥י כׇל־בֵּ֝יתָ֗הּ לָבֻ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
translations.english:
She is not worried for her household because of snow,
For her whole household is dressed in crimson.

translations.hebrew: מַרְבַדִּ֥ים עָֽשְׂתָה־לָּ֑הּ שֵׁ֖שׁ וְאַרְגָּמָ֣ן לְבוּשָֽׁהּ׃
translations.english:
She makes covers for herself;
Her clothing is linen and purple.

translations.hebrew: נוֹדָ֣ע בַּשְּׁעָרִ֣ים בַּעְלָ֑הּ בְּ֝שִׁבְתּ֗וֹ עִם־זִקְנֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Her husband is prominent in the gates,
As he sits among the elders of the land.

translations.hebrew: סָדִ֣ין עָ֭שְׂתָה וַתִּמְכֹּ֑ר וַ֝חֲג֗וֹר נָתְנָ֥ה לַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽי׃
translations.english:
She makes cloth and sells it,
And offers a girdle to the merchant.

translations.hebrew: עֹז־וְהָדָ֥ר לְבוּשָׁ֑הּ וַ֝תִּשְׂחַ֗ק לְי֣וֹם אַחֲרֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
She is clothed with strength and splendor;
She looks to the future cheerfully.

translations.hebrew: פִּ֭יהָ פָּתְחָ֣ה בְחׇכְמָ֑ה וְת֥וֹרַת חֶ֝֗סֶד עַל־לְשׁוֹנָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Her mouth is full of wisdom,
Her tongue with kindly teaching.

translations.hebrew: צ֭וֹפִיָּה (הילכות) [הֲלִיכ֣וֹת] בֵּיתָ֑הּ וְלֶ֥חֶם עַ֝צְל֗וּת לֹ֣א תֹאכֵֽל׃
translations.english:
She oversees the activities of her household
And never eats the bread of idleness.

translations.hebrew: קָ֣מוּ בָ֭נֶיהָ וַֽיְאַשְּׁר֑וּהָ בַּ֝עְלָ֗הּ וַֽיְהַלְלָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Her children declare her happy;
Her husband praises her,

translations.hebrew: רַבּ֣וֹת בָּ֭נוֹת עָ֣שׂוּ חָ֑יִל וְ֝אַ֗תְּ עָלִ֥ית עַל־כֻּלָּֽנָה׃
translations.english:
“Many women have done well,
But you surpass them all.”

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֣קֶר הַ֭חֵן וְהֶ֣בֶל הַיֹּ֑פִי אִשָּׁ֥ה יִרְאַת־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הִ֣יא תִתְהַלָּֽל׃
translations.english:
Grace is deceptive,
Beauty is illusory;
It is for her fear of the LORD
That a woman is to be praised.

translations.hebrew: תְּנוּ־לָ֭הּ מִפְּרִ֣י יָדֶ֑יהָ וִיהַלְל֖וּהָ בַשְּׁעָרִ֣ים מַֽעֲשֶֽׂיהָ׃
translations.english:
Extol her for the fruit of her hand,
And let her works praise her in the gates.
